review.title: Affordable for a Reason in SF
review.reviewText: Overall my hotel experience at the Hotel Mark Twain was pleasant. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. The theme of the hotel is a little Pinterest-y but very fun and stylish. The lobby was under construction while I was there but it created no noise or cleanliness issues that bothered me. The biggest warning I will give about the place is that it is right on the brink of the most dangerous part of town. We walked not even a full street south to get on the bus at 8pm and passed an entire homeless camp sleeping on the street (Ellis). We didn't make it a full city block before we had police officers stop us and offer to just drive us to our destination because we were in such a dangerous part of town they said. Up until that point we had only walked north of the hotel and had not noticed anything that scary. But not even a block away is a church and many community resources so the homeless (and crime/drugs that can often accompany them) were pretty much swarming around the streets very close to the hotel. Definitely something I wish I had known before I stayed there.

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText: The room is quite small understandable and the bathroom, but the worst part is the bathroom shower is clogged so I have to take a bath with water in my ankle and the bed sheets,  smellls so bad, as if they dont really wash it , really stinks. So on that night I decided to cancel my second night and finished my tour in the city and go home in LA the next day.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Bad area
review.reviewText: We ended up canceling this hotel day of and I feel terrible writing a bad review because the staff was so friendly and the rooms online looked wonderful but the area is bad news. The tenderloin district unfortunately is a bad part of SF. When we arrived at the hotel homeless people lined the entire block around the hotel and there weren't many people just walking around the area. we asked some locals in a cafe about the district and their reaction was that it's not the safest place especially at night. Again the staff at the hotel was so nice and the place looked great online but no one ever mentioned the surrounding area was so rough.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
Like many other reviewers note, this is certainly a noisy hotel with thin walls and not for those who need a quiet atmosphere to sleep. It's an older building that has been renovated but still has some original touches like crown molding and interesting floor plans. Our "deluxe" King room had a sizable walk-in closet which was a nice feature you don't often get in modern hotels.

Hotel is within walking distance to Union Square and Market Street so it's easy to get to public transportation and there are many restaurants and businesses nearby. The neighborhood borders the Tenderloin so it can be sketchy and surprising to those uninitiated to that area of San Francisco. 

Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would happily book again the next time we are in the City.

My check-in was somewhat complicated due to my stay being half-work, half-vacation, but the staff was helpful and accommodating.  They were able to let me keep the same room for the duration of my stay despite my split reservation.  Great location close to Market Street, shopping, and public transit.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are clean, comfortable, and fairly priced for the area.  Friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Tired hotel that could be a gem - but isn't
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is great but it is sadly in need of a major update.  I actually like the charm and look of the older hotels but do require reasonable facilities and services if I'm paying a high rate.  The hotel is not cheap and I expected a reasonable value for my money but did not get it.  There are signs in the hotel saying there is renovation going on but I could not see anything being done.  Room is spacious enough.  Bathroom is super tiny but OK.  No real place to use as a desk (I'm a business traveler).  Very few channel choices on the TV (even some of the major networks were missing), some lights not working etc.  I try not to be picky about hotels but this one needs help and is off my list.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs serious update if going to be a high-dollar hotel.

review.reviewText: Hotel is extremely run down, rooms were small, bathrooms really uncomfortable. It was really hard to brush your teeth as sinks were tiny and under a weird shelf. You had to bend over to spit the water out. Bizarre. Pretty bad neighborhood out there as well and breakfast was a joke. They served coffee, water, orange juice, hard boiled eggs (no condiments of any kind), yogurts and small pastries. I've never seen breakfast smaller than that.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Disappointed in this hotel.  Not worth the cost.
review.reviewText:
I chose the Mark Twain because the location is very good, and it had a three star or better rating on some of the Internet travel sites.The evening of our arrival there was no heat in the room.  After talking with the front desk staff and following their instructions, we still had no heat.  They assured me that they would check the boiler room, and we would have heat.  We did not get any that night. I could see that there were some significant renovations and painting going on on the main floor, but was surprised to find it extended to the floor we were on.  Every time we waited for the elevator it was cold and windy due the the windows left open wide to mitigate the smell of the fresh paint around the elevator door and adjacent window.On the day of our departure, the trim around the door to our room was being painted.  That made it difficult to get the luggage and ourselves through the door without coming into contact with the fresh black paint.
I am sure the improvements will be very nice when finished.  However, all things considered, I am surprised that the hotel was accepting guests during the renovations.  As a frequent traveler, I reserved with the Mark Twain in good faith and expected at least a three star experience.
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping nearby.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: The hotel is within easy walking distance of MOMA, Union Square shops, trolley bus connections to Fisherman's Wharf and a variety of good places to eat.  They are currently in the process of adding a bar, restaurant and larger lobby which will make the hotel more appealing.  The complimentary breakfast was adequate but the seating minimal, so not a very comfortable experience.  Would  have no problem recommending this hotel.

review.title: Great stay even under construction
review.reviewText:
We only needed to stay in the city one night, and I have stayed at the Mark Twain before so we gave it a try again. The room was fine, we had an issue with the radiator, but a quick call to the front desk fixed that. My only complaint would be the continental breakfast didn't start until 6:30 and we had to be gone by 6:15 to head to UCSF.... I saw many people checking early so that was a bummer for them too. 
The water pressure is low, but I'm assuming the construction is fixing that. 
Overall, the room is clean, there's a convince store on the corner, valet parking is available, breakfast is offered and location is central! I would stay again!

Heater did not work but we were able to get a portable right away from the hotel staff. The bathtub and sink were clogged and did not drain well. The room smelled like urine and poo but the bed sheets and towels were clean. The windows are very thin and you can hear EVERYTHING  going on outside on the streets so we were not able to get good, restful sleep. The hotel lobby was under construction. Overall, the hotel was safe and in a good location near great restaurants and shopping.

The list of things standard that are lacking is long: no full length mirror, no light in closet (old-time bigger walk-in), no shelf in shower, no bag stand, no bath mat, no dresser, no desk, and no kleenex.  Lighting in the room was terrible, but even worse was the water pressure in the shower...more like a drip-line than a full flow!  After filling out an Expedia check-in survey, the management suggested they'd be happy to move me to another room, which they did.  Trouble was, the new room wasn't appreciably better!  Still terrible water pressure, still bad lighting, no desk, no bag stand, no dresser, and no kleenex.  Terrible disappointment for the price.

The elevator was unusually small and as it opened, it revealed plastic all over the carpet and a very strong paint smell. Once we got to the room, the paint smell was even stronger. We opened the windows, which had no screen. It was very unsafe. I feel like this hotel should not have opened until construction was over or have a couple floors completely finished.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Good bed, spacious room, good shower.  Basics covered well.

Very disappointing stay at this hotel, the room is much older that it seems in the official photos and desperately need the renovation that is going on there these days. You can hear the people in the next room talking, taking a shower, flushing the toilet. The heating in my room was making strong noises that I had to ask the hotel to turn off the central heating just so there would be quite and I could sleep. Because I was there at a very busy week (big conference) the price I paid very much above what this hotel charges on "regular" days, and I was not aware of it, for what I paid per night on average I expected this hotel, though a small one, to have a very high bar, I was very disappointed, and when I found out what the regular rates are in this Hotel it started making more sense. One last thing, the hotel is located in a location that in the evening does not feel so well to walk around.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing the rooms, Heating system, Bathroom, TV channels are in SD and analog, not enough lighting in the room. Hotel bar was closed.

review.title: A hotel with character
review.reviewText:
This is a difficult hotel to rate.  The building is old (I believe dating from the 1920s) so it would be unfair to compare the structure to a modern edifice.  The age of the building gives it a certain charm but that patina is not without its downsides.  For instance, the elevator is tiny, the heating is vintage steam heat and if you want cool air, open a window.  But it is not run down - everything works fine.  Internet is free (and good).

The rooms were clean and well decorated.  The bed was very comfortable.  I wish there would have been a bit more storage space in the bathroom and generally more horizontal space for stuff.  Admittedly, I was in SF for a conference and had quite a bit of stuff I needed to lay out.

Although the television was flat screen, it was only very basic cable - and the sound on one channel never did work throughout the week long stay.  This is certainly something that could and should be updated.

But the real issue with this hotel is the neighbourhood.  While the hotel is within an easy walk of Chinatown, the BART station and about 12 minutes from the Moscone Center, some of the nearby streets are definitely to be avoided.  We never had any problems, but there are some very interesting people frequenting those streets!

If you like something a bit out of the ordinary and enjoy a bit of history, you will like the Mark Twain.  If you insist on a modern, cookie cutter type hotel, it won't be the best for you.
review.positiveRemarks: It has character and a certain old school charm.  The Internet worked very well and was free.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the television to digital and provide more than basic cable stations!
review.locationRemarks: The location is within an easy walk of many tourist attractions and the BART.  However, some of the streets in the are run down.

review.title: NO SLEEP HOTEL
review.reviewText:
This was one of the worst hotels I have stayed at, it was terrible!! Fire alarm kept going off all night into the morning hours and there were no working phones in the rooms, the showers would not drain, the Elevator was not working and to go up to 6th floor was a pain with luggage and kids.  Room keys would not work after several uses and we had to keep going to get them fixed. 

Hotel Staff did change our room to supposedly correct the problem, however the alarms went off in the middle of the night, 2nd room still had no working phones, showers would not drain and the cleanliness was definitely an issue.  I did request a refund and was going to book another hotel but they would not refund me all my money and at the 2nd night I just bought earplugs to avoid the alarm and hotel noise.  We paid $500/night to get a 4 star hotel and it was highly disappointing.  I would stay away!!!

review.reviewText: There were several good things about the hotel, like the location, extra blankets available in the room, refillable toiletries, and a very homey feel to it. Unfortunately, the carpets smelled musty and old which gave the entire place a run down feel that was hard to shake off. I suppose it could be considered charming, but it was just not my type of hotel. I do have to say that I did not have a bad experience with the room or the staff specifically, it was just the overall feel of the place that I was dissatisfied with.

review.title: ok but disorganized
review.reviewText: Decent hotel but quite disorganized. Had to wait 20min to check in while they sorted out some misbilling with another customer. Sounded like a nightmare for her.
Room was lovely but lift was an issue as building work happening and only 1 lift and we were on 8th flr so a challenage at times with bags etc.

managementResponses.response: Vivek, Thank you for talking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the hotel. We are happy that you were excited about our theme of Mark Twain and all if his great works. Our location is central with good access to many great restaurants, theaters and shopping. Hope you can return again soon. Happy New Year JM, GM

review.title: Nice hotel close to Market street and Tenderloin
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay. It's probably not the prettiest of neighborhoods, especially if you have a problem with the homeless, but considering that they stay to themselves and don't bother you, it shouldn't matter.
review.positiveRemarks: Mark Twain everywhere - as a bibliophile, what's not to like about that?
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Market street and that makes getting anywhere using public transport very easy. The Tenderloin is full of great restaurants.

managementResponses.response: AT, Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at the hotel. sorry we were not able to meet your expectations.. I am glad my staff was able to find a room where you felt comfortable. Hope you will return once we complete another renovation in 2016. Happy New Year. JM,GM

review.reviewText:
Good Location but not in a secure place. 
Bad connection of Internet and wifi
The hotel help us to make a new accommodation without problem. 
Comfortable rooms 
Please check the pillows are not comfortable

managementResponses.response: Garth, What a wonderful review. Thank you for details of your experience at our "Diamond in the Rough". It gives us such pleasure that you enjoyed the uniqueness of the theme and the caring fun staff that obviously enjoy their jobs  We look forward to having you return. Happy New Year, JM, GM

review.title: Sketchy Hood - Great Oasis
review.reviewText:
Yes, the Mark Twain isn't in the best location as far as real estate goes, but as for a stay, if you're looking for something a little more homely and quaint, this is your spot. Had to turn the radiator off because of the heat in the room initially, but with the windows open and a fan on, it became very pleasant. The walls are adorned with quotes and canvases all related to Mark Twain, and this gives the hotel a classic, intellectual feel that you wouldn't notice otherwise.

Hotel staff is very laid back, and the bartender at the time of this post had enormous insight into classical literature and led me through one of the most intelligent conversations I've been privy to in years. His dedication to the literature just cemented the classic feel of the hotel, and this is a perfect place to get off the grid after a long day of tourist attractions in the city. Breakfast place next door is phenomenal, and there are food and bars close by.

I don't think you should expect a 5 star experience - if you're one of those people who expects to be waited on hand and foot - maybe skip the Mark Twain. But if you're someone who wants to feel welcomed to a new city, wants to knock back a drink or two in a calm environment and have a chat with the employees before going up to bed - you would be hard pressed to find a better hearth.

Not a 5 star hotel, but they know that. The "we do things our own way here" aspect of the staff and the decor make it well worth the stay. I'll be back ASAP.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great to have some in-house food options, but otherwise, very enjoyable.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy, obviously. Don't go out and walk around too late.

managementResponses.response: Joanne, Enjoyed your review and you appreciation the not only the theme of the hotel, but our knowledgeable staff. It was great to see your photos and the fun sid of staying with us. Happy New Year, JM, GM

review.title: Great little boutique hotel next to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Staff is fantastic. Facilities are very good except there was a problem the first night with no heat.  Very clean. The bathroom in my room had a huge bath tub. I'm tall and I could stretch out in it. Loved this place.

The staff there are very helpful! Room service comes every morning to change linens and clean room. The hotel also holds your luggage even after you've checked out. The area location is ok. You are very close to union square and downtown which is great although if you go one block down there are a lot of crazy bums. But overall my stay there was really great!! Would definitely recommend!

managementResponses.response: Sorry to hear that our boutique hotel did not meet your needs. We were built in 1928 and it is a unique opportunity to enjoy old SF charm and that style is not for everyone.. Hope you visit SF again and have a better experience. JM, General Manager

review.title: Don't do it
review.reviewText: Just don't do it. Small. Plumbing shows. Heater won't turn off. Elevator is the smallest I've seen ever.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were great, rooms were clean. Main lobby and hallways were newly renovated room was a little dated. Maybe other rooms were renovated? Location was walking distance from many shopping facilities, cable car, restaurants, and train station. Enjoyed my stay very sad to leave. thanks mark twain staff!!

managementResponses.response: Honeymooners, I apologize that our hotel did not meet your needs, especially on this very special occasion.Not sure how the reservation was originally booked, but two double beds was obviously some type of error. It is unfortunate that we only have the one elevator, but the building is from 1928, a grand era. We are actually going to do a remodel in the beginning of 2016 and the hotel will have a whole new look and feel. Congratulations on your marriage and I hope you were able to find exceptional accommodations for your honeymoon. JM, GM

review.title: Don't ever stay here!
review.reviewText: We are on our honeymoon trip we arrived at Hotel Mark Twain and as soon as we pulled up we knew we were in trouble. We get into the lobby half of it is under instruction with signs saying please don't mind the dust. We get into an elevator that was 2 by 2 we barely fit in it with our luggage. The hallways had pipes you can see there was no ceiling. We get into the room and it was nothing like we saw in the picture! They gave us two double beds when we were supposed to have a king bed. I looked in the bathroom and knew instantly we needed to get out! We turned around went back downstairs and said there is no way we can stay here ! This hotel was the most disgusting thing I have ever seen. I recommend that you run as far away from here as you can! The employee then told us that wasn't the quickest stay so I'm assuming this happens a lot here. She said that she could not give us our money back that we would have to pay for first night. At this point i was willing to take the hit because it was that bad. They don't show you the bathroom in the site for a reason .. Get prepared ....

review.title: Clean and spacious room for an affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Affordable hotels in downtown San Francisco cut corners by having small rooms that are not kept up very well, but Hotel Mark Twain was clean, modern and had reasonably spacious rooms.  It is true that there is a facility for jobless/homeless the block south of the hotel but if that makes you feel uncomfortable you can just arrive to the hotel from the north side.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator was small and slow.

review.title: You Get What You Pay For
review.reviewText: Small hotel in the not-so-good part of Union Square. That was okay since my girlfriend and I just needed a place to sleep. The staff was friendly. The room could have been better. The bathtub had cracks in it. The whole tub was not ground level so it felt unstable..it's hard to explain but it felt like the bottom could break. The toilet looked like one you find in a public restroom. After flushing the toilet the handle would leak. The sink was way too small and water would splash everywhere when I brushed my teeth and washed my face. One of the towels in the bathroom was dirty. We ended up using it for the water splashes that the sink made. The bed was comfortable. TV was nice, but the remote had no batteries. We don't plan on staying here again and I don't recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square so restaurants and buses are walking distance

review.title: quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: Stayed here over the weekend from San Diego. I was in town  for a wedding with my girlfriend and definetly loved it out there! this hotel was very cozy and clean. The art work and furniture were also very elegant. They had a little bar in the front with a good selection. staff was very professional and friendly. I'd rate this place a 4star no complaints here besides the fact that parking was very limited and valet was expensive. My solution was to use ubber for the night and I ended up saving about $30. They do offer valet service but like most places in the union district the cost was high. Since we did drive we decited to park the car in a different location for free and use ubber most of the night. great alternative and wallet consious. I would stay here again anytime.

review.title: Charming, Centrally Located & Great Staff
review.reviewText:
I arrived on the last day of the Oracle convention and the street was blocked off so it was little chaotic getting to the hotel. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful when I had issues with the room's door lock and room key. They promptly moved me to a different room, no questions asked. They also stored my luggage on the last day of my trip so I could do some last-minute sightseeing. 

The hotel has historic charm, and is located a couple of blocks from Lower Nob Hill, Union Square, and the cable car transit so it's pretty easy to get places. The property is a limited-service hotel so there's not a lot bells and whistles, but it's clean and comfortable. There's an onsite bar, but it did not appear to be open every night.

There is a small cafe next door that is open for breakfast and lunch, and a Thai restaurant that is open for dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, clean rooms, friendly staff, and prompt service.
review.negativeRemarks: Better communication about ongoing events.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (closed until 2016), Asian Art Museum

review.title: Loud hotel, neighborhood has homeless crises
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Mark Twain to participate in a conference across the street. The hotel was undergoing renovation at the time so there was significant noise associated with that. The rooms are almost 100 years old, so are not soundproofed with any modern materials. The street noise was very loud at night making it impossible to sleep without earplugs. This hotel is in the Tenderloin district, and we were accosted by loud and verbally abusive homeless men whenever we left the hotel to walk somewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are not soundproofed in any way. I was on the 6th floor, and the street noise was very loud at night.
review.locationRemarks: Taylor Street Coffee shop is next door, and is an excellent place to get breakfast.

review.title: Not Horrible
review.reviewText: Biggest critique is no AC. You want to cool off, then open a window and hope for the best.
review.negativeRemarks: Air Conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Good breakfast right next door.

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText: Sketchier side of union square. Lots of homeless people

The hotel was pretty quaint with all Mark Twain's inspiration everywhere. It was very cool. And the staff was very helpful and nice. I would definitely stay again. Everything was in walking distance. It was bery convenient.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel close to landmarks and public
review.reviewText: Love the location and staff of this hotel. No need for a car as it us close to Muni, BART , and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Good value and bigger rooms than many city hotels.

review.title: Is quirky charm worth the lack of convenience?
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed my stay in San Fransisco, although, if I were to book another weekend trip, I do not think I would stay here again. Although the hotel is cute and quirky - with Mark Twain quotes on the wall, interesting decor, and an antique feel - the lack of modern amenities made for some frustrating situations. 

The biggest issue was the bathroom: there was basically no counter space so doing makeup or even finding a place to put your toothbrush down was difficult. Same issue in the shower: no ledge space or even a light. On a similar note, there was no mirror in the room, only in the tiny bathroom, which made staying with my friend difficult to manage since we had to share the tiny bathroom for any kind of prep. The shower temp also fluctuated, so that ever 20 seconds it would become scalding hot for about 2 seconds. Although this was not long enough to burn, I had to hop in and out of the water constantly to avoid the intense temperature changes. 

The beds were very comfy, although I found it hard to sleep due to the thin walls / windows. Even with the windows shut I could hear everything going on outside: people yelling, cars honking, etc. A nap during the day was impossible. The room itself was also very cold and dark, with only three very dim lights. 


The 24-hour front desk check-in/out was handy. We arrived very late so there was no need to call ahead and schedule a late check-in due to this. However, the bar closes at 10 and there is no room service in terms of food.
review.negativeRemarks: Sink counter space, more lights, mirrors in the rooms, food room service.
review.locationRemarks: While close to Union Square, it is in the "Tenderloin", which is a very dodgy area. I did not leave the hotel alone. Lots of homeless directly outside

managementResponses.response: Hello Recent Guest, Awesome, I love to hear that was how you felt about your stay. Yes, there is a lot of walking around and you can definitely get in your mileage each day. That's why we have the peaceful "Hummingbird Garden" to relax in and our lobby bar for a little libation and snack. Hope you do return soon and let us know that you are a repeat guest.  Cheers, JM

review.title: Great little boutique hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! The staff was awesome and the location was great! I was able to walk around and barely having to use a cab. The room itself was honestly ok. You can hear if you upstairs neighbor flush the toilet which annoyed me a little. The bed was ok also. But besides that it was great stay and I might stay again when I come back into town!

managementResponses.response: K, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay. Our location is idea,l because as you mentioned, we are close to transportation and Union Square. But there is even more, the theaters, great restaurants and lots of shopping.  Hope the rest of travels were fun.  Best Regards, JM

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Very central hotel, close to all transportation. Located near Union Square and the Tenderloin district.
review.negativeRemarks: Our heater didn't work but we didn't need it too much.
review.locationRemarks: Everything San Francisco

managementResponses.response: TC, Traveling can be exhausting, but glad that my staff was cheerful and efficient to make you feel welcome. I will share your review with Housekeeping, because they like to hear that our guest appreciate the cleanliness. Look forward to having you return again. Regards, JM

review.title: Wonderful boutique hotel!!!
review.reviewText: I had a late check-in with no issues. Front desk staff were cheerful and efficient while checking us in - much needed as it was a long traveling day. The room was clean and decor was quaint to the theme of the hotel. Awesome location!!!

review.title: Comfortable Centrally Located Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location.  Easy walking distance to things like BART stations and Powell/Market.  Great breakfast place right next door (Taylor Street Cafe).  Rooms are small but clean.  Room rates reasonable.  Good place to stay if only using room for sleeping at night.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Powell/Market Cable Car Station, Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown, Little Italy and BART line.

review.reviewText: Good staff but no A/C in our room. Not sure if that's common in SF.
Small washroom, stuffy room. Will look for a hotel with larger washroom next time. Good for a couple days stay.

review.title: Nice hotel

Convenient place to stay, decent room. Staff very friendly

review.title: Good location across the Hilton.
review.reviewText: The staff was awesome.  Very helpful.  Love that they set up shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Nicely renovated hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The room was overall pretty wonderful. Nice modern touches for a typical older building in SF.  The shower water pressure was pretty light but everything else was great.  The ceiling fan and open windows cooled the room enough for me.  The staff was excellent!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain hotel was a very nice hotel. The staff were particularly accommodating. The walls were a little thin and I could hear some other guests but it was not loud.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square and all the fun!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I was there for the Nike Women's Run.  The only downside for me was no late check out. Since the hotel did not allow late check out,  it put a damper on the after run events. I had to come back to shower and leave.
review.positiveRemarks: It is nice and funky. Nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Allowing customers to have a late check out for cases like a 1/2 marathon event! We pay enough money to stay there.

review.locationRemarks: GOd location t

review.title: Worth the price
review.reviewText: Would have liked a fridge but overall well worth the cost. The neighborhood isn't the greatest but again, worth the cost. Staff was the best! Very friendly and always welcoming.

review.title: Good Effort
review.reviewText: The hotel has been updated and is 'boutique-ish'.  There is still room for improvement - the closets, for example.  Re-fitted with a rack and boxes as drawers, with no light, I pulled the boxes out and used them on the floor to store my clothes.  The bathrooms are 1920's tiny.  I understand the cost savings in not rebuilding them, but one person could hardly turn around in it - let alone a couple.
Excellent service and knowledge from front desk people.
Not very  hospitable,  valet dinged our door. The bartender looked like he came off the street. I won't ever stay there again.

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText:
Loved it! there were some concerns- but as a New Yorker- maybe this stuff is normal on this coast. There was no AC but most restaurants didn't have any either. Windows don't have locks on them, and dead bolt didn't work. 

But... the hotel is literally 3 blocks from everything you need to do. We took a bus tour for two days and used it like a taxi, store on the corner that had any thing you might have forgotten. Starbucks a couple blocks away. Breakfast restaurant next door. 

Very clean and tidy! a++++

managementResponses.response:

Warm Regards,

Alexander Wink

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel. Friendly staff. Close to everything.
Localisation , staff And room is wonderful ....  Very close metro And cable car station .....  Room is clean
Hotel is clean & staff is nice. Rooms are very small & bathrooms are cramped. It is very noisy at night.
Spent two nights at his hotel and it was a great location. Walking distance to both Bart and the cable car. Lots of shops restaurants nearby too.

review.title: Older style hotel tastefull renovated
review.reviewText: This older style hotel has been tastefully renovated. The plantation shutters and fan nearly make up for the lack of AC. It's only a short walk to Union Square.

review.title: Nice Hotel great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was friendly. Rooms were clean. I broke a glass in the bathroom. I called the front desk and they came right up to clean up the mess.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Located downtown. Not far from any where we wanted to go.

review.title: visitors from Germany
review.reviewText: great deal. Friendly staff, clean rooms and all in walking distance to downtown. very reasonable prices for this area and during tourist season. will return
review.negativeRemarks: closet had no lighting. minor issue
review.locationRemarks: all the classic tourist spots, Union Square etc

review.title: Expected More. Very misleading.
review.reviewText:
Upon arriving, my uber driver was surprised I was staying at this hotel, which should have been my first tip. The area is really rough...

After checking in, I went up a sketchy elevator to my room where the door would not open. Asked the guy at the front desk if he could take a look at it. He told me sometimes the door handles don't work and after a few times of great force, he was finally able to rip my door open to find that the culprit had been two loose screws holding in the lock. He proceeded to fix this problem by screwing them back in with his FINGERS. Absolutely did not make me feel secure.

There is no a/c, even as a no smoking room it smelt like smoke and everything looked shotty and dirty. Deciding that I might not find another hotel on short notice, I decided to suck it up. Opened my shower curtain to find a cockroach scurrying into my drain...all happened within 30 min after my check in. Needless to say I asked to check out and asked for a full refund, where the lady at the front desk did not even apologize, was rude and acted like this happened all of the time. Found another hotel. Don't even waste your time and money on this place!

review.title: Something to think about before you book...
review.reviewText:
This is one of those "Old School" style boutique places. Read: NO AIR CONDITIONING! Room too hot? Hotel staff suggests opening a window and turning on a fan. Real hard to sleep in downtown SF with the windows open all night!

Also frustrating- my wife had to spend the entire (short) time at this hotel with her foot soaked by the Strawberry Milkshake into which she stepped immediately after leaving the cab in front of the hotel. Door staff was more concerned with playing with each other/front desk staff than keeping front of hotel clean or helping us with our bags.

Real big disappointment for me. After abouta half hour here, we bailed for the Hilton across the street!

review.title: DONT SYAY HERE
review.reviewText: Shower sucks extreme hot water then cold water a second later. No Ac! Valet left my car in front for 2hrs! Area is sketchy... And there was dog mess in entrance of hotel that staff ignored.. Never will I stay here again.!!

review.title: Misleading...
review.reviewText:
-Staff...respectful, accomodating
-Loction...very sketchy area (stinks of urine, homeless people everywhere)
-Rooms...cheaply renovated (pictures on hotel website are very misleading), no AC, paper-thin walls, very basic
-Ammenities...WIFI signal was weak ( weak connection, kept getting kicked off); everything else very basic 

Overall below average experience...
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to Civic Centre (pick up for OSL Music Festival shuttle).
review.negativeRemarks: Everything...rooms are very cheaply renovated, add AC.
review.locationRemarks: Close to City Hall, Civic Centre, shopping etc.

review.title: Uncomfortably numb.
review.reviewText: Upon arriving after working late after 12 midnight on the evening of my arrival; the rooms shower was cold and the drain broken.  I stood ankle deep in a cold shower as the water would not drain.  Getting out of the shower discovering hair (not my own) resting on the tile in the bathroom.  The drain was addressed but the water upon waking the next morning hoping to take a shower before meeting colleagues-the water was still cold.   More than an inconvenience but a basic need.  I decided to check out that morning.  The front desk assured me that Expedia was notified and I would be refunded for my last night stay.  We'll see.
review.positiveRemarks: The availability of technical equipment/phone charger.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot and cold running water.  Vacuumed rooms.  The bed coverlet had foot crusted upon it.

review.title: Quaint hotel with amazing staff!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain is an excellent hotel for what it is - an older building with a classic feel. It's not exactly in a family or tourist part of town, but it was perfect for a convention hosted across the street at a larger hotel to get out of all that rush. The room was fantastic and staff were all tremendous and friendly. You can hear city noise and even neighbors occasionally and the elevators went out once or twice - but were fixed quickly. I will absolutely stay here again on business or personal trips in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was lovely and had lots of character. The staff was friendly and top notch!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - the hotel is true to it's character - certainly not like a big chain.
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot to do nearby - West of the hotel is a little rough, but safe. East are other hotels and some nice places to eat. Two great Thai places near.

review.title: Poor quality
review.reviewText:
Good: 
Long bath tubs and high shower heads. 
Interesting Twain and mustache themed decor. 

Bad: 
No AC in room and the ceiling fan was ineffective. 
Oversize valet vehicle parking $55/night. Nothing cheaper found nearby. 

Terrible: 
Acoustic insulation severely lacking. Clearly heard TV and normal-level conversation from neighboring room. Staff moved us when we requested it. In the new room we heard only the sound of snoring from next door.
The rooms were very clean.  We loved the butterfly garden.  The staff was attentive and helpful.

managementResponses.response:
Greetings J,

We appreciate you taking the time to let us know we had all the ingredients necessary to provide you with an extraordinary hotel experience. I will share your comments with our staff. We hope you can return to Hotel Mark Twain again soon.

Warm Regards,

Alexander Wink
Front Office Manager
Hotel Mark Twain

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The staff really care at the Mark Twain. They could not have been more helpful. The hotel is chic and well located just a few minutes walk from Powell St and Union Sq

review.title: Recent trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The experience was less than desired. The room on check in still had hair in the tub. Room square footage was very small and photos on web site were misleading as to size of room. The last night we were kept awake by the people in the adjacent room. As older downtown hotels go could have been worse, could have been much better.
review.locationRemarks: great shopping with in a few blocks. unfortunately on the edge of a high crime part of tow, so kind of uncomfortable going out at night.

managementResponses.response:
Greetings,

Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your candid feedback about Hotel Mark Twain. It is only with perspectives such as yours that we can continue to strive to provide the most safe, comfortable, and pleasant experience for our guests.

Our front desk team is trained to always verify the guest name, room number, and also check photo ID whenever they issue replacement room keys. It sounds like this does not match your experience, so we will reaffirm to our team the importance of verifying ID in this situation.

I see you still gave us a positive overall rating, which is very encouraging. We do appreciate you staying here at Hotel Mark Twain, and we hope you will consider a return visit in the future. 

Alexander Wink
Front Office Supervisor
Hotel Mark Twain

review.title: Security
review.reviewText:
I was able to get replacement room keys to my room without any ID or verification of who I was.  Not even my name.  The clerk said "I just go by feel".  It didn't make me feel secure at all.  

In addition, despite the relatively rough neighborhood, generally, there was no verification at all of guest registration regardless of what time of night we came back.
review.negativeRemarks: Security

managementResponses.response:
Good day Alma,

This is excellent. I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. Reviews like yours are very encouraging to our team as we continue to provide great service and comfortable rooms for our guests. We would love to welcome you back anytime. Thank you very much!

Warm Regards,

Alexander Wink
Front Office Supervisor
Hotel Mark Twain

review.title: Very nice hotel close to downtown shops
review.reviewText: Very happy with with our stay at mark twain. Im very satisfied with the service and location.
review.positiveRemarks: Convinient going to shops and the service.
review.locationRemarks: The location was so good.. Very close to downtown. You can just walk to city anytime..

managementResponses.response:
