I am thrilled to know you had an excellent stay here at Hotel Mark Twain. Our goal is to ensure our guests enjoy both personable service and comfortable rooms, and I'm glad we could provide this for you.

I appreciate your comments about the bathroom and closet lighting as well. It is only with candid feedback such as yours that we can progress into an even better hotel. I do know we have plans to improve the closet lighting, so I hope if you return to San Francisco in the future, we can welcome you back for an even more enjoyable stay.

Warm Regards,

Alexander Wink
Front Office Supervisor
Hotel Mark Twain

review.title: Easy access to Union Square
review.reviewText:
The employees were great!  Very helpful!  The lobby was nice. 

My only wish is that the bathroom was a little cleaner. They do need a small light in the closet, it's dark. 

My children and I felt safe and it was convenient to catch the bus from Union Square in San Francisco. Only 3 blocks away!  

I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
It was a nice stay, no complaints. 
The price is very reasonable for the location

review.title: No air conditioning
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to the Moscone Center which is why I chose it. The location is convenient across the street from the Hilton. Breakfast is not included. There is no fitness center. My main complaint is that it doesn't have air conditioning which I assumed would be standard for a hotel in this price range. The neighborhood is dirty, smelly and there are lots of homeless people with bad attitudes lurking everywhere etc. but that applies to pretty much all of San Francisco's downtown these days unfortunately.
review.negativeRemarks: Add air conditioning to the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Hilton hotel, 10 to 15 minutes walk to Moscone Center, breakfast joint right next door

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: The rooms are cleaned everyday and the beds are comfortable.

review.title: OK experience
review.reviewText: Staff friendly and helpful. On a decent block, but some of the surrounding blocks seemed a bit sketchy.  Very clean (but small) room and comfy beds.  Continental breakfast a disaster - packaged muffins and old fruit.

review.title: not what was expected
review.reviewText:
Room was smaller than appears in pic 
Surrounding area awful
Was charged for a night when I told them I was uncomfortable & wanted to leave 
Would not pay almost $400 a night to stay 
Very disappointing

review.title: Hotel with lots of charm
review.reviewText: It was close to everything we needed. The Bart so I could travel for business, Union Square, and China town for my wife and many great food restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: If you went the wrong way there were a lot of beggars. We try and help one per day but there were so many it was overwhelming. we felt safe at hotel.

review.reviewText: I got a great deal on Expedia. My room was selling for $750 the next night, so unfortunately, I was not able to extend my stay at the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient to BART and MUNI
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for considerably less than large brands nearby, easy walking to BART, MUNI, and cable cars at Union Square.  Upscale furnishings, but it is a boutique hotel, so don't look for huge exercise areas, lobbies, coffee shops, etc.

review.title: Small rooms, no view
review.reviewText: I expected more from reading the description on Expedia. Hotel Valet is inconvenient. They park you car off site so you need to give them thirty minutes to get your car. We ended using Yelp to self park a block away on Jones Street for $25 a night. The self park garage the hotel staff recommended wanted $55 to park our Ford Explorer. The room was disappointingly small and I expected more for the $$ (we paid about $200 an night but with taxes and SF fees two nights cost us $555.00). The room was dark with no view (faced an interior open space). The hotel staff did not seem interested in us and provided the bar minimum. The location is one block from the skid row of San Francisco. We went to the right as we exited the hotel and were immediately in the middle of it. The staff should have warned us....
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square.

review.title: Easy walk to convention center
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean but aging. My travel was for business, the American Library Association annual conference.  I choose the hotel because it was across the street from one of the official conference hotels so I would have easy access to the conference shuttle.  The desk staff were all very helpful and friendly, the hotel is older and shows it in the VERY small elevator, a little shabby chic and like all older hotels there are very few outlets. There is a light shaft the hotel is built around so you do have some natural light but absolutely no view unless you want to see the mechanical equipment at the bottom of the light shaft.  WIFI is decent.  The in-room fridge is small and there is no light switch in the closet.  The desk is actually the credenza the TV sits on so yes, you can use it but it's not a comfortable height.  I was in a deluxe room and it was tiny.  BUT, the room was clean, the bedding in good shape, everything worked.  I carry a power strip with me when I travel so the lack out outlets wasn't a problem for me.  The hotel is on the same street as GLIDE a church with a serious urban outreach mission so they do feed the hungry.  The church celebrates all forms of diversity so if you have a problem with LGBTQ or mixed race peoples then don't stay over a Sunday.  If you do, attend a service and celebrate.
review.positiveRemarks: Mark Twain is an easy walk to Market Street and there are a lot of Indian restaurants in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel should offer power strips, there are so few  outlets and there should be a light in the closet.
review.locationRemarks: Right down down, close to Market and Powell so reasonably distance to the wharf and, it's about a 10 minute walk from Moscone convention center.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: No service on 2nd floor, small patio, found a woman's hair on my pillow. Clean bathroom, nice tub, fast internet.

review.title: outdated, tiny rooms and no amenities
review.reviewText: No AC in room and it got stifling at night. Extremely small room and bathroom was awful. No counter space, toilet was gross, and really tiny. There was no lighting in the entry or closet making both areas pointless.  Tried to cancel our last night with 24 hours notice and staff said they require 48 hours. Overcharged us by $100 from what our Expedia itinerary said. Never coming again.

review.title: Paper thin walls
review.reviewText:
My first impression of the hotel and the room was cute. It's a small boutique hotel and I like the decor. The tile floor of the bathroom in my room felt a little sticky. But I guess it was just me. Overall, I liked the hotel.
But when it was time to sleep, I wish I had booked at another hotel. First of all, the walls there were paper thin. So thin that I could hear every single thing on the TV from the room next door. And the guy didn't even have his TV volume on high (I know because I checked outside the hallway). It was only because the TV was right next to my bed on the opposite side of the wall.
And then like an old New York apartment, every time when someone flushed their toilets (I mean, EVERYONE in the nearby vicinity, not just the guy next door), I could hear this loud rumbling noise. I guess a lot of people do like to use their bathrooms in the middle of the night. Also, my shower water did get really hot whenever someone flushed their toilets in other rooms. Not to mentioned you could hear people yelling several floors down.
By the way, I don't have super human hearing. As a matter of fact, I'm a sound sleeper and not one that's easily awaken by noises. But needless to say, I couldn't sleep at all and I felt like a zombie the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was actually comfortable. Decor was cute. It was only couple blocks away from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: umm.. whatever happened to sound insulation between rooms and plumbing walls?
review.locationRemarks: I discovered an Italian restaurant within walking distance called Brasserie on Geary St. Their pork belly and shrimp is to die for.

review.title: Nice hotel with charm
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a weekend. The hotel staff was friendly. This is an older hotel, so some features may not be as updated as we would like. The pipe in our room made rattling noise at night whenever our neighbor used the restroom. We asked the front desk for a different room the second day, they seemed to be accomodating. However, due to the fact that we could not meet their required check-out time to switch the room, we were not able to switch. Overall we had a good experience, aside from the pipe noise at night.

Totally doesn't represent the very high rate during weekend that I had to pay, for room only, not including breakfast.
Room: convenient enough, nothing special.
Bathroom: small ,outdated.
Lobby: tiny elevator that you need to wait for hours.
Wi-Fi: OK
review.negativeRemarks: Rates adjusted, breakfast included, elevator modernized.
review.locationRemarks: The 10 min. walk from Powel station was a challenge due to all the homeless people on the way.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Good location, steps to BART, restaurants, and shopping area as well as Chinatown.  Bathrooms are small but rooms are spacious.  We were above the mini garden so was very quite, no street noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to what we planned to do
review.negativeRemarks: No fans in bathrooms so they fogged up quickly!
review.locationRemarks: Walked to Chinatown, BART, Union Square, cable car!

review.title: OK Hotel by Homeless
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain is just ok. It is not bad, nor is it great. The bathrooms seem like converted school bathrooms or some sort of municipal style bathroom. The shower pressure is poor. There wasn't a desk in the room, which made it a little difficult to do work. The WiFi speed was just ok and the TV had very little channels and the quality was poor. But, perhaps the largest thing/issue was that in a city with a large homeless population, this hotel sits right next to a homeless outreach methodist church which means there is a larger congregation of homeless people milling about right around the hotel. Additionally, since some of these people have mental illness, and since the Hotel Mark Twain does not have AC since SF has a very cool climate and the windows are open to allow the cool air in, I was kept awake by a person obviously troubled with mental illness yelling for more than an hour between 1 and 2am outside at who-knows-what. No one did anything about it. I will not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: friendlier staff, faster wifi, some sort of security
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in the Tenderloin. It isn't a great area and I would highly recommend a family or single woman/girl stay elsewhere.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: This was our third time staying here in the last six months.  The staff is wonderful and cordial and helpful.  The only complaint is that our room which was on the inner well of the hotel really has very little access to fresh air. Even though there is a ceiling fan it was too warm, stuffy and difficult to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Air circulation
review.locationRemarks: We recommend a new venue in the Tenderloin called Pianofight. It's located at 144 Taylor Street. Terrific food, bar and theater- young and original.

review.title: Quaint hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff were exceptional.  the hotel is not fancy but quaint in the decor.  It was comfortable and had all the amenities needed but was a bit small ie. bathroom.   
Location was good for Union Square area and getting to the cable car.
review.locationRemarks: High end shopping and there would be entertainment in summer and on weekends in the square.  Lots of restaurants and close to the Hop on Hop off pu.

review.title: Nice Hotel , But overpriced
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel , Bery Clean and Trendy but ,,, terrible area  full of homeless people fighting in the night and asking for money at any time . The rooms are very tiny ones

review.title: Fine for price,good location for us
review.reviewText:
We have stayed once before, hotel is ok, a little tired, Handy to transport and in location we wanted, reasonable value for the price
Front desk very helpful, met expectations

review.title: Nice Cozy Place to Stay in the Bay
review.reviewText: We came for Dodger games.  Very centrally located near Muni transportation. And Bart!  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!
Go relax in the Hummingbird Garden. It's a little piece of paradise inside a bustling city.

review.title: Surprisingly great hotel for a competitive rate!
review.reviewText:
I needed to book a hotel last minute for a conference in the city. Hotel prices in the city are already nuts, let alone convention time. I've stayed in the city plenty times before, and was surprised to find Mark Twain as I've never heard of it before. I was hesitant- esp with the competitive price point of sub $200/nt, but the ratings/reviews seemed decent enough.

I arrived at the hotel pleasantly surprised. Small, but very clean and chic. This is a no frills place, but they definitely don't skimp on style. There's a small bar in the lobby, but that's about it. Check in was fast, the staff even got me early check in without any issues. Room was fabulous and comfortable. Bathroom was a tad small if I had to find something to scrutinize, but still fine. Wifi was consistent and free. My favorite were the outlets right on the bedside lamps. As a business traveler, those amenities are small but well valued. 

Overall, AWESOME option for business travelers and even families that aren't looking for a full service hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator (there was only 1...) can take a while
review.locationRemarks: A central location, and while I never felt unsafe- the area can get a little sketch at night

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: What made it memorable for me was the reasonably priced bar in the lobby, the food was good, and Robin was great to talk to.
review.positiveRemarks: Free internet which was nice at this price point. They don't gouge for bottled water in the rooms like most places.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little cramped and dated. No HBO.

review.reviewText: This hotel was an awesome pick. Great location and warm and hospitable staff. I'll definitely stay there again!

review.title: Unfriendly staff
review.reviewText:
We found the female staff at the front desk very unhelpful and quiet rude. We observed one female staff member giving dirty looks and rolling her eyes to another guest behind her back after and interaction. There were 2 helpful and pleasant  male staff members at the desk.
Room was small and the bathroom was very small. 
Beds were comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: The attitude of the female front desk staff
review.locationRemarks:
Some undesirables around the hotel.
Was close to union square

review.title: Nice hotel, sketchy location
review.reviewText: Loved the boutique hotel. Decor is beautiful, friendly staff, and beds were small but okay. No AC, just ceiling fan and open windows for air. Location is kind of sketchy so I wouldn't suggest walking around at night. Also a little noisy at night. Stayed on a Wednesday and Thursday 3rd floor in room facing next door building. Can still hear people yelling out on the street. I'd suggest a room not facing street and maybe higher floor level.

review.title: A cute and affordable place to stay in San Francis
review.reviewText:
My wife and I spent 4 days in San Francisco and had read several reviews of this hotel prior to booking. The only negative about this place is the rooms are small but we did not visit SF to stay in our hotel room. The room we had did have plenty of room for us to sleep, shower and have coffee.
I'm not sure if this applies to all rooms but our room had no refrigerator if that matters for anyone. We did have our own single cup coffee maker which was replenished daily with fresh coffee pods (pre-packages filters)

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They have a small but cozy bar / eating area in the lobby. There is a sweet "serenity" garden out back that has a goldfish filled pond type of thing. We never used it but it looks like a great place to enjoy your morning coffee or to just meditate.

There are some complaints about the neighborhood and while it is on the edge of the Tenderloin, we had no problems. We are from Philly so seeing homeless people and having them ask for money is something we are used to.

All in all, I am pleased that we chose this hotel and the price is just right for SF.
review.positiveRemarks:
It's clean and cozy.
Eat breakfast next door at the Tyler Street Coffee shop. Best breakfast! Ate there twice.
review.negativeRemarks: Having a small fridge would be nice, other than that nothing
review.locationRemarks: You are 2 blocks from all types of public transportation. The BART is 2 blocks away, as is the cbale car trolley. Lots of downtown shopping.

review.title: Nice, affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Even though the location is excellent, the place could feel a little bit insecure. But other than that, is an excellent choice
review.locationRemarks: There is a lot of homeless around, and that can make you feel insecure

review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the central area. The staff is very friendly.

review.title: Conveniently located but 1 lift & noise pollution
review.reviewText:
Bed not made up well each morning and room needed a proper vacuum.

Noise pollution from the street and room temperature too cold

review.title: Great Location, near O'Farrell
review.reviewText: Stay/walk on the O'Farrell side of  this little boutique hotel and for the price point, enjoy a cute, small, but excellent location in the city. Staff was VERY helpful and friendly, including printing our boarding passes the night before we checked out. Small, older rooms but clean, renovated, and efficient. Note that we did not need, nor could we find AC, so in hot weather the open window might not be enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning..? Perhaps an extra shelf or two in closet
review.locationRemarks: Next door a homeless/halfway house, but no troubles..Around corner on O'Farrell easy walk to shopping, restaurants, and luxury hotels & CafeMason

review.title: Nice hotel near union square
review.reviewText: The room was clean and newly renovated, however the bathroom was small if you have to share. There is only one small elevator in the building so there sometimes is a wait. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful and the hotel rates were definitely worth the price for staying in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful Stay!!!
review.reviewText: The brightest part of my trip.  The hotel is a couple blocks from bart, and close to the trolley.    The staff was excellent,   extremely helpful and knowledgeable.  Loved the front desk guy,   gave us directions and maps of the city.   Our room was clean and comfortable. We spent time in the bar and the gentleman was friendly and welcoming.    I would definitely stay at the Hotel Mark Twain again.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was great.  The beds are comfortable.  The rooms are small but very clean.  A little noise, but to be expected in a big city.
review.negativeRemarks: Not that I can thing of.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, bart, and the trolley.

review.title: Nice, close to Union Square. Good value!
review.reviewText: Nice! Not a 5 star but was perfect for what I needed.  I would definitely recommend and/or use again. The neighborhood south of the hotel was ROUGH, so I would advise staying along O'Farrell. Very close to Union square!! Staff was very friendly & held my bags all day sunday after I checked out and let me check in early Saturday.  I was in San Fran for 2 days checking out the city before a work trip in Napa. All in all I had a great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Quaint décor, good value! Good shopping/food close by
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly dingy, room was warm. Nothing really major- elevator was slow/small.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square! Just don't go south!! (Ellis st) very sketchy area with a lot of homeless people....stick to O'Farrell and you'll be fine!

review.reviewText: Great location near center of town in Union Square area. Quieter inside rooms than in neighboring hotels that I have tried. Nice decor updates, but the room was not super-clean or new-feeling (it is an old building).

review.title: Great place to stay in SF Market district
review.reviewText: This is a very charming and unique hotel.  Our room was on the back of the hotel and overlooked a cute garden area.  Very quiet for the location.  Staff is wonderful and very helpful.  Nice little bar onsite, drinks reasonably priced and fun bartender.  Location requires use of valet parking and navigating around the homeless.  We will definitely stay here in the future.

review.title: Good base for standard sightseeing in San franciso
review.reviewText: We headed out every day for Alcatraz, Ferry Building, Fisherman's Wharf.  We always used the great public transportation system of SF.  We could access all within walking distance, and we are in our 70's.

review.title: Clean, modern, and funky
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Hotel Mark Twain. Everything had mustaches, Twain quotes, and a quirky flair. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, larger than I expected, and very comfortable. We definitely would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Powell & Montgomery BART stations, which is convenient. We walked to Chinatown & Japantown, though it was a little bit of distance.

review.title: It was Loud.. You can here everything outside..
review.reviewText: It was ok.. But for San Fran everything is expensive.. Just wish I didn't hear everything outside..

review.title: Clean, comfortable, friendly
review.reviewText: Stayed a week in double room with husband & grown son. the beds were comfortable and the room was quiet and clean. I liked the decor and the central location. The desk staff was super helpful.
Renovated boutique hotel. Great location, great outer facade and the inside was clean with a modern look. Room was clean and had walk in closet.

review.title: Nice Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: I was very worried when I booked this hotel because we are from Texas and I booked over the internet based on location, rating, and price.  We were pleasantly surprised about the condition of the hotel and had a great time.  The rooms are small in comparison to newer hotels but that is to be expected for the era.  My two teenage sons were in the room next to us and they thought the hotel was very comfortable also.  The hotel has a nice bar adjacent to the lobby and a restaurant also.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is located close to restaurants, bars, theater district, shopping, and Chinatown.  You can easily walk to any of these places.

review.title: Walking distance of China Town and Cable Car.
review.reviewText: The front desk folks were great!  We were upgraded to a suite,"the Billy HolidayRoom".  Our room was clean and we could walk to cable car and to China Town.  Our car was parked by hotel staff and returned to us when we checked out.  Great service in San Francisco!

review.title: Nice location with lots of character
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel centrally located in downtown San Francisco near lots of great restaurants, shopping and several transit lines. The hotel staff made me feel welcome and room was pleasant though a little small.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small, especially the bathroom but not much can be done about that.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART, MUNI, Market Line streetcar and cable cars. LOTS of shopping, dining and bars nearby.

review.title: room small and stuffy!!
review.reviewText: The place is little small, from the elevator to bath rooms.

review.title: Unique hotel in a not so unique neighborhood
review.reviewText: I was privileged to get the top floor room. Nice, comfy, but lacks air conditioning. If you open the windows, you will be woken up by police and fire sirens throughout the night. The bed was really comfortable, and the Internet was adequate. The bathroom however reminded me of my college dorm room days. It even had the same freshman smell. Past 10pm, the streets are filled with drug dealers and crack heads. So they keep the main entrance locked. I pretended they were zombies when heading back into the hotel after curfew.  Such a fun experience!

Charming hotel with a very friendly staff. Got some good food recommendations from the front desk and the bartender would chat and create drinks for us. Would come back to stay as it was easy to catch transportation for the day out.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText:
The hotel is comfortable, clean and has Valet parking.It has a good atmosphere. The bathrooms are very small.
We liked it because of the friendliness of the employees.
The only thing that I did not like at all: we had booked 3 rooms and paid immediately by booking' 
We asked to have the rooms on the same floor and that did not happen. The rooms where not reserved at
booking time !
We will go there again if we are in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Warf and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks:
Reservation of the rooms at booking time.
Lower costs for valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to many attractions of SF. It is quiet and comfortable.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this stay at the Mark Twain Hotel, it was a really nice place with great rooms and a comfy bed. There was some nut-case screaming all night somewhere nearby, but thats no reflection on the hotel itself

review.title: good location, poor neighbourhood
review.reviewText: the location is very good but the walking route to market st is not a very pleasent one. the bars and restaurants on the geary st are so wonderful, i would stay at the same hotel again without walking down to turk or market st
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms are not very convenient, lacks simple things like towel hangers
review.locationRemarks: visit redford bar on geary st

review.title: Nice hotel but has a few downsides
review.reviewText: The bathroom was so small it was hard to shower. You have to shut the bathroom door otherwise you can't get into the shower. The area where the hotel is located there are a lot of homeless people that bother you when walking around the neighborhood.
The hotel staff was very helpful and the building and rooms had a lot of character.  It was a nice hotel with a friendly staff.

review.title: Great hotel in an excellent location!
review.reviewText:
Visited the Mark Twain on a recent business trip to the GDC conference.  The hotel is excellent with a real old world charm while at the same time being modern and clean.
There is quite a bit of road noise from outside but being directly in the centre of a busy city, you can expect this.
A special shout out to Aaron the bar tender (not man!) who despite thinking I was an Aussie and called football soccer, was a credit to the hotel..

review.title: Nice but needs updating
review.reviewText: There was no light in the closet so you couldn't see what you were taking out of your suitcase. Also there were no screens on the windows. Which is fine bc there were no bugs but I was nervous that someone could climb up the fire escape and come into our room while we were sleeping. the Bathroom needs updating the toilets don't flush that great. The staff was very nice and helpful. The lobby was nice. And the bed was extremely comfortable. I would stay there again even with the flaws. Good for the price
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great and the bed was awesome. Good night sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms updated, screens on windows and Light in the closet
review.locationRemarks: Taylor Street Coffee next door was a great breakfast place. We ate there both days and the food and staff were wonderful.

review.title: Mark Twain Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our choice to stay here.  We were only there the one day and evening but found the staff to be extremely helpful and welcoming.  The room was nicely decorated and since it was at the back, no noise was heard from the streets.  The pipes inside hotel "groaned" but they were getting the problem fixed the next day.  It was very central and we took a 10 dollar cab down to the Italian district.  It is very central.  Value for money was excellent.

review.title: Small Hotel with excellent service.
review.reviewText: This is a small hotel that has decent rooms, but not close enough to the upscale retail stores, which would have been more preferable.  The first night we stayed in a room facing the street.  Even with the windows closed, we couldn't sleep due to the noise of sirens, and constant heavy traffic that included honking horns all night long.  The next morning, I requested a room change to an "inside room."  This is a must if you are considering staying at The Mark Twain Hotel.  Alex, who runs the front desk, was incredibly nice, efficient and very professional.  He was helpful in providing directions to local restaurants, museums, and other local attractions--in addition to fixing our problems with the noisy room.  One criticism of the rooms that we stayed in...the bathroom sinks are the smallest I have ever seen.  It was impossible to wash my face without slopping water all over the floor.  Our sink was the size of a small drinking fountain!  Other than that, the room had a pleasant decor and was in good shape.  But don't expect anything fancy at the Mark Twain.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms need to be made slightly larger so that there is a normal sink and counter to fit toiletries and hang towels.
review.locationRemarks: The location is near several diners that are fairly nice.

review.title: Shower temp was inconsistent the entire time
review.reviewText: The walls are paper thin on the 9th floor,  elevator was the size of a refrigerator pocket max weight occupancy 1250lbs.

review.title: Quaint hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
Recently stayed here for a couple of nights and was pleasantly surprised. 
Hotel is clean, modern whilst paying tribute to some of history's greats such as Mark Twain (obviously) and Billie Holiday.
ALL of the staff we met were incredibly helpful and friendly! Price was very reasonable.
Location was perfect - just a couple of minutes from union square! 
Would definitely stay again!

review.title: Great place with a very exclusive restaurant A++++
review.reviewText:
Fantastic price for this holel. VERY CLEAN, staff very pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean and the carpets throughout the hotel looked new. located in a great area and easy access to all areas of SFO. I've been to this city many times and I hope to go again soon.
I will defiantly stay at the Mark Twain. The restaurant attached serves great quality up market food
I thought the price on the menu was a little high but the food was worth every dollar. Well done all.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: .Nice place to stay close to a a lot of activity. Small elevator not for the clustrophobic! Would stay there again, though!
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant, helpful staff. Clean pleasant room
review.negativeRemarks: All windows look into a courtyard with occasional noise from the street. Unable to control heat in room. No AC.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Untion Square, Moscone Center, Powell Street

review.title: Nice boutique hotel central SF
review.reviewText: I've stayed in a lot of boutique hotels (even in the same block) and this one was very nice. I read about it being haunted (disappointed saw no ghosts!) and the staff being unfriendly - far from the truth. Great room, excellent service, even a valet (which you need in this neighborhood). And Starbucks across the street in the Hilton. Highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice (large) room. Comfy bed. Nice lobby. Great staff. Good central location - excellent price
review.negativeRemarks: TV didn't have kids channel :-(  Bathroom was a little claustraphobic (tiny)
review.locationRemarks: near Market Street, across from Hilton, lots of restaurants - pretty near everything

review.reviewText: For a small boutique hotel, this was great!  I stayed 5 nights, and I was very pleased.  Don't expect the Ritz Carlton amenities, but it was very nice, clean, and perfect for my business trip.  Great value for the price, and it was in a great location to Union Square as well.  Very pleased.
Convenient location, close to downtown and restaurents
review.negativeRemarks:
Door knobs - not functional
When complained about a broken dead lock, transferred me to a diff room

review.title: loud bathrooms
review.reviewText: great location but the bathroom noise from above or below was loud!
review.negativeRemarks: baffling the noise in the bathrooms and closet!
review.locationRemarks: great for business travelers very central. Or shopping all close.

review.title: Great check in experience with friendly staff
review.reviewText: Nice decor. Friendly staff. Had minor issue with ceiling leak which was sorted promptly.  Received credit @ check out for inconvenience without having to ask. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Free water in room. $2 is too much for small bottle.
review.locationRemarks: Union square etc.

review.title: SF Stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel! Double bed rooms are kind of small for 4 adults and does not have free continental breakfast. Had to pay for coffe and any breakfast we items we had.

review.title: Excellent hotel for Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly staff. Clean room. I enjoyed the stay. You can hear he toilet sound from next door neighbour.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny elevator
review.locationRemarks: lots of restaurants around this hotel

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. We were there during a storm so we woke up to no power. Asked for towels, took them over 30mim because they weren't staffed accordingly. Close to union square

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location but that's about all it has going for it. The rooms are bare bones, the bathrooms old, old, old. We were in two different rooms because the first was so noisy. The second room was much quieter but no place to hang clothes. Hangars and bar but cabinet and safe under it so you couldn't hang anything. Nice staff, reasonably clean, decent bed but no amenities. Unattractive place, no ambiance won't be back.

review.title: Fine for a short stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Mark Twain hotel for 2 nights during our trip to San Francisco (followed by a several night stay at another hotel in Union Square). We chose this hotel over several other similarly priced options through Expedia due to its proximity to transportation and other attractions. The hotel itself was clean and pleasant, the bed was comfortable. We didn't spend much time in the room, so it suited our needs fine. The surrounding neighborhood is not nearly as bad as many other reviews state (a little run down, but not unsafe). The major problem we had occurred on our second night, when it sounded like someone right outside our window was screaming the entire night. We chose a room in the back of the hotel thinking that the street noise in the front might be unpleasant, but that would probably be preferable to screaming, proselytizing homeless people (the screaming was some sort of sermon). I've lived in several major cities, and don't have a problem with normal city noise, but I feel this hotel would benefit tremendously from having better windows that help to insulate guests from things of this nature (since it's not possible for them to change the neighborhood completely).
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel is great for people that want to be close to transportation and attractions, without spending a fortune on a hotel room.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows, sound insulation
review.locationRemarks: It is a short walk to Union Square, very close to the Bart station and several buses/trains to take you anywhere in the city.

review.reviewText: Easy access to Union Square, tours, transport, good dining.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, newly refurbished, love the Twain theme.
review.locationRemarks: Great for access to Union Square, shopping, dining, tours and local transport to other areas.

review.title: Good Stay - Taylor St is very noisy
review.reviewText: Hotel was in good standing.  Check in agent was not very helpful with lunch recommendations as she could not think of a single place to recommend!  Lobby was nice.  We had to switch rooms our second night because we were initially facing Taylor St.  The noise was so bad we thought there were people fighting in our bedroom!  The second room was perfect though as we were facing indoors.  There is a perfect breakfast place right next door that we ate at both mornings.

review.title: Nice place, good value
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good value. It appears to be an old building with a fresh coat of paint. The elevator is very small, and the room has it's quirks, but it was comfortable for our 2 night stay. It isn't in the best neighborhood, but there were a few good restaurants and bars within walking distance, and the front desk was very helpful with recommendations and help with public transportations.
review.positiveRemarks: very helpful staff, nice overall decor.
review.locationRemarks: the location felt iffy at first. The front desk specifically told us not to walk past a certain area which made us hesitant to explore too far.

review.title: okay for price
review.reviewText: small room.  Cold showers.  Friendly staff.  Decent location, no issues with homeless

review.title: Hotel was nice
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The water for showers and baths was only warm not hot. There was no facial tissue and the toilet paper was too thin to substitute. There was no place to conduct business, like a small desk. I had to sit on a bench and put my computer on the table for the TV or the bed.
The restaurant in the hotel Fish & Farm had bad service and the food was only so so.

review.title: lacks privacy
review.reviewText: the neighbor's constant phone conversations can be heard clearly.
review.negativeRemarks: sound bolstering.  airvent in shower seems open to next room.  i am sure there are newer, better rooms.  But i didnt have a chance to stay in one.
review.locationRemarks: close to downtown and union square.  plenty of theatres, restaurants, offices nearby.

review.title: Good hotel but,
review.reviewText: This hotel is very good, but the neiberhood is a little busy.

review.title: Good medium-priced hotel
review.reviewText:
Well located, two blocks from Union Square.  An older hotel, but the rooms have been updated and modernized.  

We were initially directed to a room that was already occupied.  Then our lock was changed after two nights, although we were booked for three.

The restaurant was good, but not outstanding, and like everything else in San Francisco, was overpriced.

On the whole, we were well satisfied, but there is room for improvement.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff.  Restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Located close to main shopping district; close to BART, Muni and the cable car, and within easy walking distance of Van Ness Avenue attractions.

review.title: Just Par...
review.reviewText: The room overall is just about ok. I was shocked to see there were no toothpaste available. The wifi signals was ridiculous, I had to stand by the door to get anything. I also didn't know the location was situated in a so-call "Tenderloin" which means a rough area. I saw a lot of homeless people but it didn't trouble me at all.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the town centre. The front desk was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks:
- free toothpaste
- need to improve wifi signal
review.locationRemarks:
- The location was situated in a so-call "Tenderloin" which means a rough area.
- close to town centre.

review.title: Nice and clean. close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice and clean. Alex helped and gave a lot of information when we checked in. The hotel provides the free water in the lobby. The area is feeling safe when you go north and east sides from hotel. Close to Union Square, Market St, China town and Japanese town.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice and clean. close to Union Square

review.title: Decent for a single night stay
review.reviewText: Clean room, but small to be called "deluxe". Single pane windows... You can here every car horn and siren. Valet parking is a joke! They tell you 20-30 min to get your car.... More like 95 min plus $45 to park it.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Did not notice in our booking that the hotel did not have a/c, however, this was the hottest weekend in San Francisco (in the 90's).  I asked for a room on an upper floor, quiet and a view.  I got the upper floor, a view of the large hotel across the street and all the street noise, even with the windows closed.  The room was at the end of a hallway which had a door to the fire escape; the fire escape was across my windows, so I did not feel safe leaving the windows open, even though the largest one did not lock.  Thankfully, the room had a large ceiling fan.  The decor was nice.  Location okay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice and so was the bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Add better windows

review.title: Excellent Hotel.
review.reviewText:
The Mark Twain Hotel never pretends to be other than it is.  It is a hotel built long before Big Macs and Starbucks.  The windows open (no air conditioning) and you get a nice breeze. Newly updated (paint, carpet, etc.) the rooms are scrupulously clean!  If you want a little more space, choose one of the larger rooms. Yes, there is street noise in some of the rooms, but you are in a city, after all.    

The staff was helpful and breakfast items were plentiful (I grabbed a coffee, banana, and yogurt).  Food in the immediate neighborhood was good. There is a cafe next door that had a line down the street during the breakfast rush (got breakfast later, around 11:30, and it was quick, and excellent.  

There is a taxi stand across the street, and transit is close.  I didn't rent a car as it is expensive to house them, and you don't really need one in the city (parking in S.F. can be a challenge.)
review.positiveRemarks: It did not try to be a Best Western or any other place made out of plastic.  If you want that you will have to go elsewhere.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: It was a great location and nice room ... Clean and location was perfect

review.title: Nice hotel near union square!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel Saturday through Monday.  I called to see if they had a room available for us to check in early and they did. Room was great size. Bathroom was small and the toilet was loud when flushing but it wasn't a big deal. Room was clean staff was really friendly.  Word of advice if walking anywhere don't make a right when walking out of the hotel. Area on that side is a bit shady so avoid it if possible! My boyfriend and I walked to fisherman's warf and it took us about 40 min to get there not bad at all! Will definitely stay here again if the price is right!

review.title: Affordable hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Ask to stay on quiet side. Our first night was on street side and the noise was absolutely atrocious. Upon request, we were moved. It was much much better, but could still hear voices and noise from other guests quite audibly. Beds comfortable. Bathroom small. Not bad hotel for older building in San Fran. Don't expect luxury hotel because you'll be disappointed.

review.title: Nice alternative with great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a recent conference at the Hilton. The hotel was very reasonably priced and great value compared to the venue itself. It is centrally located and a short walk to everything. The elevator can be a little slow (it's 9 floors) so that may be a concern for some others.

review.title: Quirky hotel not so unlike the author
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a nice surprise. I had thought that it was located near Chinatown, but it turned out to be in the Tenderloin area. The area seemed kinda sketch at first cause there's a lot of homeless people nearby, but I got used to it pretty quickly. Hotel is actually not that big (approx. 4 floors with about 10-20 rooms per floor).  Decor is Mark Twain-themed; it looks very nice overall. The staff was very professional, prompt, and ready to help with whatever you need. If you have Kemal helping you out, you shouldn't have any problem at all.

Room wasn't big, but was clean and comfortable. Towels were actually soft, which deserves a big thumb-up from me. I also love the location of the hotel. Just a few blocks from Union Square and many shopping places; two decent eateries right next door (Million Thai and Taylor St Cafe); a deli/liquor store right around the corner, and a wine place across the street. Also, if you have been recommended by Frommer's to visit Glide Church, the church is only a few doors from the hotel's front door.

As for amenities, free internet (another plus)...and that's about it. No free breakfast, but no big deal. You're in San Francisco; go out for breakfast. Forget hotel's free food. As for parking, it's hard to find cheap parking near the hotel. Closest garage (across the street) charges $40/day so you might as well have your car valet parked at the hotel. It's certainly much more convenient. Just give the hotel 15-20 mins to get your car
review.negativeRemarks: Adjust water pressure for the sink's faucet.
review.locationRemarks: 3-4 blocks from the 30-Bus stop. 5-10 min walk to Union Sq. Good cafe and Thai restaurant next door.  Glide Church. Little Saigon on Larkin St nearby.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: This is not a luxury hotels. The rooms are not very large and the bathrooms are basic. Cable TV did not work during our stay and I wrote a note to the manager expressing my discontentment and I received a $20 credit as a compensation. This is a good hotel for an overnight stay in the center of San Francisco if you don't want to spend a fortune.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located close to Union Square, department stores, restaurants

review.title: very noisy
review.reviewText: Our room was on level 7 and we were able to hear the noises from the street very clearly throughout the entire night. Also, we were able to hear what the people were saying in the room next to us. Elevator is super small. It can maximum allow 4 adults with 2 small luggage only.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good. close to center of the Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Westfield Shopping Mall. Cable Car Turnaround Station. Cheese Cake Factory. Apple Store.

review.title: More like a 2 star
review.reviewText:
Typical older building so you get the thin walls. The Bed was comfortable however I could hear the toilet being flushed in the room above us then the maids started vacuuming early so I woke up pretty tired.
If your staying here I would request a room with a view because our view was a "Brick Wall"

review.title: Good! reasonable! Clean!
review.reviewText: Located about 1/2 mile from Moscone Center. On the edge of the "Tenderloin" so there were homeless but I never felt in danger. Staff was considerate and there was a metropolitan feel to the hotel with a number of guests from out of the country. Rates were very reasonable for this area of San Francisco where most hotels this good would cost 2 or 3 times as much.
review.negativeRemarks: The tub was slow to drain.
review.locationRemarks: Near to Moscone Center and downtown. Cable cars and the BART and other public transport options are close. Plenty of good restaurants to choose from!

review.title: Very homey. Great staff!!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay here.  The room was cozy and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been nice to have more than 3 or 4 channels, considering it is DirectTV.  There wasn't a desk to work at, but the big comfy chair was n
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants close by.  close to some of my customers.

review.title: Nice hotel with a good vibe
review.reviewText: Well designed spaces, nice detailing throughout.  Helpful staff and good to very good service.  We asked for some additional furniture for the room and received it almost immediately. We had a room overlooking Taylor street and if you are not a very very sound sleeper, you will be awakened many times by road noise and loud people.  The courtyard rooms are probably much quieter.  Even with the noise, we would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, nice space, interior design
review.negativeRemarks: Sound dampening should be invested in (thermal pane windows would do wonders).
review.locationRemarks: Union square and lots of shopping available.  Great food everywhere.

review.title: Cute hotel. Lacks ammenities.
review.reviewText: We booked without thinking to check for air conditioning. No air conditioning and no screen on our window that led out onto a landing where others could easily walk. We didn't feel safe leaving the window open to sleep because of this. There also wasn't a blow dryer. Blow dryer is a small thing, but there is usually one in most hotels. It was clean and comfortable except for the stuffiness because of no air conditioning. Probably won't stay there again.

review.title: Ideally situated for Cable Car and Union Square
review.reviewText:
Small, recently refurbished, helpful staff.
You can't choose your neighbours anywhere, but interlocking Deluxe rooms guarantee unwelcome insomnia from inconsiderate guest noise. Badly needs attention with soundproofing , and would not consider booking unless there is sealed room and no connecting doors.
review.negativeRemarks: The soundproofing of interconnecting rooms. The next door neighbours, if thoughtless , are virtually in your room with their conversation
review.locationRemarks: Cable car and Union Square, safe area for tourists, easy to hail cab, great Irish pub, Foleys, within yards

review.reviewText: Convenient price. Near to union square.  Breakfsst is not bad. Staff is helpful &friendly. I recommend this hotel to others.

review.contentCodes: CRMD REMOD PD NLI HMP MMD
review.title: In the Tenderlion District (Historic area)
review.reviewText:
The photographs do not depict the actual appearance of the hotel.  The Mark Twain was under-going extensive and much needed remodeling.  Elevator (very small) was usable half the time during our stay & had not been inspected in over a year and a half.  Expired late 2013.  The room was quaint with no HVAC.  A ceiling fan was provided for air circulation. Room was not cleaned upon our 3:30pm return & and front desk rep seemed annoyed when we inquired about it.

Toilet paper ran out (versus being supplied the day of cleaning) and needed to request that evening.

  The shower was the worst experience of all and unsafe.  The temperature fluctuated from scalding hot to cold, burning my girlfriend.  

This hotel was the absolute worst experience I've had and would not recommend.

review.title: Nice and Simple
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was more than polite upon our visit.  Our standard queen bedroom was bigger than we expected it would be.  The hotel was undergoing some renovations during our stay in the lobby area, but we were unaffected or bothered by it.  Only one small elevator, but it was suprisingly quick and efficient (we stayed on the 8th floor).  One thing I was a little bothered by is that the bathroom vents were connected to our neighbors room, so anytime we were in the bathroom or near it at the same time, we could hear each other almost too well.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice boutique hotel, quaint and affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: The privacy noise in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Right down the street from Union Square.  Just south of the hotel is a little sketchy, but not to the point where my wife or I felt unsafe.

review.title: Decent Hotel . . . Close to Union Square &Chinatow
review.reviewText: We had the hardest time booking a room for a same day room and was finally able to book this hotel. It's in the poorer part of town and there are a lot of homeless people. We had the hardest time with parking (read signs). Valet is $38 I believe (the next day we parked at a parking garage $25 for 24 hrs just around the corner). The room was okay. I didn't think it was worth $200 something for a night but I understood that San Francisco was expensive so our room was probably decent for the price. For the most part,  noise wasn't a problem, we didn't hear much from the neighbor's but the windows weren't that great. You can hear sirens and a bit of traffic but overall it was pretty quiet (we were not facing the streets so that might've helped). They do house keeping once a day. Bathroom was nothing special and there's no air conditioner but there's a ceiling fan. Union Square was right across from Macy's (a couple blocks walk) and I recommend doing a loop tour bus to just explore but be careful of who your tour guide is, some skip parts of the tour. I would probably stay here again as a third choice.
Nice staff, perfectly fine room, central location. No complaints!

review.title: Nice way station.
review.reviewText: Mad a late reservation.  It was around 11 or so but still was able to get a room the staff were present, but slow. Other than that, we got into are room, and, we were presently surprised. The hotel has had a recent face lift,  and it looks great, as well as clean. Oh yes there was something that struck me odd. In the bathroom there was a hole in the shower wall 5 hat looked like it was put there on purpose for vetting or something.  I could here other guest in the morning, and I was uncomfortable knowing that they as well could hear me.

review.title: Decent hotel, good prices
review.reviewText: The value us really good.  There is some early morning noise, garbage pick up in the back.  The rooms are really clean and safe.  The rooms are really big and spacious.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Good hotel for a short stay - we stayed 1 night and that was fine - well located for bars etc and within walking distance of many places.

review.title: Value for money hotel
review.reviewText:
Having read some dire comments from other travellers,  we were pleasantly surprised.  Sure, there are people on the streets,  but if you don't like that, don't go to San Francisco,  as they are all over town.
It's well located for downtown,  the staff were really helpful and the room was ok.
review.negativeRemarks: One caveat. When we received our car back from the concierge,  it was covered in bird droppings, and so it had just been left in the street overnight

review.title: OK hotel for an expensive daily rate.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was OK. The staff was great and very friendly. They did an upgrade on my reservation with out any extra cost. The room was very clean and neat. The wifi has no cost. They serve a 'continental' breakfast at the lobby. Recomendation.. don't have breakfast there!!!. The best option is to have breakfast next door. 
Overall the hotel was ok and very convenience, but it not worse it. $200 per night is way too much for clean sheets and wifi signal.

review.title: Nice location, remodel in progress
review.reviewText:
Our experience was good. Staff were really helpful and organised leaving luggage for an overnight stay at Yosemite. A remodel is in progress but again staff are honest, open and transparent about this.

In terms of the remodel my one piece of feedback would be that the safe and clothes shelves are generally higher up. As someone who is 5 ft 4 inches tall (about average for a woman) I was unable to reach the safe easily meaning I was reliant on my husband to get items for me.

We did also experience some noise with the radiator when the heating was on. Overall a good experience and the Hummingbird garden is a lovely extra but some parts could have been better.
review.negativeRemarks: The height of storage and the safe.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square was really close by as were all transport links.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: After reading all the horrible reviews on yelp we were ready for the worst, but it was a wonderful suprise to find a nice clean comfortable and very friendly place. Our trip to sf was a total success.

review.title: Nothing fancy.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a very basic experience, don't expect anything fancy. The rooms are clean and tidy but there are no drawers (not one!) and the wind noise is not stopped by the window. Also, some renovation is going on, which means elevator sometimes unusable, stairs with wet paint etc.

The staff could try a little harder. I asked if my clean laundry could be left in my room, but that was not possible. Also I was told my laundry would be complimentary because one day late, but actually only the "express charge" was complimentary (they made it express for me after it was late).
review.positiveRemarks: It's close to my work destination, Union Sq and the Powell BART stop. Please note that this is the heart of the Tenderloin.

review.title: A Hotel Butterfly Garden
review.reviewText: Be aware the hotel is under renovation and there is noise and dust and inconvenience until July 2014. Room lacked a chair to sit upon. Bathroom faucet ran constantly. No Kleenex. Coffee maker was a great addition for hot tea or coffee. Bathroom SO small that I had to move the door wide open to get in!!!! Front desk staff were remarkable and helpful. There is a butterfly garden attached which is serene and lovely. Location is three blocks from cable cars on Powell Street and Union Square. The Taylor St. Coffee Shop next door is great. Breakfast items are sold in hotel lobby also. This is an adequate hotel if you are visiting to see San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: A chair to sit upon in the rooms. A faucet that does not leak.

review.title: Hotel is in the area we wanted (Union Sq)
review.reviewText: The room was larger than we expected (our experience at other hotels was that they tended to be rather confining)
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and informative when we had questions about places we needed to find
review.negativeRemarks: It is hard to answer that as you were clearly going through a redevelopment stage throughout the hotel
review.locationRemarks: close to major shops and varied transport facilities. From our perspective very close to Alamo vehicle rental premises

review.title: Very bad surrounding area, do not stay here,
review.reviewText: There were homeless people and bums outside, very dangerous area, paid over $300 per night, NOT WORTH IT
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING

review.reviewText: Under renovation, smells terrible, looks terrible, and my room stared into a large apartment building. Thin walls, tiny elevator, and so on. Don't go here.

review.title: so that others/ everyone may know
review.reviewText: we have never been to san Francisco CA, but in view of my family's choice this time around we elected to pass over this beautiful city and we found out its a big error for every traveler not to stay here even for a day or two. It was so pleasant ,comfortable and very amusing how the city are being administered by professional people beginning from the place we have stayed, as you will know we choose the Hotel Mark Twain against any other hotels around because of the locations, the ambience ,security and the hospitality from the personnel down to the kind of rooms you offer,, it was very surprising we were able to have a nice room ,one of the cleanest and worthy to recommend to our friends and families too. The front desk are so wonderful people, they usually assist us in all or most of our needs, they are respectable. During our 3 days stay we can never ask for more and we are so glad we choose your Hotel. Being at the center of the city ,it keeps us from travelling far and kept our energy intact and were able to access to in from the place we are suppose to go to with ease and convenience. everything that we experience we can only attribute our amazing travel to the greatness of the city of san Francisco and the great service from Hotel Mark Twain. We will meet again and live again to your hotel next time around and we will scatter your good name hotel with our friends and acquaintances because you deserve to be our house away from home. Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel front desk personnel are so great, the room is nice and the location is perfect.The service when we run out of transportation was so great
review.negativeRemarks: Since you have undergone some reconstruction in your restaurant maybe that will help travelers who are tired to used it instead of going out.
review.locationRemarks: its perfect location nothing more.

review.title: One Sat night stay
review.reviewText: Little noisy on the Taylor st side, but still slept fine. Was perfectly adequate, the renovation is nice. The hotel is small but then it is older and it is SF. I would recommend it to others. Staff was very helpful and great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Info on Wifi. Otherwise nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Glide Memorial on Sun Am for service, plays and the newly gentrified Tenderloin hang outs like Hooker's for chai on Hyde and Woodruff.

review.title: Don't be fooled
review.reviewText:
I spent $200 for a one night stay, and they still charged me an additional $40 for parking. The employee at the front desk made me wait for ten minutes while he setup someone's wake up call. Does it really take ten minutes to do that?

The room was small, staff was rude, elevators were small, and the bathroom was small. It's really a depressing place to stay. Oh and there was no AC in the rooms.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near union square and not too far from the train station and shops. The hotel is quite old and needs to be renovated though.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay that is near Union Square and just minutes away from the Bart and public transportation. Nothing fancy, but safe and clean...

review.title: Quaint hotel at the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel with extremely friendly staff who were also helpful. Restaurant downstairs was welcoming offering a range of foods.
Good size room, comfortable room and clean.
No problems with the area at all! Walking distance to Union Square (less than 5 mins) and Fisherman's Wharf (about 20 mins and avoiding hills!).
Wonderful cafe next door for breakfast.
Would stay again.

review.title: close to Union Square and public transportation
review.reviewText: We were close to downtown activities, good restaurants, access to public transportation and cable car stops.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was outstanding in helping us find our way around SF. We were able to check in early and leave our luggage to pick up later.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and shopping and cable car turn around stop.

review.title: NIce hotel but do not walk on Taylor Street
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was very nice and staff were helpful. I found the room to be a little small but overall nice. My family and I encountered several questionable people on Taylor. If you take other streets to leave and access hotel, you will be fine. I left a few expenseive electronic items by mistake and the hotel staff retrieved them and shipped them to me! Many thanks to the staff at Mark Twain!
review.negativeRemarks: Get a new elevator:)
review.locationRemarks: Avoid walking down Taylor street. The Westfield mall is nearby along with several restaurants and bars,

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Stayed at hotel mark twain for one night. Overall it was a big enough hotel for the 3 of us. Had a good size bathroom and a good size closet. It was near downtown which was a big plus. So much better than the other hotel we stayed at before! The gentleman that checked us in was very nice and friendly. I got charged for parking even though we didn't have a car but it was fixed right away and the gentleman who checked us out was very nice and apologetic about it. I recommend this hotel!

review.title: Decent location, but too expensive for the quality
review.reviewText:
I do believe that is paid too much for the hotel quality. Tiny elevator, outdated room, uncomfortable bed, outdated bathroom and no AC. The window did not even have a screen, So I couldn't leave the window open. I did open the indie briefly, to air out the smell jn the room, however, I had to hold it up with a bottle. Bar tenders are also rude! I sat there for five minutes and they couldn't tell me they were closed.

Definitely not worth the price!

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. We walked to the night clubs and had easy access to transportation. Liquor stores close by. Bar in lobby + restaurant on premises. Quiet room. Would stay here again.

review.title: Hotel Mark Twain - I wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText:
The good: staff were friendly, hotel is near union square, free WiFi

The bad: no water pressure in the shower to speak of with water peridically scalding me at random intervals. Rooms got very hot at night - there is no AC, just a ceiling fan. If you open the windows (no screens), there's lots of outside noise and other room noise, walls are paper thin. Other guests were very loud. Elevator is so small if you have more than 4 in your group, you need to go up and down in stages, so ask for a room on the second floor so you can take the steps. Not a very safe area of town with large numbers of vagrants and aggressive pan handlers/beggars (don't turn right out of the hotel, or you won't be in a safe area - always head towards the Hilton Hotel towards Union Square). Could barely fit my feet on the stairs. Suspected blood stain on sheets. False advertising on webpage - no Bowflex weights in fitness centre and no lemonade in lobby.

review.title: Decent Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and helpful. A broken toilet seat was replaced in a timely manner.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were all great. The facilities were clean. The bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Recommendation to hotel management: please replace sink faucet and toilet with low-flow devices in order to conserve water. Shower flow was low flow
review.locationRemarks: The hotel location is at the edge of the Tenderloin district, so I recommend walking to Union Square via O'Farrell rather than Ellis St.

review.title: Really enjoyed the hotel.
review.reviewText: I stayed 4 days and 3 nights. The location is great. The elevator is small but I used the steps. Loved having a refrig. and coffee pot. I slept good. The bed was comfortable and not being on the road made for a quiet night. They have a small but great workout room and a cute peaceful courtyard to sit and enjoy a glass of wine. Really for the price it is a good deal. Norstroms Rack is 3 blocks away across the street from Norstroms.
review.negativeRemarks: Little update in bathroom and clean better.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to union Square and downtown shopping. I walked to the ferry building. Close restaurants that are great. love the Irish pub.

review.title: A Roomy old style Hotel with Comfort
review.reviewText:
The entire staff is exceptional, bar tenders, front desk, managers, house keeping. The property is close walking distance to Union Square and many diverse restaurants, but when you head out the front door, turn Left. Turning Right will lead you to the homeless, beggars, drugs, and chauffeur drivers relieving themselves for your entertainment. There's no avoiding the 'colorful' San Francisco characters talking to themselves and violently acting out, but as "they" say, City Hall likes them because they provide entertainment.... and they are everywhere.
My only problem was a 'cold water' hallway pipe that chattered through the night and kept me awake. When I asked to have my room changed, I was told I needed to make the request before noon, it was 12:20.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, old style, but room to wander....check out the hummingbird garden with your morning coffee on the ground floor.
review.negativeRemarks: $2.00 morning coffee when you can walk a block and get a real large coffee for $1.98 Forget the in-room coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq., Cable Car turntable, Historic Buildings, 1859 earthquake,The FLOOD building, FLWright design, Weinstein Gallery.

review.title: A historic hotel with quirks
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Mark Twain has both the charm and shortcomings of a structure built to obsolete standards. The rooms are smaller than average for a modern hotel, comfortable for one but maybe less so for two. Closet space is substantial. The bathrooms have been updated but rely on windows for ventilation. Heat is provided by steam-type radiators, and air circulation by ceiling fans. High ceiling can actually make he rooms feel smaller. Windows have been replaced with modern, operable metal sash units and are are shuttered rather than curtained. The small elevator is rated for eight passengers, but they would have to be very fond of each other to ride together. Three would be a comfortable maximum.

The Tenderloin District has a fair number of street people. The sounds of all-night traffic and other activity are hard to exclude, and may be distracting to anyone unused to urban life. Wi-Fi was included with the room, and was okay for email but slow on image intensive social media and inadequate for streaming even radio feeds.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much. A building this age always has issues and can't really be rehabilitated to fully modern standards.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient to Market Street, several good restaurants, a few museums and a BART station if you don't mind walking a few blocks.

review.title: Problems with personal service
review.reviewText: Left item. Unable to get it returned by mail because paperwork wouldn't download on Ipad. Had to go out of my way to pick it up. Not fun on vacation to be treated like this
review.negativeRemarks: More personal service. No one wanted to help, jut follow procedures

review.title: mark twain hotel in san francisco
review.reviewText:
The location was great and the staff was also wonderful. I stayed two days at the beginning of my trip and stayed in room 703 and at the end of my trip 216 - 703 was fine however room 216
the bathroom door opens in so if you weight more that 120 lbs its a tight squeeze between the sink and the door and the toilet. I believe that they will be in the process of renovating.
review.positiveRemarks: location was great right across from the Hilton
review.negativeRemarks: The renovation should take care of all the issues
review.locationRemarks: Union square, chinatown, northbeach all within walking distance - bart easy transpotation from the hotel to the airportbes

review.title: Under renovation
review.reviewText:
The hotel was under renovation when we were there. Walls were super thin and even if we whispered the staff kept telling us to hush. We were loud at first but when they told us to tone down, we did and they still think we were too noisy.
Room, toilet and elevator were small.
Location was good.
Valet parking for $38 and it was only until 2pm was quiet expensive. We thought it would be a 24hr thing. Although it's $38 in and out.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nicer than I expected. You can tell that it has been newly remodeled and it looks amazing. From the entrance to the lobby and the bar. The elevator is really small and when I say small, I mean it is so small claustrophobia sets in. I understand the smallness of it because the hotel is old. At least it moves really fast. Getting into our rooms, I was a tad surprised because of how nice the downstairs was in comparison to the room. Don't get me wrong, the room was clean and prepared nicely, I was just expecting it to be similar to the situation downstairs. The big flat screen was nice, the bathroom was standard, and the beds were comfy.
The only thing that that was a downer for me was the $43 a night mandatory valet parking.
All the staff that I encountered during my stay were very nice and professional.
Would recommend this hotel because of the location. It is a short walk to Market Street & BART stations. I did not feel uncomfortable with the location in terms of feeling safe.
review.positiveRemarks: The design, theme, and overall look. It definitely has a lot of character.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe updating the bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Market St., BART stations, bars/clubs, shopping, dining.

review.title: Great service and location
review.reviewText: Staff repeatedly went out of their way to help find restaurants, forward phone messages, show routes on the map, store bags, offer BART advice. The suggested breakfast next door was such a winner we ate there both days. And the hotel location is great.

review.title: Not bad at all
review.reviewText: This hotel is a decent place to rest your head. It's an older hotel that with some TLC could be even better. It's close to the theater we were attending and we didn't feel unsafe at all.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: They were remodeling and the bathtub was full of dust.

review.title: This hotel sucks
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 4 nights. Sound from your neighbor's room easily travels through the paper thin walls and underneath the door jam. Really easy to hear what's going on in the next room, which is terrible. Carpet in the room is really sketchy; I cringed at the idea of walking around barefoot.

Do yourself a favor and book another hotel. There are lots of other hotels in the sub-$175 price range in SF, and I'll take my chances with another hotel than book this again.

The only pluses are (1) I didn't get bed bugs and (2) There's a nice restaurant/bar called Jaspers across the street that does real good cocktails and burgers.

review.title: Conveniently location of hotel
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is conveniently located in downtown San Francisco, just across the street from Hilton hotel and 2 blocks away from shopping haunts Macy's, Barney's, Sephora and the famous Cheesecake Factory. Fantastic location, considering price of hotel. There were many homeless people wondering outside the hotel though. Not recommended for single lady traveler, especially if you are Asian. Front desk staff are generally nice and helpful except for Baji. She was very impatient and didn't make the effort to help us. Simple question of time period of carpark charges, ie. from what time till what time, was met with repetitive "if you park your car overnight, you'd be charged for just 1 night.". There are cheaper parking alternatives elsewhere and we wanted to maximise the overnight parking charge. When we collected the car at 6pm, we were informed that we would still be charged for 1 night, or any additional hours that we require parking. We were stumped. If she told us that overnight carpark charges were till 2pm, regardless of whether we checked out of hotel or not, we would have retrieved our car before 2pm. To our dismay, we paid for more expensive parking when we found elsewhere that was at half the cost. This being said, we were disappointed with her service attitude. The other 2 front desk ladies whom my roommate & I met were very helpful and nice and made us feel as welcomed as possible and with smiles too. Now that is a very comforting sight after flying 20 hours.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, convenience and general cleanliness of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk service standard of Baji. Everything else was good, considering price of hotel paid. Parking is expensive, but there are cheaper options.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located in downtown San Francisco to many shopping and eating places, Chinatown. Public transport all within short walking distances

review.title: Expected more, got less. . .
review.reviewText: Temps in the 40's at night. My room stayed that way as well. Found out the next morning there was an open window in the bathroom opened that I did not notice upon my late arrival. Not sure why it was open, and why there was no screen on it. Radiator heator in room could not keep up. Second night, room was warm, but by morning was very cold again. Mentioned to staff and they provided a floor heater. Long black hair on first towel I was going to use, and I'm blond. Ugh . . . Bed was comfortable, but you can hear any/all noise outside throughout the night. Great location in downtown though. Staff was very helpful, but that is about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Need thermastat in room to control air temp. . . . Better housekeeping . . . .
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and Chinatown by foot. Not far from the Warf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square via taxi or the cable car.

review.title: Old but clean hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a comfortable stay at the Mark Twain. If you like old hotels this is one that for the price provides clean rooms which is a must for us. The location is on the edge of the Tenderloin but is close to Union square. It is around the corner from the Hilton. Staff was excellent. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The price and location were reasonable
review.negativeRemarks: The rug in the room needed to be upgraded but overall condition was clean
review.locationRemarks: Around the corner from the Hilton, 5-10 minutes to Union Square and shopping areas. It's close to the Tenderloin which can be tough

review.reviewText: The front desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Maid service was good.
review.positiveRemarks: The traditional "old style" doors, stairways, woodwork, and other features. The location was very convenient to Union Square & a BART station.
review.negativeRemarks: Air circulation in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, BART, Moscone Center, John's Grill (outstanding!)

review.title: I cancelled and sill got charged.
