review.title: Mark Twain gets 2 stars
review.reviewText: This hotel really deserves a two star rating since when we got there the room showed a hotel that was very old and dilapidated in places. The stairs themselves are substandard and not made for large feet. There was no air conditioning and so the only way to relieve the constant heat coming into the room was to open the windows. Unfortunately everyone else was doing that and we had to put up with a variety of unacceptable sounds coming from other rooms. We were not pleased and will not stay at this hotel again. The hotel is also right next to a homeless shelter which placed my wife in the occasional awkward position of having to "defend" herself from pan handlers who were unwilling to take a NO the first, second, or third time.
review.negativeRemarks: Demolish it and build a new one.

review.title: Clean and modern, not too loud

review.title: Noisy, expensive
review.reviewText: We are seasoned travelers and knew it would be noisy and sketchy in the Tenderloin. But no hot water? No heat? Come on!

review.title: Nice rooms but staff was sometimes rude
review.reviewText: Title
review.negativeRemarks: Politeness of staff

review.title: Disgusting

review.title: very good location

The hotel is located 3 short blocks from the square.Christmas tree was up, skating rink. Many tourists. We walked to Chinatown, North Beach, took the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf. Weather was great. review.title: Average experience
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was wonderful - friendly and helpful. Location of hotel was just on the edge of riff-raff. We were told by our driver when we first got there to not turn right out of the hotel lobby, only turn left and he was correct. We never felt frightened, but there were some questionable characters roaming nearby. We just ignored them and we were fine. For the price, it was comfortable enough as we weren't in the room very much anyway. The room was a little small as was the bathroom, but it's an old building that's been modified so we weren't expecting much more than that. All in all, an average experience.

review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and size of room fine. Only major complaint was the heating situation. When we arrived, it was very cool out,much cooler than we expected,yet heat was minimal. Then two days later the weather warmed up very much but my last nite I spent tossing and turning not only because the heat was on all nite,but the steam heat noise was extremely loud. I called the front desk at around 2 or 3 AM, but was told system was on a timer. I find that hard to believe if I had too little heat when needed and way too much when it warmed up. There needs to be a way for one to control heat in room to suit ones own needs. Also bathroom was very nice, but needs its own access to heat also, found it way to cold the first two days there. Hope this helps your may improvements needed.

Open the front door, and the hotel was in a rough neighbourhood. Overall, I wouldn't recommend.

review.negativeRemarks: entire hotel needs updating

review.title: Nice staff
review.reviewText: The location was great and the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. Their pleasantness can't be faulted one bit for the condition of the accommodations. The hotel was built decades ago and there are only so many upgrades one can do without major renovation, which it seems has not happened for the rooms, the one tiny elevator that might fit 4 with a somewhat tight fit, or the hallways which have water pipes running the length of ceilings. Funny, but I kept looking at the hotel pictures on line and comparing those to what I saw, especially in the room and concluded the on line pictures had to be airbrushed with staging of furniture and bedding not indicative of what I had to settle for. If there were other rooms available in nearby hotels, I would have checked out.

review.title: Old hotel.
review.reviewText: Old hotel. Some charm. Nice restaurant. Rooms were small. We had room on street side. Terrible noise at all hours of night. Not far from shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Can walk to shopping, near transportation

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is close to everything and reviews I have read previously about the area were misleading. I had read that there were a lot of homeless sitting outside and around the hotel, this really isn't true and is no worse than any other major city I have stayed in.

The rooms were ok but could definitely use some deep cleaning, also I would recommend asking for a room at the back of the hotel as the windows are very thin and you can hear a lot of street noise, including street cleaning at 6am.

The breakfast spot next to the hotel is a must and don't be turned off by the long line, it moves quickly.

The elevator is VERY slow so would suggest using the stairs if you can.

review.title: Good hotel near the Tenderloin
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a week's stay at the Mark Twain and would happily recommend. On the fringes of the Tenderloin / Theater District it's just a couple of blocks from the Powell St cable car turnaround, F Line Streetcars and Bart connections without having to walk through some of the grittier areas of the neighborhood. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Fee wifi connection with a decent speed, in room fridge, spacious room and Mark Twain quotes dotted throughout the building - a nice touch.

The hotel is located on the border of tourist area and poverty stricken Tenderloin. So turn the wrong way and you are immediately confronted by homeless people sleeping on the streets. On the other hand, tourist hotspots such as Union Square are just 5 minutes walk away.

review.title: Close to Union Square

The concierge helped me find a shop to buy new shoes I had forgotten at home and the bartender kept the small, comfortable lounge area jovial with good service and new drink ideas. My stay was quite pleasing though short in duration.

review.title: Nice character hotel

review.title: Small old fashioned boutique rooms

review.title: Very small and outdated.
review.reviewText: This appears to be an older bulding that was renovated into a Hotel. The decor is very outdated. Rooms are very small and furniture is old and not in good condition. No air conditioner, just a ceiling fan. Bathroom is also very small making it hard to move around. There is only 1 very smal elevator, so you may need to wait for some time to use. Stairways are very narrow and steep. The Hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. This was just not a comfortable hotel. If you have an extended stay I would recommend the Marriott or Hotel Nikko arround the corner.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the uppolstery in the bulding. Definately add air conditioning. Update the funiture.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is in an ok area. I felt safe at the location. Distance to shopping and the restaurants is only a few blocks. I would recommend Tom Foley's.

I found that it is best to walk rather briskly to avoid getting accosted by pan handlers and vagrants that are evident in this area. Hotel was clean, staff very polite and helpful with a number of excellent restaurants close by. There is a great wine store less than a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: The location being close to shopping and the cable car system.
review.negativeRemarks: The city of SF needs to put more effort into controlling the amount of panhandling in this area of the city.
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants, high end shopping,

review.title: Good price, not so good hotel.
review.reviewText: I read the reviews and knew that it was close to the tenderloin district; however, I was not prepared to be harrassed everytime we left the hotel. Even right outside the front door, we were harrassed daily for cigarettes and money and the hotel even had to call the police once. Also, the website photos deceiving and were clearly taken a LONG time ago.
review.positiveRemarks: It was within walking distance of a lot of places.
review.negativeRemarks: Stairs and hallways need to be vacuumed. The walls in the rooms need to be cleaned. World's smallest elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and a nice walk to the wharf if you don't mind walking up hill a bit.

review.title: Professional
review.reviewText: Professional front desk and room staff. Every aspect as billed.
review.positiveRemarks: Very well managed. Everyrhing as expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Radiator heater a little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to just about everything I was interested in.

review.title: Recommended choice for an older, original SF hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed at this property 10 consecutive days. Check-In was welcoming and flawless. The front desk staff was one of the best staff I have ever experienced in all my days of traveling! Elevator to room is small, can handle about 4 people (no luggage). My room contained 2 double beds which were clean and contained lots of pillows for comfort. Rooms size was good, but the bathroom is smaller than most. An open closet contained two garment rods with an in room safe that uses a physical key to lock it. Bathroom was clean, plenty of towels, and the usual provided toiletries. Sink area is very small but functions well enough. Shower height was excellent for me, I'm 6'2 and it was above me! Plenty of hot water; yet when someone else uses cold water the shower temp goes up. Room was a comfortable temperature. A ceiling fan and radiator controls additional comfort. Nothing is perfect in older hotels, so if I had to list drawbacks I would say the carpeting was very worn and dated. Walls are thinner than most so loud neighbors can be heard (yet I had no trouble in getting proper rest). Water running through pipes is louder that most. The city block the hotel is located on is uneventful, but a simple block or two walk changes that. Overall I usually book the chain hotels as I feel the comfort in them, however I was extremely impressed with my Mark Twain hotel experience and would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The kindness of the hotel staff! Management, housekeeping, and front desk were pleasant and helpful to all my needs!
review.negativeRemarks: More variety in the TV channel lineup. (TV offers all Major Networks, and lots of sports channel coverage). Newer carpeting would be a plus.
review.locationRemarks: Older area, a bit worn at street level, however within a few blocks you have excellent access to shopping, transportation, and restaurants.

review.title: Good hotel with great staff in s Not good area.

review.title: union square hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Mark Twain for one night. We stay in the city quite often and have stayed in many different hotels. This one really dirty and not kept up. The carpet was dirty and bathroom was really old with chipped paint. It is in a good location, but not a great place to stay for the money.

review.title: Right in the Center of it All
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain is in a central and convienent location, just a few blocks to Union Square. It is not a fancy hotel, but it is completely acceptable for all, including families. The staff was friendly and efficient.

review.title: Perfectly adequate, budget hotel in San Francisco.

Across the street from the Hilton, and next door to Glide Church. You know, the church with the homeless shelter where Will Smith and his son stayed, in the movie, "The Pursuit of Happyness." Facilities and rooms were clean; not immaculate.

review.title: Nice hotel in an ok location.

The area where the hotel is located is only 3 blocks from union square, but if you make a left instead of a right on the street just past the hotel you are in "The Tenderloin", not a good area!! Overall a nice stay, and would recommend this hotel.

review.negativeRemarks: valet service fee waived

review.title: Less than welcoming first impression
review.reviewText: We made our reservations over a month prior to our stay. We booked 2 rooms for our family. When we checked in, we were told the only remaining rooms that matched our reservations were on the 2nd and 8th floors. We were approached by many of the drunks in front of the hotel when we checked in which made us feel a little apprehensive about our security at the hotel. The front desk did not do much to calm our apprehensions.
review.positiveRemarks: The historic aspect of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Post security at the front door to elicit a feeling of welcoming and safety.
review.locationRemarks: We drove down to Fisherman's Wharf so I do not know the things near by to see and do.

review.title: A little dated for the money
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain hotel experience was a 3/ 5 for the trip. If you strictly wanted a place to lay your head for the night, this is for you. I thought for $ 242.00 for a night and an additional 33$ plus tax to vale your car in a car lot was a bit much for this dated hotel. Next time, we will look for a place that already has its own parking and is a little more modern.

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient
review.reviewText:
My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Mark Twain Hotel and enjoyed it. Our daughter lives nearby on Sutter St. and several of her favorite restaurants were within easy walking distance. We also liked the Taylor St. Coffee Shop next door and ate there every morning for breakfast.

The staff at the Mark Twain was very friendly, and they were quick in responding to messages for us left by our daughter. And even though this is an older hotel, the room and bathroom amenities are up-to-date, and the location near to restaurants, night spots, and theatres is favorable.
review.positiveRemarks: The Mark Twain theme, the cleanliness, the friendliness of the staff, and the location were th things we liked most.
review.negativeRemarks: Room rates are a little pricy, and noise can be a problem at night. Also, another elevator would be helpful to reduce waiting at busy times of day.
review.locationRemarks: This is covered in the first section above.

review.title: Great value and great location
review.reviewText: The common areas are in pretty sad shape... stair-well, hallway, etc. But, the room was in just as good of shape as any mainstream chain I've stayed in. Check in was a bit painful as they wore terribly under staffed for the load that walked in. Very friendly though. I'd say it'd get rated a 4 if they invested in their common areas but at the end of the day I couldn't care less as long as the rooms are nice. Some reviews mention homeless people - umm it's a major city and that's just kind of par for the course. I didn't have any concerns. So I'd say if you want a great location at a good price this is a good option.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilets could be upgraded - 1940's round bowl not so good. And if possible, freshen up the carpets in the hallways and stairwell at a minimum

review.title: Close to trains and shopping
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. Small rooms but otherwise cheerful and accommodating .

review.title: No Frills Stay.
review.reviewText:
The first thing we noticed upon arrival, were all of the homeless beggars out front, begging for money. When we checked in, some people received vouchers for meals, but we did not. The room was very basic, and we had to have the windows open at all times, due to no air conditioning. Room service skipped us the first full day, and after asking several times for towels, we had to go to the front desk and demand them.

Next time we are in San Francisco, we will stay somewhere else.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff needs to be more attentive when asked to provide services that are routine at all hotels.
review.locationRemarks: This is in a bad neighborhood! We were warned not to "take a right" out of the hotel, due to the vast homeless population.

review.title: Close to Transportation, stores and restaurants.
review.reviewText: The room had no air-conditioning, and luckily it was cool when we were there. We had to sleep with the windows and blinds open, and ceiling fan running to get air moving. The bathroom was extremely small, with no exhaust fan. The walls weren't very sound proof, as we could hear our neighbors easily through the walls. There was garbage laying on the floors in the hallways. They had a small continental type breakfast, but had to pay for even the coffee, which was disappointing to me. The bar staff and restaurant hostess were very pleasant and friendly. There were panhandlers, and people sleeping on the sidewalks. We needed two beds, and did get that at no extra cost, just an older hotel. If I visited again, I would pay more for a nicer hotel, and stay by Fisherman's Wharf, where most activities were taking place, and better choice of restaurants and shops.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to buses, and cable cars, and the visitor information center. The bar staff, and restaurant hostess were very nice, and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast should be free, or at least the coffee. They put bottles of water in the room, but charge if you drink them.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, and transportation,

review.title: Not exactly Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Would not go out after dark. Had a trucking co. Loading what sounded like dumpsters til after midnight. On the edge of skid row.
The room was OK but the carpets looked original and were very thin.
Will be real reluctant to accept a 3 stare rating again.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything to be a S F hotel

review.title: Ok Hotel in San Francisco, But Needs A Renovation!
review.reviewText:
Positive: close to Moscone convention center where I was attending a conference, close to downtown, very helpful and pleasant staff

Negative: sketchy neighbourhood, hotel very old needs an upgrade, got a room with a view of a graffiti wall and emergency stairs, bad sound insulation, could hear phone conversation int he other room

Overall ok hotel if all the other hotels are booked, but for the price I was paying, could have gotten better. The service was excellent though. Armanda, especially, was very polite and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad sound insulation, no privacy
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, but bad neighbourhood

review.title: Not What we are used to in SF
review.reviewText: Ok hotel, but for the money you should move over a few streets...less mess! There is no air conditioning and the room was warm in SF...don't figure! Beds hard, but younger son liked it! It was worth a try, but for the cost I would recommend staying elsewhere. The staff was very nice, but the hotel is very old and needs updating. The bathroom very inconvenient too with no room for one, let alone two trying to get ready in the am.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the hotel rooms
review.locationRemarks: Not too far from downtown

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Loved it, first time traveling, this location was perfect
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really, it was perfect
review.locationRemarks: The mall was only a couple blocks away

review.title: Cool older hotel close to the action
review.reviewText: We were well looked after and any requests were taken care of in a positive manner. Room was very clean, bed was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location. Free internet was GREAT! All staff were positive and helpful!
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants including fabulous Taylor Street Cafe (the best breakfast value in town). Short walk to main shopping area and public transit.

review.title: Good place within close distance with everything
review.reviewText: My experience with the hotel was overall good. I didn't spend too much time in my room but I always came back to a nice clean room. The bed I slept on was pretty comfy. The t.v. was o.k though I only watched the news in the morning, the remote control didn't work like I expected it to, but I could have probably asked for assistance if I really needed it. The staff was pretty friendly, they offered any assistance to get around in San Francisco and places to visit. The sink and bathtub in the bathroom were nice to use and the water was really nice on my skin. They also had a mini fridge in the dresser of the room that was nice to have. I don't have anything to say about breakfast services but they are next to a place called Fish and Farm, I tried a burger from there and it was not too bad at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square, bars, clubs and access to transit system. The room space was good. Good staff.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Great hotel. Convenient loction.
review.reviewText: Thank you Expedia. Everything was perfect. Very convenient location.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good service. Only downside is that the washroom sink was small, but I still managed. Everything else was good. The hotel is located just far enough from where all the homeless were so there was no trouble avoiding them.

review.title: Good Hotel and Location for San Francsico
review.reviewText: Location is good for car rentals, cable cars and muni. People at the front desk were very helpful and cheery. Elevator was small and rooms were somewhat noisy as you could hear people in the neighboring rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and it was very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level of neighboring rooms and take out the radiators!
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to shopping, restaurants, cable cars and muni. Lot of homeless people verbally accosting you if you went down hill later in the day.

review.title: Nice Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: A tough but convenient area of San Francisco. Not my first choice but a decent hotel. I like the older hotels and this one was a surprise considering where it is located. The restaurant was above average and the service very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Near the Tenderloin and all the homeless

review.title: Good value for the location
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel, especially considering the price. Location was very close to the hotel where I was attending a conference, but much cheaper than the conference hotel rate. Room was a good size, since I got an accessible room, bathroom was roomy, and bed was comfortable. There's no air conditioning, but the windows open, so it was fine for the end of May. Elevator is teeny, so if you have a lot of bags, be prepared to take a couple trips!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of elevator, panhandlers near hotel entrance (not too bad though)
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square, many restaurants, BART

review.title: Not fancy but definitely nice
review.reviewText:
I booked the hotel first and then read most of the reviews, and got scared to the degree I almost cancelled my reservation. I am glad I did not.
My stay was very pleasant. It is an older hotel and it is somewhat outdated, but I guess one cannot expect more from the historic building in older part of the town. Overall, the hotel was very clean and bed was comfortable. I noticed some complaints about the noise level in the reviews, but I did not have any issues with noise at all. I guess some people have wrong expectations from the phrase "boutique hotel." It is not "boutique" in a fancy sense, but rather an intimate establishment. If you want something glamorous for romantic getaway, it may be a wrong place. But this hotel certainly serves its purpose of accommodating reasonable traveler for few nights.
Few words regarding the neighborhood. I love walking and I am a female traveling alone. I did not feel myself threatened in the hotel vicinity. I talked to the people at the reference desk and they advised me that there is a soup kitchen for homeless about two blocks down the street, and this is where the trouble is. So, I new exactly what cross-road I should avoid and I did. Other than that, it may be not a swanky area of the town, but it is relatively clean and safe. In the evening, I walked about a block toward the downtown to meet some friends at the local bar and then back to the hotel without an incident.

review.title: Good central location near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Good standard hotel in a good central location. Room was comfortable and well appointed.
review.locationRemarks: Adjacent to Union Square and good for transport links.

review.title: My bad experience here.
review.reviewText: The neighbourhood this hotel is located at is simply bad. The hotel itself is very old and not kept in good condition. The rooms are tiny and old. The elevator hardly fits two people. Their staff is okay. Checked into this hotel at midnight and checked out in about 8 hours although I booked this hotel for two nights.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition, location, cleanness and pretty much anything else
review.locationRemarks: Simply bad.

review.title: character hotel in heart of SF
review.reviewText:
we were very happy with the Hotel Mark Twain. Great location, easy to find our way around. The front desk staff were always helpful.
Our room was a decent size and comfortable beds. Very large closet! Huge in fact.
Free Wifi and in room safe was a bonus. Cheery bar in the lobby. Interesting character filled hotel. Lots of Mark Twain sayings scattered around.
We would stay there again if visiting SF
review.negativeRemarks: elevators were a bit slow
review.locationRemarks: very handy to Union Square, shops and restaurants.

review.title: Great location , Union Square, China Town
review.reviewText: The Hotel is in a very good location, for Union Square , China Town, and it across from the Hilton that you can catch any of the sightseeing buses . right at the door . very nice place .. would use this Hotel again !

review.title: Conveniently located right in downtown
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel if you're looking for a hotel that's convenient to everything especially in downtown. It falls in between the tenderloin/union square. A boutique hotel.

review.title: Central location close to everything.
review.reviewText: We had stayed here on a previous occasion and everything was wonderful. However, this time our room was not cleaned when we returned from a day of shopping. We settled for clean linen and emptying of the trash. Remote control did not work and had to wait a full day to have it replaced. The hotel is within walking distance to Union Square, shopping, and theaters. Downstairs Bar staff was friendly. I will give this hotel another chance.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of rooms.

review.title: Homeless Shelter!
review.reviewText: We checked in and were greeted by a gentleman with hardly any english skills. Room was nasty, dirty and the TV stand was leveled with random pieces of wood. DO NOT VALET PARK!!!!! I caught the valet speeding with my car in the area of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing really. I moved to the Hilton next door for the same rate thats what I liked.
review.negativeRemarks: Re-Train front of house staff

review.title: Old without character
review.reviewText: Hotel is very run down and seedy. It is olld without character. There are layers and layers of paint every where.

review.title: Nice place for the price and location
review.reviewText: I stayed at Hotel Mark Twain for the Google I/O conference, which is held at the Moscone Center. The hotel was located within a mile of the Moscone Center, Bart, and also nice shops and restaurants. When I walked in, I wasn't impressed by the decor or the small bathroom, but it was very comfortable and welcoming. The staff was really hospitable and friendly, not to mention well priced for the location!

review.title: Good price, but will sacrifice some quality
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, definitely a good price for the area. However, this is an old hotel, which gives it some charm but also has some unusual features. For example, you will be able to hear EVERYTHING from your room. Meaning toilets flushing and showers running in the rooms around you, talking in the hallways and the rooms. Also, each room has a radiator. Anyone who is familiar with a radiator knows that they make a lot of noise, so just be prepared to hear some unusual noises in the middle of the night. Definitely kept us awake at times. We also had a mishap where our radiator began spewing hot water. There was no maintenance at the time (this was the middle of the night) so our only option was to switch rooms. In switching rooms, we woke up about everyone on our hallway (hence the comment about the extremely thin walls) to their annoyance. Overall, not a bad hotel...but definitely be prepared to sacrifice some quality for the history.

review.title: Call it charming or old, it has a great location
review.reviewText:
Call it charming, or call it old. The room, furnishings and bedding was clean and well kept. The free Wifi internet worked well on the fourth floor. But some areas for improvement: No matter which way I turned the handle on the old radiator in the corner, the room was too cold, though I'm sure a call to the lobby would have helped me figure it out. The tiling in the bathroom, while spotless, was not the smooth marble of newer hotels; it was the orange tones of yesteryear. Traffic noise will be distracting to light sleepers.

Others note the homeless shelter on the block. But the Hilton is also across the street. The homeless kept to themselves and did not ask for anything here.

The hotel is in a nice location, with the Moscone centre and Metreon a few blocks away. If you want a good workout, you can take a scenic 40 minute walk north to the Fisherman's wharf, but be warned that it is near-vertical the entire way. Saner individuals would take the cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: Cold, unable to adjust radiator
review.locationRemarks: Across the road from the Hilton, the Moscone Center is few blocks away.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay!
review.reviewText: Was surprised at how old the hotel is, but, it does have a lot of character. We enjoyed our stay. A lot of homeless people in the area but, you could stay at the Hilton acros the street and you would still have to see that. Lots to see and do in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent. The experience was very nice. This was my first stay in SF, so finding a hotel location in a good area was not easy. This hotel is just north of some of the not so nice areas, but I never felt unsafe.

review.title: Good staffs, good location
review.reviewText: The staffs were very useful and friendly. However, the hotel is quite old and has a smell. Location is other best thing. You can go union square, downtown, or public transportation in minutes walking. Definitely come back here next time.

review.title: Great hotel for a reasonable price!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! Perfect location, very central to a lot of sights. It was in a safe area with nice restaurants nearby. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and quiet. The room faced the back so we didn't have any street noise. I was very pleased with this hotel. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for anyone staying in San Francisco!

review.title: Not Bad but with a few warnings
review.reviewText: Good enough for what you pay, Staff was okay... All hotels in San Francisco this one included should be far more up front with what the parking situation is if your are driving. I drive a Toyota Tacoma and they tried to add on the over sized vehicle prize of $45 dollars a day opposed to the $33 a day which they eventually honored. The water temperature fluctuated whenever someone in the hotel flushed the toilet. Lastly The elevator is extremely small so pack light or you are going to need to do multiple trips. The hotel is a nice place in a fair part of town. Clean and Modern rooms TV was smaller and lagged heavily. I would recommend the hotel to a friend on a budget.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator, TVs, Front counter staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square park and the Powell Mason Trolley turn around.

review.title: The most helpful staff
review.reviewText: I was at the Hotel Mark Twain for 5 days while in San Francisco for a *very* large convention. I was glad to get a reservation. It turns out that the Hotel Mark Twain was nearby everything I needed, but was also quiet. Best yet, the staff were fantastic. I was frantically trying to print out a last minute presentation and they helped me out, without charge! I hope to have the chance to return there in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: Could you speed up the elevator? It's the only downside.

review.title: Great front desk staff
review.reviewText:
The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. They held my bags for me on the day I checked out until my evening flight at no cost. Also, when I checked in they asked me if I wanted this floor or that floor and I said the quietest, so she suggested a different room altogether which worked out great.

The Mark Twain is directly across the street from a side door to the Hilton lobby so I was able to attend a conference there and save a lot of money. Also, my friends at the Hilton had to pay for wifi in their rooms while it was free at the Mark Twain.

This hotel is an older building so if you want the feel of chain you might not like this. Even though it was old it was very clean and I didn't see any bugs of any kind.

There are a lot of homeless people in the area but it was like that over a broad area, not just around this hotel.

There are lots of restaurants of all price ranges within walking distance and a drug store (I think it was Walgreens) within a couple blocks.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff and the housekeeping

review.title: Good hotel, bad area!
review.reviewText:
The good. This hotel was good and the staff was excellant.
The bad. We had steam heat pipes that rattled often during the night. Another guest complained of the dumpster trucks picking up and dropping their containers at 3:30 in the morning.
The really bad. This area is probably reasonably safe in the daytime but don't go out after dark as we were approached twice by very aggressive panhandlers. Soup kitchens in the area keep many homeless in this area.

review.title: Needs help
review.reviewText: pictures on internet are decieving unless you want to stay in the beautiful lobby. They must have 1 or 2 nice rooms for internet pics. The rooms are old need paint carpet. No satellite or cable tv. Wifi was good but no strong cell signal.No A/C bt not necessary.

review.title: old ,out of date and very disappointed
review.reviewText: I didn't expect much...but it was very old and small....would not stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: outdated and dingy
review.locationRemarks: decent....in the middle of shopping and restuartants

review.title: Functional hotel at a good location
review.reviewText:
Apart from it's prime location, Hotel Mark Twain really doesn't offer much. For the amount that was charged per night, I would expect the heater to work, the TV remote to work, to have On Demand TV (Not even Cable TV!), complimentary bed room slippers, and a couple of bath robes maybe? The water pressure was also very weak. Whenever someone else on the same floor uses the water, your water instantly become scalding hot - making showering a very unpleasant experience in the hotel.

However, I did appreciate the good customer service as well as the complimentary lemonade at the hotel lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: Good customer service. We were able to leave our luggage bags in the hotel after check out.
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks away from Union Square. However, beware of bums lingering around the streets

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and had the old-town feeling to it. I was pleased to see a computer and printer available for guests to use to print out boarding passes and such. The room itself was in a presentable condition. There is no real view at this hotel, even from the eighth floor. The only real complaint I could issue was the appearance of the ceiling fan. We were almost positive there was spaghetti sauce splattered on it. Overall, the hotel was great and the staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Spaghetti on the ceiling fan
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Union Square region

review.title: Good hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay for an older hotel in downtown San Francisco. The room was comfortable. There was no light in the closet. The bathroom was very acceptable, It did not have a fan. The shower head was great. Of course, there was no air conditioner for the room. It was unusually hot for the time of year that we were there. We left the windows open and the street noise did not seem to bother us at all. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant and bar were good.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, and it was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: No closet light, no bathroom fan.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent central location.

review.title: Noisy room
review.reviewText:
Staff was really polite.
Great location, really near union square.
Comfortable room, but too noisy.
Everything makes noise there, refrigerador, water pipes, bathroom flush, calefaction...
It's almost imposible to sleep!!!
I was on de esconde floor, maybe on higher floor is better.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: A hotel with a unique character
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at this hotel. I like to stay at Mark Twain for its convenient location, great price, historical displays, and the Mark Twain decor. I think this hotel is truly unique!

review.title: Students hotel
review.reviewText:
I had a problem with the shower temperature. The temperature kept switching while showering.
Internet was also too slow , kept turning on and off.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Disappointing hotel experience
review.reviewText: Rooms had stained carpet and blanket had cigarette holes. Service was good however. Just a very old hotel that needs renovations

review.title: Not worth e price
review.reviewText: First of all the staff was outstanding and the service was top quality. The hotels interior however is a different story. The room was cramped, I had to turn sideways to get into the bathroom, and the bed was felt like sleeping in a cardboard box. The walls are so thin that I could hear the every conversation of every room at shared a wall. Not worth the price that was paid. While downtown, the hotel rests on the edge of sketch and I has harassed by panhandlers at the entrance or within one block each day
review.negativeRemarks: Old and run down
review.locationRemarks: Sketch

review.title: Old hotel with good location and service
review.reviewText:
Location and affordability was the main reason we chose this hotel, we found that it was very close to foods, shopping and transportation to union square San Fran. We particularly liked how we were able to walk to the BART and cable car system, which was all we needed to get to and from airport and touristy destinations.

We arrived to be given a room with 2 double beds. Upon request the hotel staff happily changed us to a queen room on the same floor and away from the noisy street rooms. Although the walls were thin and there were sirens going every once in a while it was very manageable.

The hotel and our room was old and a bit run down..particularly the carpet, however, it was still clean and warm which was very inviting after a long day out in the cold. House keeping services was top notch, we were able to sleep in till 10-10:30 every morning and still was able to come back every night to our rooms nicely made..in fact house keeping even helped us hang some of our wet shirts with coat hangers in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Old carpet, uncomfortable mattress
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to shops and food

review.title: Its OK
review.reviewText: Good location for RSA Conf...Hilton is over the road with a great foyer free for business meetibgs!

review.title: Reasonably Priced Hotel in Downtown SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located in downtown area. Restaurant and bar in lobby area. Room was comfortable. I suggest getting room off street if possible. Noise from people and traffic is noticeable.
review.positiveRemarks: Downtown with easy access to public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from street level-not hotels issue
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk to all downtown San Francisco locations

review.title: More to be desired
review.reviewText:
Hopefully this review will help others make a choice. I usually do not stay in the city, but rather near the outside (better hotel rates, comfort, and parking), but this time I decided to give it a go. First off the hotel rate wasn't so bad (two night stay), however be sure to factor in the parking (about $40 per-night including tax, with in-and-out privileges).

The room: there is no A/C so the room gets hot, we were on the 7th floor so we opened up the windows, this really does help, but if you are a light sleeper be prepared for the noise that comes along with being downtown (people, cars, and the occasional ambulance/police) .. heat and noise are not a good combo for sleep. The bed was a "firm", I love firm beds, so it was no prob for me, but my girlfriend would have preferred something softer.

The walls are a bit thin so you can kind hear your neighbors, additionally our sink got clogged, almost immediately from the beginning of our stay, really more of an annoyance.

The area isn't a terrible area, and is a nice walk .. we walked in the evening to find a place to eat, immediately next door to the hotel is a thai spot which isn't to bad and reasonably priced (dinner for two $40) and there is also a Chipotle nearby which was familiar and we didn't have to wonder if dinner was going to be good or not.
review.negativeRemarks: no A/C
review.locationRemarks: downtown feel, city feel

review.title: Hotel in the tenderloin.
review.reviewText: When I see the term "boutique" I expect certain things. This hotel had nothing that I would associate with the that term.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, pretty near to the principal's attractions of the city. The only problem to go to san fransisco is that the parking for your car is expensive, 30 usd a day.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel for shopping
review.reviewText: Great location. Walking distance to Westfield Mall, Bart, Union Square, F Line Cable Cars and great restaurants. The staff was excellent and very helpful in giving information on restaurants and transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls very thin.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for our purpose. Went to see A Christmas Carol at A.C.T theater. Very close to major department stores and shopping mall.

review.title: Boutique stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel had a very safe and comfy feel to it. All of the staff was super nice and very helpful. Only complaints would be it was very loud since we were on the 3rd floor you heard everything on the street and the bar closed very early, since it was raining we would of spent our money there instead of down the street at the tap room.
review.negativeRemarks: Try to stay as high up in the building as possible to reduce noise from street level.
review.locationRemarks: Very central and within walking distance to many restaurants/bars/theaters.

review.title: great hotel for single
review.reviewText: services was good, the room is a little small. but there have not any chairs, we just seat in bed.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant experience with this hotel. Walls are a little thin as we were able to hear our neighbors conversations and the cost of parking was inexcusable. Over all ok stay. Comfortable bed. Parking will be the deciding factor the next time I choose a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be included in the cost of the stay.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was ok. Parking little expensive. Nice staff...

Just few minutes to chinatown, pier 39 and Golden Gate.
review.negativeRemarks: Best breakfast in USA just beside
review.locationRemarks: Pretty good location... 20 min to Golden Gate

review.title: Excellent for the money
review.reviewText: Very good value in the heart of Union Square. Clean rooms, helpful staff, great location.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: It was great! But no parking. It's a great location and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking

review.title: good price good stay
review.reviewText:
I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. I stayed at another hotel nearby with higher price... And comparing to that hotel, Mark Twain hotel had much more space and was more comfortable.
Considering its reasonable price, I would recommend this hotel to others. It's close to Union Square. While there wasn't not much noise coming from the streets, the area around seemed safe and still busy. It has a nice bar and a nice restaurant on the lobby floor that I could enjoy in the end of my day.
However, the carpet wasn't that clean... and seemed old. (seemed to need to re-do the carpet..) If you wanna stay here, may want to bring your own indoor slippers or shoes.. And there was only one elevator, and the elevator was very small and crowded. And the water pressure(?) was not as strong..
Overall, I enjoyed the stay at this hotel and I will come back if I visit SF again.
review.positiveRemarks: closeness to Union Square. pretty comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet was dirty. I didn't want to step on the carpet on my bare foot.
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Square.

review.title: Awful hotel stay!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was the WORST hotel that I have ever stayed in. The rooms were out of date - the paint was peeling off of the wall. The carpet was filthy. In the bathroom, the bathtub needed to be re-caulked & the floor was filthy. On day 2, The iron left a large black streak on my linen pants, most of our pillows were removed from the bed and put on a dusty shelf in the closet - when we tried to call the front desk for replacements, the phone didn't work. So I called from my cell phone and requested replacement pillows and we were denied due to the fact the the hotel was full and therefore had no extra pillows. Also, we had to close our bathroom door every night due to being able to hear every word that was being said in the bathroom next door and the bars downstairs. As an afterthought, we went to one of the grocery stores that was close to put some drinks/food in the refrigerator. On day 2 we went into the fridge to get some of our drinks out for the morning and it was hot. The fridge had stopped working during the night & all of the food/milk was ruined. We asked for a replacement fridge, but never received one. I only wish that I had thought to take pictures to post.

The front desk staff was the only good part of this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: bums sleeping a half a block down from the hotel.

review.title: Mark C Twain
review.reviewText:
The hotel is rated 3, or 3.5 stars... Not so.
I'll start by saying that trying to get sleep is impossible. I had a room on the side of the main street and the windows did not properly close so I could hear everything going on street level even though I was on the 6th floor. The hotel itself is run down, the walls, the carpet, the furnishings in my room were dirty and stained. The hotel is serviced by a tiny, 2 people at most, elevator. I ended up talking the stairs most of the time b/c the service was too slow or when the elevator finally arrived it was at full capacity.
The location of the hotel itself is a plus only the sense that it is near the BART, a lot of good places to eat and close to shopping. However the neighborhood felt a bit unsafe to me even though there were plenty of people on the streets. I wouldn't want to be walking out there at dark by myself.
review.negativeRemarks: The loudness in the room.

review.title: Charming and Friendly
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice! Charming and clean. The staff were excellent and went out of their way to accomodate all requests. I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise outside
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Good location hotel.
review.reviewText: The rooms are small. The staff is very kind and helpfull.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was small.

review.title: Hotel is ok and a unique experience!
review.reviewText: We had no idea that this hotel is very close to the Tenderloin area . . .in fact, do not turn right when you are heading out the front door. There is a tiny elevator that holds maybe 3 people- that is the only elevator. We asked for a room that is not on the street and we were pleased that there was not too much noise. . . .and it was on the 3rd floor so we could use the stairs. The staff were friendly and helpful which was a plus. Over all, it was just an ok hotel . . .next time we will spend some more money and stay in a nicer place. Also safety wise as far as fire or earthquake, I was a little worried . . .the hotel was built in 1928 so hopefully the hotel has been retrofitted for earthquakes! It was an experience that I do not want to repeat the next time we are in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was in walking distance to Union Square and the shopping areas of downtown. Also the staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It was an older building on the edge of the Tenderloin area.
review.locationRemarks: Not too good, Our shuttle stopped outside the hotel and my daughter and I looked at each other that this could not be our hotel!!

review.title: Would come again.
review.reviewText: The hotel and the staff were great. The elevator and stairs were pretty small but not unmanageable. The only weird ting is there is a giant grate in your shower.

review.title: disppointing
review.reviewText: although the staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel itself is just too old and run down. it needs a major renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: old and run down rooms and facilities
review.locationRemarks: well positioned in the city

review.title: Close to everything hotel.
review.reviewText: Check in was very efficient. We were greeted by Joey and were able to get to our room right then even though it was 10:00 a.m. Joey also arranged for us to move to another room which had two beds the next day. When I called to make the reservation there was not a room with two beds so we had to share one bed the first night. Also the rest of our party was arriving in 2 days and Joey arranged a room with two beds for them too. It was fantastic the extra mile he went through for us. The only downer was there were two doggies staying in the hotel who barked all day. I assume when they were left in the room. I love doggies and I didn't mind the doggies except for the noise. I cannot imagine what they did to the room being left alone like that.
review.negativeRemarks: The tiny elevator
review.locationRemarks: Downtown where all the activity is

review.title: Good stay at a decent price
review.reviewText:
No doubt the hotel needs room
updates, but overall the area was close to downtown and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Would stay again if it was the same cheap price.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a soup kitchen right around the corner so lots of homeless lying just around the corner from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: As above. Lots of marihuana smoked and urine smells in area but that's most of downtown SF.

review.title: Good option for short stay in central SF
review.reviewText:
Served my purposes, a neat hotel in downtown SF at a decent price.

I came in late and left early and would use the hotel again for that purpose. If I went with my family or planned to spend few days there, I would look for something nicer in a different area.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy, but I am a sound sleeper and wont wake unless the fire alarm goes off
review.locationRemarks: The area isn't nice after dark

review.title: Very clean and convenient. Nice people.
review.reviewText:
It's a great little hotel, close to everything. My room was clean and my bed was very comfortable. The location was convenient, though the hotel is located a little outside of Union Square. It's really on the border of the tenderloin. It's fine. The price is worth being one street or two streets away from the center of the action. The staff was friendly and helpful too.

There is one small elevator in the hotel with a capacity of about 5. There are nine floors total. There are not that many rooms per floor, so it works. You might want to be ready to take the stairs if you're impatient.

review.title: Bad valet
review.reviewText:
The parking situation was really bad.
Open world had Taylor street closed off, leaving
you having to find a spot to park around the corner just
to go check in, this took 30 min of driving around.
Bags had to be lugged all the way to the hotel, there was
valet offered ( paid $51) but the hotel had no answer or was not ready
for the street closure and never gave us a warning.
On check out, we had to walk a block away with all
our bags to the parking lot, valet could not find
a parking spot close to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently and in walking distance to union square shopping.

review.title: Two star only
review.reviewText: The mattress pad had stains. The girl checking us in said they had "upgraded" us to a deluxe room but that was a joke! The room had two double beds and we had requested queen or king in the reservation. The baseboards were filthy and had not been scrubbed in months. I was afraid to look under the bed, for fear of finding it was not vacuumed, and I was too tired to care, unless I found a bedbug. That was the good thing--not a bedbug in sight, night nor morning. Elevator is miserably small and the wait is long so we ended up hiking the stairs. Would not go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and comfort
review.locationRemarks: Location central to Union Square. Close to Powell, and the heart of downtown shopping.

review.title: Cold Water, a major dissapointment.
review.reviewText: Upon check-in, we were promptly serviced at the front desk but once we entered our room, noticed that we had been put in an incorrect room as there were two beds when we had asked for a single room. The most disappointing part of the stay was the fact that there was no hot water throughout the entire hotel and when asked what we should do about it, the guest services rep said "take a cold shower I guess?". We were booked to stay two nights and left after only one night.
review.positiveRemarks: the hotel manager refunded us our money.
review.negativeRemarks: cold water, poor service.
review.locationRemarks: it's located in the "tenderloin" which felt unsafe.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in very convenient place,so easy to access to everywhere.

review.title: Great staff, bad location, frustrations
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in borderline ghetto. Panhandlers outside the doors. The room was clean. The staff was excellent, in particular (Will). Our car was delivered late, but they comped us a day on parking charges, so that was good. On our last day, there was no hot water in the hotel. Will comped our entire parking charges for our 3 night stay. They did the right thing. I would not stay there again. Staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: location, no hot water on last day
review.locationRemarks: panhandlers, dirty area

review.title: A Horrible Experience
review.reviewText: The was only one person on staff when we arrived at midnight. He was as kind as possible but having a young child with me, assistance with my bags would have been helpful. The eleavator was really small therefore difficult to navigate with child,cart and bags. The room itself was less desired than the pictures reflected on the website. We checked out after finally locating another hotel. the three hr stay cost us a night stay but we were extremely happy at our new hotel. The bathroom was newly remodel and quaint. If the room was cleaner and larger we would have stayed, It was a horrible experience. After traveling more than nine hours all we wantted to do was sleep but could not in the conditions we found at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: the bathroom was quaint and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: beds
review.locationRemarks: no opinion

review.title: The Jewel in the Tenderloin.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a little oasis in the strangest neighborhood in San Francisco. The staff made everything easy, friendly and cozy. Would absolutely return. The lobby is very quietly elegant, while the rooms, older but clean and comfy, could use a little updating. Nevertheless, the entire stay was pleasing in every way. And, the price for the quality and service, couldn't be beat.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise between the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Well, it's the Union Square neighborhood and the Tenderloin.

review.title: The Noise!
review.reviewText: The only problem we had at the hotel was the noise outside and the radiator in the room. The radiator rattled and banged throughout the night waking us up on more than one occasion. Soundproofing would be a good upgrade.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise.
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: Good for a one nighter on business, thats about it
review.reviewText: Good for the price considering downtown San Francisco. I wouldn't plan on staying with my wife for multiple nights. Staff was nice but just kind of a grungy room. I could see through to the next room through my shower.

review.title: Great European style.
review.reviewText: Construction going on but not bothersome at all. Reminds me of a European room, smaller than big chains but beds were comfortable and our stay was nice. Don't worry about the other reviews that talk about homeless people, it happens EVERYWHERE in the US.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, nice staff, easy access to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees but it's San Francisco and that's to be expected.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Metro Station, some homeless nearby but they left us alone.

review.title: Do Not Stay Here
review.reviewText: Did not like the rooms. They were not clean at all.

review.title: No alley facing rooms
review.reviewText: Don't get a room facing the alley no matter which floor you are on. During the night you can hear all of the deliveries, talking and arguments.
review.negativeRemarks: Room location

review.title: Mark Twain Hotel
review.reviewText: A good hotel in a central location which offered clean and comfortable faciities.
review.negativeRemarks: one lift in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: Central and easy to access downtown amenties

review.title: nice and small
review.reviewText: nice hotel. close to everything (including some sketchy but harmless homeless people). not good if you like spending time at your hotel (small w/ few amenities).

review.title: would never stay a second time
review.reviewText: The hotel has a very old hrating system that uses water running through the old registers. Even though it was warm enough oitside and we never needed the heat to come on, there were awful loud. Banging noises coming from them that started about 2:00a.m. each night..,terrible .....
review.negativeRemarks: Register noise

review.title: Only OK
review.reviewText: The staff was polite and friendly, however the cleaning crew wasn't attentif to what was to be replaced. Noisy: you could hear the conversations in the next room, the fridge was noisy and the pipes were noisy as hell. Twice during the night the incoming call wasn't meant for me. 3$ for two drops of water? ...where is the candid camera?
review.locationRemarks: homeless shelter by the corner was a "nice" touch

review.title: Fairly clean, older hotel with shady surroundings.
review.reviewText: The hotel was founded in 1928, so it's an old building, probably older than that. The hotel is also very close to some bad neighborhoods ("Tenderloin" and "Skid row") with a lot of homeless people. If you go there, come down the hill from Post St or go up the hill when leaving to avoid the worst of it. The staff was friendly and helped with directions, early check in etc. The hotel is old and small, typical of many European hotels. Don't expect a lot of space, large bathrooms or air conditioning. There were windows that opened, a ceiling fan above the bed and a steam radiator for climate control. WiFi isn't great, but works and is free. No continental breakfast, coffee or anything like that in the mornings. There is a small fridge in the room if you want to keep a snack or beverages cold. The place is pretty clean, but is a typical older building with many layers of paint and plaster and the cracks and settled parts of the building to prove it.
review.negativeRemarks: The neighborhoods around it, and it's old and a little rundown.
review.locationRemarks: If you go up the hill to Post St when you leave or come from that direction its fine, otherwise, avoid the bad neighborhoods downhill.

review.title: A little too rustic...
review.reviewText:
Poorly maintained. Would have stayed at a Motel 6 if I knew it'd be this bad.
Moldy and cracked paint in the bathroom. Carpet hasn't been shampooed for who knows how long. No climate control but there is an antique heater that is powered from a boiler.
It'll rattle when it's on, or it'll hiss steam if it's off. No sound proofing, which is OK if you are on a nicer street like Bush. Not the high traffic of cabbys, busses and bums in front of Mark Twain. Shower temperature swings from boiling hot to cold after you set it. Your choice of a 2 person elevator or slopping stairs. But it's not all bad. You're in walking distance to many sights and eats. Valet is "only" 27 a night... but it takes up to 1/2 hour to get your car.

2 points for you expedia. Since the glamorous HDR photography did not show how bad the room I got was going to be.
review.negativeRemarks: The Heater.
review.locationRemarks: Bums everywhere. They don't like walking uphill, but they have enough energy to work their way up from Market st.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: I had read a lot of negative reviews about this hotel, but we decided to try it anyway. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a corner room (away from the street) - it was quiet. There was a ceiling fan to cool the room. The room had plenty of space & was clean. The staff was very helpful - meeting our request of good places to eat & printing out maps for our trip ahead. The hotel is within walking distance to a lot of places of interest. I would recommend not venturing far at night - the area was a bit questionable (at least for me) - but, during the day we felt very safe. We plan on staying there on our return trips to San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: A bit questionable after dark

review.title: Mark Twain review from a Kiwi
review.reviewText:
After a long journey we were greeted by lovely staff members, who upgraded us for free.
Room was lovely and spacious which we were VERY grateful for.
Elevator was very small ( especially when travelling with baby buggy) which proved a little difficult sometimes, but apart from that hotel was clean, friendly and quiet.
Placed very close to the Tenderloin area which is full of homeless people on the streets but if you turn left and not right out of hotel this isn't a problem. Walking distance to Union Square and China Town. Not many hills to climb. Overall a great experience during our lay over.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly and suite was spacious
review.negativeRemarks: Small elevator for baby buggy
review.locationRemarks: Good but would have preferred to be a few more blocks away from the homeless shelters

review.title: HOTEL STAY
review.reviewText: HOTEL STAFF WAS VERY FRIENDLY ANE HELPFUL NEED TO HAVE AREA IN FRONT OF HOTEL OPEN FOR PEOPLE TRYING TO CHECK IN. IT TOOK US ABOUT A HALF HOUR CIRCLING AROUND TO GET A SPOT WHICH WASNT IN FRONT OF HOTEL. HUABAND HAD TO WAIT IN CAR UNTIL VALET PICKED UP.
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING

review.title: Major problems with the heating system
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at the Mark Twain for 3 nights which I had pre-paid through Expedia. If I hadn't pre-paid, I would have moved after the first night. The hotel itself is fine, and the lobby, restaurant and bar are nice. However, I had a steam radiator in my room which made so much noise that I couldn't sleep all night. I called the desk at 4:30am and they seemed to know all about the problem, and said they would turn the hotel boiler off! Which they did, and by the time I got out of bed, the room was freezing. The second night, I discussed this with the front desk, and they were very apologetic, and turned off both the heater and the hotel boiler, so it was quiet during the night, but again, by the time I woke up in the morning, I was freezing. The third night, I left the heater on until I went to bed, but had to have the television on very loud in order to hear it over the heater. Then we went through the same process of having the boiler turned off, then turning off the heater.
It is crazy, and actually a bit dangerous, to have such an out of control steam heater. At one point, when I was trying to turn the heater off, it spit out boiling hot water and hit me in the face.

The hotel is a perfectly fine hotel, if it weren't for this problem. I can't recommend it at this time, but would if they fixed this problem.

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: An excellent bargin close to the Union Square area and easy walk to Moscone Center. Excellent restaurant on site as well and very good bar

review.title: Great deal on a boutique'y hotel in great area.
review.reviewText:
This place is clean, secure, and was a great deal on Expedia. Very nicely located also.

Safe area but close to areas that would be scary for some travelers.
review.locationRemarks: Very good--close to Union Square and relatively safe.

review.title: For on-the-go people
review.reviewText:
SF is an expensive City - this hotel was well worth the money - evrything you need if you're an on-the-go person/group. Nothing spectacular, but just what you need. Close to everything you need to get round in the City.
However as we were warned it was quite noisy outside
Strong reccomendation to have breakfast at the little cafe right next to the hotel as you exit on your left. Awesome affordable breakfast ;)
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Very well located for union sq

review.title: Avoid this hotel if possible
review.reviewText: No air conditioners. No hot water. If you open your window to let in air, all you can here is argueing and yelling in the street. Bathroom was extremely small. Will not be staying here again. I was suppose to stay 3 nights and cancelled my 2nd two nights with in 10 minutes of being there.
review.negativeRemarks: no hot water for shower and no air conditioning

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great room. Great location and close to everything in the downtown area couple blocks from cablecar and a couple more to MUNI. Only small down was you could hear everything in the ajoining bathroom though the vent.
review.negativeRemarks: can hear your nieghbor through the bathroom vent
review.locationRemarks: Great location and close to everything in the downtown area couple blocks from cablecar and a couple more to MUNI

review.title: Not satisfied.
review.reviewText: Hotel room was extremely small for 4 people. Smelled bad. Bathroom wouldn't flush unless you kept flushing over and over. Barely no outlets for phone chargers. I would say the only positive was the location.

review.title: HORRIBLE!
review.reviewText: Horrible experience! We will never stay here again. If you want to listen to people screaming in the streets all night and to have the heater screeching at you all night, this is your place!!! The heater was even turned off! We stay in SF all the time and won't be back here again. The staff didn't do anything to remedy the situation. The valet couldn't find our car because they had the wrong tag on it. It didn't even match our claim ticket! We almost missed our tour bus because of that. The front desk staff didn't care; they argued with me about the amount of time we had been waiting for our car and then he addressed me as "Lady". Nice. Like I'm not important enought to have a name. There was no manager on duty to complain to. Noisy area, uncaring staff, inept valet service. My husband was even fuming and he is usually the calm one. Trust me; find another hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy! Inept and uncaring staff!
review.locationRemarks: Terrible location... bad area of town!

review.title: Convenient Location to Shopping & Food!
review.reviewText: I booked a one queen bed and received a two queen bed room which I didn't mind. The room was big enough to move around and tight. The beds were very comfortable and they give you plenty of pillows. The bathroom was a little too small even for two people, especially the sink so only one person can get ready at a time. The closet was roomy but didn't have any lights except for one of those battery operated push night light. We were also not aware of the construction but fortunately we're early birds and left for our daily sightseeing by the time the drilling and pounding starts.
review.positiveRemarks: Fish & Farm restaurant on the lobby floor in case you don't want to go far to eat or just want to grab drinks
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom and lack of light in the closet. Oh and the construction!
review.locationRemarks: Great location. The hotel is within walking distance to the BART, Union Square, the cable car station, restaurants, and even the piers!

review.title: Hot Room.
review.reviewText: The heater was WAY TOO HOT!!! We asked how to turn the heater off in our room and we did what they said, however, it was still on! And the bathroom was very small. Other that those thing the hotel was okay.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This a is a fine budget hotel well located in San Franciso. The staff is friendly and the Internet is free.

review.title: Great hotel, not so great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely and the staff very friendly. The area is a little sketchy, so I wouldn't recommend walking around on your own at night.

review.title: Mark Twain
review.reviewText: I stayed on the 8th floor. Half the floor was undergoing a remodel. Not a big deal but the whole floor smelled of wet mud and there were large sheets of plastic on the floor and hanging out the windows of the rooms being worked on. The plastic on the windows blew noisily all night.

review.title: SF on a budget!
review.reviewText:
Come out of the hotel and turn left! NOT Right!!!! Right will take you into the tenderloin district and you don't want to be there, left and across the road will take you to a taxi cab and a $10 ride from the pier/embarcadero.

For what we paid, we couldn't have asked for a better location, the hotel was clean, safe, and the room suitable, the pipes are a little noisy when someone flushes the toilet!

We even surviced an earhquake here !
review.negativeRemarks: The location perhaps, if you don't like the San Fran characters.
review.locationRemarks: Its near enough the tenderloin district to be intimidating.

review.title: noise issue
review.reviewText: even though the wall is concrete made, I was waken up in the middle of the night by noise next door. It was not a fun experience at all, but other than that this is a fine hotel for what I paid.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were exceptional. The only issue we had was the old style heater/radiator, it was noisy at times. Other than that, we couldn't ask for a better stay.

review.title: pleasing accommodations
review.reviewText: The accommodations were pleasing however, the construction immediately outdoors was not acceptable. The construction crew began work around 7:30 which jolted us at the time.

photos.caption: A great picture in the lobby

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is its location in Union Sq. The lobby & staff were very nice. My room was clean but a little older and there is only a radiator to heat the room. Additionally, if your room overlooks the main street then it can be super loud at nite. I would recommend this hotel but only for 1 or 2 nites.
review.positiveRemarks: The people who worked there were really nice and helpful. Great Customer Service
review.negativeRemarks: No central heat and too much street noise reached the room I stayed in
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic Location!

review.title: Walk from Powell BART Station
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy walk from Powell BART station.

review.title: Check-in in less than 30 seconds
review.reviewText: The hotel decor is a bit dated but the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms are excellent. The hotel staff were friendly and very customer service oriented. I arrived. They were already expecting me and had my key card ready (easily accessible, not in some filing desk drawer folder). Spent less than 30 seconds at the front desk before I was able to head to my room. As a frequent traveler, you can't imagine how much that improves my mood.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator was slow & small. The awning & decor cast some doubt to the service and cleanliness. But was quickly dismissed as you entered your room.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. 3 blocks from Union Square

review.title: Not recommended overall
review.reviewText: We stayed here to save a little money and I wish I hadn't. The bed was old style and very hard, the rooms were not well insulated, I had to unplug the very loud fridge, and the shower never got past luke warm. No glasses in the bathroom? Really? The lobby was nice and the location near Union Square great. Not recommended overall.

review.title: No rest for the weary!
review.reviewText: Good location to shopping but lots of homeless people who are very aggressive! The room was very noisy, we could hear the people in the next room very clearly and they weren't sleeping or talking if you know what I mean! Pleasant staff and the hotel was more than adequate but don't count on it being quiet or else bring ear plugs.

review.title: On The Edge
review.reviewText:
A decent value for the money. They are amidst some construction and refurbishing...and when it's completed, the hotel might warrant higher feedback scores.

I would not be reluctant to stay here. But please realize that this hotel is on the edge of what I'd call "Tenderloin District Grittiness". 1.5 blocks in the proper direction and you are in good shape....ie...O'Farrell Street and en route to Union Square. 1.5 blocks in the "other" direction and you are in a potentially unsafe area.

Street smart urbanites should fear not!

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Hotel is awful. While the room was tidy the staff on the front desk were beyond useless. Didn't know anything about the neighbourhood, wouldn't give me a refund for the shuttle I booked which was $15 per person and just slow in general. Hotel has one elevator which struggles to fit one person with luggage in, the bathroom is disgustingly small, the door when opening misses the toilet bowl by about 9 millimetres, and the shower was just crap. They had construction work going that wasnt supposed to start till 8am every morning but without a doubt begun at 6:30am every morning. The location is bad too. Its in one of the slummy areas with drug dealers everywhere and homeless people all about. Every night when going to get dinner I was able to witness someone urinating on the side of the road or building. Just a smelly, dismal neighbourhood. What you save here doesnt make up for the lack of everything else you need to enjoy your stay in a place. Do not stay here. EVER!
review.negativeRemarks: Bad staff, bad elevator, bad everything.
review.locationRemarks: Horrible, drug dealers/users everything.

review.title: I can't believe my eyes
review.reviewText: The pictures are misleading. The pictures make the rooms appear to be cute and comfy which unfortunately is not the case. The rooms are tiny. There is hardly any space in the bathroom. I was surprised I could even close the door considering how close it swung to the toilet. And there was no room to stand in front of the mirror because the toilet is once again in the way. Smallest bathroom I have ever been in. You can tell that the building is a bit old. Normally that would be totally fine with me, except this hotel needs a make-over! Also, valet told me to call ahead to pick up my car, about 15-20 minutes. It took them 50 minutes to get my car to me. I expected a little bit more from the websites descriptions and pictures. I considered finding a different hotel for the night.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square but kind of a sketchy block. Scary if you are a girl with your girlfriends.

review.title: Affordable yet Excellent!
review.reviewText: An excellent choice for students or those who are looking for something that is affordable with excellence. This hotel caters for all as we found out when we arrived. The rooms are clean and the decor is modern with a touch of elegance. Complimentary WiFi to keep you busy at night if you don't want to leave your room in conjunction with cable TV. Hotel staff were very helpful at every moment of our stay. Overall an excellent experience and strongly recommended to those who want to stick to a budget.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff friendliness, Clean rooms, Complimentary internet
review.negativeRemarks: No exhaust fan in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: On the border between Union Square and Tenderloin - Can be a bit rough at night if you take the wrong turn!

review.title: not very good
review.reviewText: It's a very old hotel.it is not good for its price. My parents took a visit for me and we lived there for five nights. The parking there was expensive and not very convenient.

review.title: nice little hotel
review.reviewText: The service of the front desk was excellent. The hotel is placed near all down town sfo. The price was very convinient. The room was quiet and confortable.

review.title: Good Place with Good Service
review.reviewText: Good hotel but would be better if they included breakfast.

review.title: This hotel was just okay.
review.reviewText: Room smelled like smoke and toilet had a flushing problem. Hotel service was great. Housekeeping came and fixed these problems. Room and bathroom were quite small.

review.title: A little iffy
review.reviewText: Didn't feel the bathroom was really clean. Room was small. Location is good if you want to be near Union Square. Room was on backside and relatively quiet for a city. Definitely utilitarian and not romantic.

review.title: wall less hotel
review.reviewText:
