Here is the good news, Location is near Union square and tenderloin, the staff is nice.
Bad news Walls are thin, If u want to get sleep or do anything else not happening, its a voyeurs dream, not if you need 2hrs of sleep. Its great if your date needs comments from the homeless
review.locationRemarks: above union square, Bankers hill, close to everything, cabs are priced reasonably priced, and you get a quieter neighborhood

review.title: NWM convenient and reasonable
review.reviewText: the service was really excellent. the location was very convenient and our room was clean. we requested a room off the street as it can be very noisy on that side, but our room was quiet and comfortable. it was a bit warm as we were on the 5th floor with no a/c, but that was due more to the weather. had a great stay, a great run, and would stay there again! thank you!
review.locationRemarks: marina, cow hollow, union square, ... they all have a lot of variety in restaurants, things to do and see, shopping, and feel safe.

review.title: Wouldn't stay here again
review.reviewText: The room was small, bathroom small as a closet, thin walls, could hear neighbors, street noise kept us up all night

review.title: Not satisfied
review.reviewText: Both the hotel and the neighbourhood were very noisy and it was not easy to sleep. The room was very small.

review.title: Good location. Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Pretty much what you should expect from a reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco. Nice lobby. Clean rooms. Easy access to downtown. The only complaint...the bathrooms were not that good (noisy fan, loud toilet flush, no counter space).

review.title: Paddlewheel Blues
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located in a transitional section of the city. Street noise was loud and the hotel radiator hissed and popped making sleep nearly impossible. Bathroom and shower was tiny but functional. Bed was fair to poor. Reception staff was polite but did not supply receipt. Elevator was miniscule.

Saving grace...great breakfast place next door....

review.title: Great deal on a friendly, comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: We were really happy with this hotel. It was comfortable, and the staff were friendly. We found the beds to be the most comfortable we've ever slept on in a hotel. They were firm, but not too firm. Some reviewers complained that the rooms were small, but we found them typical and satisfactory. Some reviewers complained that the walls were thin, but we didn't hear any more noise than usual from other rooms. We stayed almost a week. The location was very convenient for sightseeing and catching various buses and cable cars. The neighborhood may make some folks uncomfortable, but we found the folks on the street to be polite and not particularly interested in us. We had our two kids with us, ages 8 and 10, and it wasn't an issue. When it was time to leave, the desk staff were very helpful arranging for a van to pick us up at 4:30 am to take us to the airport so we didn't have to walk to the public transit station at that hour.

review.title: An excellent hotel in a somewhat sketchy neighborhood
review.reviewText:
Rooms are clean, kept looking great by friendly housekeepers, and are outfitted with the essentials (tv, soap, shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, etc.). NO a/c, but there is a fan, and also a small radiator in the corner of the room. This was not a problem during our visit in July, but during hot months like Sept - Oct I can see this becoming an issue.

The staff are friendly and very willing to help.

The hotel is located right on the edge of the sketchy Tenderloin area, but it's directly across the street from the Hilton, so it's not THAT sketchy. Just be sure not to venture too far west on Ellis or Eddy lest you get mugged.

Otherwise, the location is great. Within walking distance from Union, Market St. and the SOMA & financial districts. Convenient bus routes surround the hotel, and there are plenty of good restaurants to be found within the vicinity.

Fun fact: The hotel is half a block up the street from GLIDE church, featured in the movie "The Pursuit of Happyness". We checked out Sunday service there and it was a great experience. You can really see how the church cares about its members, regardless of race, social status, or partner preference, and they are very welcoming to tourists.

Would definitely have no qualms with staying here again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Good location and comfort for the price.

review.title: Get some Dang Bottle Openers! Oh, and be nicer too!
review.reviewText:
The hotel and staff were rather unhelpful in providing some very basic amenities. Not to sound like an overindulger, but I couldn't get a glass or a bottle opener for my room. I had a lovely Anchor Steam beer (brewed in SF) and had to bring it to the lobby to be opened. I also wanted a glass and was refused. A customer service minded emplyoee could have made executive decision to take care of me, but didn't. In fact, I was told that I couldn't have my glass because the adjoining restaurant might run out due to the use of my single glass! I think it is unfortunate that they don't provide this very simple and cheap amenity when asked. Also, it was like pulling teeth to get a late checkout...a grudging 30 minutes was finally provided. The star system of Expedia is a bit misleading here. I'd call it a two star with a restaurant.
The room was simple, clean and nice. The location is awesome (across the street from the $400 a night Hilton)! If you aren't used to street folk, the neighborhood could seem dodgy...but that is the nature of the Union Square area of SF.
We selected a room at the back of the hotel for quietness...our view was of an apartment building wall about eight feet away. It was quiet and very dark. If this isn't for you I'd recommend asking for a room overlooking the light well. It would be quiet too and wouldn't have perpetual twilight.
Overall I'd recommend this hotel...for the value and location rather than for it's style and service.

review.title: Quite good for its price
review.reviewText: Old furniture. Very bad noise room isolation. Good location.

review.title: Pursuit of Happyness...NOT
review.reviewText:
You know the movie "Pursuit of Happyness"? In the movie, Will Smith and his son stand in line for a chance to spend the night at the Glide Memorial Overnight Homeless Shelter...it is right next door to this hotel. That in and of itself is not too bad. Unfortunately, the individuals who didn't make it into the shelter roam the neighborhood and shout to each other all night. The hotel is old and without air conditioning. The weather was cool and we didn't need AC, but I was hoping to have the "hum" of an air conditioning unit drown-out the loud homeless people.
Beds are very hard and the pillows flat/dead. The bathroom was TINY. So small you have to squeeze between the tub and toilet in order to close the door. I booked this as an Expedia Unpublished Rate- 3 star Union Square Boutique Hotel. This is the worst 3 star hotel I've ever stayed at. Motel 6 would have been better. If you want to be "happy", go stay somewhere else.

review.title: Great rates for the location!
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent the weekend here. Never have been to San Francisco, so we were not sure of what to expect. The location of the Mark Twain was close to shopping and the major attractions were only a short jaunt by BART or MUNI transportation. The only time we spent in our hotel room was to sleep and shower so paying a high price for something more extravagant didn't make a lot of sense to me. The staff at the Mark Twain were very friendly and helpful. The room was older, but quaint and quite clean. There are quite a few homeless people on the streets, but they were not aggressive in any way when they asked for money. We enjoyed our stay here and if we ever go back to San Francisco, we will be staying at the Mark Twain again.

review.title: Good for the price you pay
review.reviewText: Good location. Not so good neighborhood. 3 good near by restaurants to have breakfast and dinner. Not so friendly for children. Accomodations a bit neglected.

review.title: A classic hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the short time I was there and it beats the big chains any day.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText:
Clean, convinient location (close to the convention center) However:
Very noisy surounding,street noise realy causes inconvinience.
Unable to conect to the internet! Wi-Fi service not working!

review.title: Would book here again
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with this Hotel, especially the location, which was across the street from the conference that I was attending (as well as very close to Union Square and great shopping and restaurants). All the staff were great, very helpful and available. It was a bit noisy, mostly street noise, and the walls seem a bit thin. However, I had a very pleasant, clean room, great wifi, and would definitely book here again.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel in great location

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Good location but the room has broken windows and it is very noizy at night.

review.title: great price/nice hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoyed the Mark Twain Hotel. The hotel is in a nice location within walking distance to shopping, Asian art Museum. The room was clean and comfortable, the neighborhood was a bit run down but we did not have any problems when we walked to the Asian Art Museum. I would'nt walk around at night though. The staff at the bar were very friendly and the food was good. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Unimpressive
review.reviewText: My experience with the cleanliness and comfort of the room and the morning desk staff were great! However, the evening/late afternoon front desk staff were completely unhelpful and unable to answer simple questions and requests on multiple occasions. My room was on the second floor and it was noisy--lots of street noise including noise from large tour buses idling at the Hilton across the street for several hours in the evening. The wi-fi only worked about half of the times that I tried to use it, and when it did work it was very slow. But, overall it was clean, comfortable, 3 blocks from a BART station, and the price was right!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great spot, clean room & friendly staff. the building is old & so a bit noisy but who spends time in their room when visiting SF anyhow? great location for the price.

review.title: "Cozy hotel "
review.reviewText: What i expected for a small boutique hotel. Our stay was good. Staff was great. The bed & pillows were too hard for our liking. Every morning about 5 am the trash trucks woke us up. The bartender was helpfull and freindly. We never did eat at the restaraunt , but did hear that the food was great.

review.title: Worked for me
review.reviewText: Eight easy blocks to shopping and ten to the Moscone Center, the Mark Twain was a great stay for the right price.

review.title: AFORDABLE
review.reviewText: Just off a main street and right across the Hilton. Close walking distants to Union Square. Better than paying two and a half the price for Hilto thats right across the street.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Because this hotel was close to the Tenderloin district, there were a lot of homeless people near by. There were lots of places to eat that were close as well as the Bart. STaff was helpful, kind. Walls are thin.

review.title: Well Priced Hotel
review.reviewText: For the price I paid, my stay was comfortable. While this is the case, I was a litte disappointed with the condition of the hotel. This hotel is old, with old carpets. The room was small, but adequate. Internet access was available in the lobby for free on the hotel's computers, or as a paid for service via wireless. Staff were friendly and competent.

review.title: Whether you're on a budget or not, this "budget boutique hotel" blows the rest away!
review.reviewText: This is my 2nd visit to the Hotel Mark Twain -- had such a wonderful & relaxed stay last time that booking here again was the 1st thing I did after confirming my trip to SF. It's truly a "boutique" hotel -- small, personal and comfortable! 5-stars for me! :-)

review.title: Great for the price!
review.reviewText:
Older hotel but clean and nice. Location is pretty good. We found an amazing restaurant 2 blocks away called Chutneys, on Jones St. It's great Indian/Pakistani food really cheap and it's soooo good. And you can bring your wine, which really saves a lot. Four of us ate for 50 bucks!

The hotel staff was very nice and knowledgable. The restaurant in the hotel smelled very good but too expensive. Good walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, etc. A long walk but worth it to go to Exploratorium - at Fine Arts Palace.

Good shopping and pizza in North Beach too and it's a short bus ride away. Alii-in-all, it's a great hotel to stay in for the price. Not fancy, but it definitely works!

review.title: san Fran Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent Service, Everything went very good. I will go back and get the same hotel.

review.title: Fun in Frisco, I'd go back every weekend if I could.
review.reviewText:
Our hotel was perfect and the staff outstanding, we had alot of fun just meeting people and sharing stories. Although we were a bit nervous about
the area on our block, we were reassured by the staff that the homeless folks are pretty harmless and as long as we respected them we wouldn't have any problems. We even shared our leftover Chinese food, one night with them.
The hotel was only a few blocks from other shopping, great restaurants/bars and a quick walk to the cable car pickup. Everyone we met were so friendly and helpful. We do not recommend renting a car for the entire trip because parking is rare and high priced. We took a shuttle service to and from the hotel, very reasonable. We rented a car for one day (1/2 block from our hotel-lots of rental options), and drove up to Napa Valley, Stinson Beach and Muir Woods. Perfect amount of time. We then were able to see the Golden Gate Bridge the following morning before we turned the car in and it was glorious, what a view. We walked alot, so bring good comfy clothes and shoes. Great cafe next door to the hotel for breakfast or lunch. Recommend the Puccini/Pinetti bar for happy hour and fantastic bar food (the meatballs, YUM!), Finos for awesome Italian, well known John's Grill for steak sandwich or salad lunch. Nob Hill for great pictures of housing, and enjoyed the recorded tour on Alcatraz. Purchase a 3 day cable pass , then you can jump on and off as much as you want. Tiernans Irish pub for beer at last cable

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I used this hotel in November 2008, it was OK. Unfortunately, by February 2010 the service had deteriorated. The internet which was claimed to be available in my room - and which I was initially billed for - was actually not connectible. The charge was ultimately reversed. Heating was in the form of a radiator which I found I had to turn on in the middle of the night, after waking up cold. I elected to stay in my room until check out and the heating was totally turned off, it was very cold. I do not recommend this place.

review.title: Great hotel not so great neighborhood
review.reviewText:
We have stayed here several times and alway enjoyed ourv stay. It is close to everything and easy to get a cab to locations not in walking distance. The staff is very helpful.
The location-neighborhood is not the greatest near the tenderloin, but we were not bothered by the locals.
one minor problem was the WiFi- it was crawlingly slow and a pain to get onbut it was free with the deluxe room. Price was great and even better from Expedia. Would definately stay there again. Both restaurants next door were great.

review.title: You get what you pay for...
review.reviewText: This hotel was pretty clean and well maintained. The elevator was extremely small and on the slow side, be prepared to wait in line at times. The room was clean and the staff did a good job of cleaning daily. Like most of the rooms in San Fran it was pretty small. The biggest negative for this stay was hearing the neighbors, as if they were in the room with me. It was pretty ridiculous. The surrounding neighborhood is hit or miss. Go straight away from the hotel out the front doors and you're good. Go towards the back of the hotel and you'll hit methadone clinics and homeless shelters. There was a lot of good places to eat and drink around and transportation was easily accessible. So, not great, but compared to some other rates of nearby hotels, it was acceptable.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText: I WAS VERY SATISFIED

review.title: You get what you pay for, maybe slightly better... Slightly
review.reviewText: Noisy, windows faced a very busy and loud street. Walk in closet was great, but no light. Also bathroom is small which would've been okay except the tiny shower did not have a light either so it was awkward and dark. Door man had some sass which was annoying since they should be the friendliest of all.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Try the restaurant!

review.title: Thank You.
review.reviewText: Godlen Gate Bridge. Two Thumbs UP!

review.title: Mark Twain 1
review.reviewText: none

review.title: OK,good price and convenient
review.reviewText: Dated but clean. Elevator wasn't working when I was there, but i needed the exercise. Very convenient to Union Square. Perfectly fine if staying for a short business trip. Generally a no frills hotel, but had a bar and restaurant in lobby, which was good.

review.title: Hotel is milking its location in Union Sq
review.reviewText:
When I arrived, the elevator was out and not expected back in service for weeks. A bellman did quickly carry my bags up to my 5th floor, but I had to walk up. Stayed there for 4 days and the walk up & down the stairs began to be annoying (though I suppose I got my workout...there's no exercise facility). The biggest problem was that the week I was in SF was very cold and the hotel has central forced water heat deleivere through radiators in each room. The rediators have valves that allow one to vary the amount of heat in the room, however, they DON'T WORK when the boiler is not turned on! The cheapskates in the Hotel turned off the boiler during the day (i.e. when they thought everyone would be out of the hotel at meetings) but I was in and out and working in the hotel during the day so it was very iuncomfortable. The front desk person did turn on the heat one day when I specifically complained but the following two days they did not despite my calls to the front desk.

I have stayed at this hotel in the past and had a good experience, but it seems that they are now milking their relatively good location in Union Sq but providing only the most basic services to economize. I'll only stay there again if I have confirmed that the elevator is working and the weather is very nice in SF.

review.title: We will stay again!
review.reviewText: This hotel had a quaint feel in the heart of Union Square. We walked everywhere and couldn't be happier with the location. If your looking to spend a lot of time in the hotel it's a little small but has a very nice feel to it. If your staying near Union Square no need to rent a car, we rented one and never needed it... parking is expensive!!!

review.title: Nice services, ok location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located very close to the Union Squre which was very nice for shopping and easy to get to the trasportation. A lots of good restaurants is in the neighborhood area, however, it is close to the homeless area also.

We were very impressed with the service and cleanliness of the room. The room was comfy, evn though the heater made a lot of noise all night long.

We would recommend this hotel if you need to stay close to the Union squre.

review.title: A San Francisco bargain!
review.reviewText: The only downside is the location: when leaving the hotel, turning left is the better option, even if one must detour a bit from one's destination. Turning right, there will likely be panhandlers lined up in front of the Glide Community Center, next door. This was not a real problem for us, but my husband did have to pass this gauntlet every time he went to fetch our rental car from the garage (there was no other possible way to get to it.) This is a minor quibble; I absolutely recommend this hotel and would stay there again! (Note: this was not the hotel-affiliated garage; we found one that was cheaper, nearby)

review.title: ok hotel, nothing more than that
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located, 5 minute walk from Union square.
There were technical problems with the room keys, and it took the hotel 3 days to fix them. Also very bad wifi connection in the rooms.
The rooms can be bigger, a 2-bed room is too small for more than 2 people, unless they are family and don't mind the intimacy.
The service however was very good and helpful

review.title: Ricardo
review.reviewText: Very gentle employees. Excellent quality/price ratio. Near Union Square.

review.title: Best Affordable Hotel EVER in SF
review.reviewText:
I love Mark Twain! This was the third time I stayed at this hotel. It is always very clean. The lighting in the room is a little dim but that's not an issue. Staff is friendly. For a moderately priced hotel, I can't ask for anything more. It is on the border of the Tenderloin district so paranoid people who don't have alot of city smarts may not be as comfortable.
Super convenient to everything. BART is only 3 blocks away. And if you need cab, just cross the street to the Hilton where a fleet is always lined up outside.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a fantastic location
review.reviewText: It is a very nice Hotel with excellent location close to the center of the city & very very nice hotel staff.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: This was my second time staying at Hotel Mark Twain and possibly the last. The location is convenient, it is walking distance to many places (Union Square, China Town, etc). The hotel itself is a little outdated. The room was okay but I can't complaint for the price I paid.

review.title: Great Staff, Poor Comfort
review.reviewText:
Hotel Mark Twain is decent, but I didn't have a great stay. First, it's very close to the wrong side of Union Square, so there were sirens throughout the night and a lot of noise.

As well our room was heated via radiator and wasn't terribly warm. Couple that with a very hard bed and sleeping the night we were there wasn't too easy.

Rooms were clean as were all the linens and the place was well-lit. Staff were excellent and the valet service is worth the price.

review.title: good except for the location
review.reviewText:
Hotel Mark Twain is a solid if unspectacular hotel for basic stay needs. The staff was friendly and the room was reasonably clean.

The only knock on the hotel (at least the one in San Fran) is that it's right next to the tenderloin district and there are quite a few homeless people soliciting in the vicinity. Other than that, my stay was pleasant.

review.title: Sleepless in San Fran
review.reviewText: Way too noisy and the bed was not comfortable.

review.title: Not for a romantic getaway, but fine for business.
review.reviewText: I was attending a conference across the road at the Hiton, and I was looking for a cheap room for myself. There was a special offer on this hotel when I was booking. The room was okay. It was clean, and I had everything I needed. If was going for a romantic weekend I would not chose this hotel, and would spend the extra to have something more fancy, but for the purpose of a cheap and clean place to stay, it was fine. I could hear people in the neighboring room at times, but I arrived prepared with earplugs, (I'm a light sleeper at the best of times) so I slept fine. The front desk staff were pleasant. The small bar seemed okay too, although I didn't use it.

review.title: Noisiest place I have ever stayed
review.reviewText:
Rooms themselves were fine, staff were helpful. BUT

But geez this place is noisy. We were on the 9th floor, every morning about 7 we could hear trucks rattling around on the street below. Sirens in the middle of the night, the works.

Walk up to Union Square area is OK, but don't accidentally walk the other way as it's a fairly dodgy part of town.

Also only has one teeny tiny elevator - which was a bit slow. And feels a bit dodgy. No major incidents like getting stuck or anything but you were always pretty relieved to get out of it

review.title: Stay Away!
review.reviewText: My November trip to the Hotel Mark Twain coincided with an extremely cold and rainy days. Despite the hotel's policy of running the heat from 5pm-7am, on each of my four days in the hotel the management shut off the heat around 11pm or midnight, leaving the room freezing. When asked about it, the management brushed aside our complaints. For a 3-star hotel, it was a miserable experience. Stay Away from Hotel Mark Twain!

review.title: Dissatisfied
review.reviewText:
Overall it is in a good location. If you end up being next to people who are inconsiderate don't expect to get any sleep. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything your neighbors do.

Also heaven forbid an emergency should arise where you have to leave short they will charge you no matter what. I had a water pipe break in my house and I was advised I would be charged regardless. Please can any one tell me that they actually plan to have a pipe break ahead of time.

review.title: A Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: Small, quirky, great location

review.title: Mark Twain - San Francisco - Ok for Some
review.reviewText:
I would recommend this hotel to some people; not to others.

The location -- if you plan on shopping in Union Square, riding the cable car and/or seeing a play in the theater district -- is excellent. The hotel's Fish & Farm restaurant is casual and very good (and has a full bar). BART and Muni buses are just a few blocks away. The current price was great considering other hotels within two blocks charge three times the price. There are issues, however. During our three day stay the elevator rarely worked (people all the way up to the 9th floor had to walk up and down). The in-room wi-fi service was horrible (to the hotel's credit, they refunded the charge when I complained). The free desktop/internet computer in the lobby worked sporadically. The rooms are clean, but the hotel is old and the bathroom, especially, could use a revamp. Charge for valet parking (for the area) is a bit less than at other hotels. TV worked fine (no HBO) and coffee maker was a nice touch. Would stay here again at the current price, but would be careful about which of my (pickier) friends I recommended the hotel to.

review.title: Good economic/location compromise
review.reviewText: Although the hotel was a century old, my room was comfortable and had no issues with anything.

review.title: Bad section of town, dirty windows, uncomfortable bed, noisy noisy street, dirty unsafe neighborhood
review.reviewText:
SF has a bad homeless problem, and it is exhibited surrounding the Mark Twain. The windows were streaked with dirt, and while the room was clean it made it seem dirty. The bed mattress was horrible, it hurt my back. The rug was dingy and cheap. I was advised not to go at night a half a block away. Definitely not worth the price I paid, and I was supposed to be getting a deal!! So much for the anonymous booking for me in the future!

On the good side, staff could not have been better and more helpful. And there is a great breakfast place right next door.

review.title: Friendly Staff! Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: My son and I visited San Francisco to take in the Van Morrison concert and stayed at the Mark Twain for one night. The hotel is in an excellent location, perfect for the sites we were visiting during our 2 days in the city. The rooms were average size, well appointed, and comfortable. The front desk were VERY friendly and helpful, I could not have been more satisfied with my stay at this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location. It's a small and intimate and you can be in Union Square in 5 min walk.

review.title: Not impressed, missed the air conditioner.
review.reviewText: Need air conditioner and also carpets were not nice.

review.title: Nice Hotel in dicey part of town.
review.reviewText: Once in the door the Mark Twain was a perfectly fine hotel. Incredibly helpful desk clerks, clean room and bathroom. It is close to Market street cable cars and transportation. The Mark Twain is also across the street from the Hilton, so you are close to very nice accommodations. The only downfall is the proximity to the Tenderloin district of San Fran. It gets pretty low and sleazy depending on the direction you go from the hotel. No one ever bothered us, just an eye opener coming from rural Colorado.

review.title: Not what i was looking for
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at this hotel, and the year previous we stayed at the Larkspur. The bathrooms here were bigger, as was the room overall, and there were a couple of extra amenities like the iPod dock and coffee, but honestly that wasn't what we needed. We needed a comfy bed, a place close to Union Square, and a late-night walk back that didn't make us feel like we were going to be mugged, and the Mark Twain did not deliver on any of these. For my girlfriend and I, this hotel did not suit our needs, and since the Larkspur is almost exactly the same in price, we will be staying there, not at the Mark Twain, for our future visits.

review.title: You get what you paid
review.reviewText:
Area is great, couple blocks from union square.
The rest is hardly on par. It's not too bad, you get what you pay.

review.title: Cheap and convenient in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The Mark Twain is right on the edge of a neighborhood called the Tenderloin. Rumor has it it's a rough part of town. I would call it colorful. I left the hotel in the morning and always came home well after dark and not once did I feel threatened or unsafe.

The Hotel itself is old and charming but well-maintained. They only have one slow elevator, but as long as you're not in a super rush, I think it just adds to the charm.

Other than checking in and checking out, I didn't have too much interaction with the staff. But the ones I did speak to were more than friendly. And I always got a smile from the door man who was a charming and unsuspecting touch for a small and inexpensive hotel.

The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and, although the bathroom was exceptionally small, it was more than adequate.

I was able to walk to just about everything I needed or wanted to see. But I should mention that I'm an athletic 36 year old. I walked to the Ferry Building, to the PIers, to Fisherman's Wharf, to Haight Ashbury, through the Golden Gate Park all the way to the Pacific Coast. I did, however, take a bus back to the hotel afterwards. :-)

If you're looking for luxurious pampering, the Mark Twain isn't for you. But if you're looking for a clean, comfortable inexpensive place to lay your head while in San Fran...I give it two thumbs up for sure.

review.title: Would Stay Again, Anytime
review.reviewText:
This was a great place to stay, with the possible exception of its proximity to The Tenderloin. This is sort of a rough part of town. However, the staff were engaged, knowledgeable and very helpful. It is also located right next store to one of the most famous little diners in the country, "The Taylor Street Sandwich Shop". Tiny little cafe, but excellent...the line was out the door.
The hotel is convenient to all transportation and shopping. There are a number of good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Not Quite Union Square
review.reviewText: Calling this hotel "Union Square" is a stretch. Sure, it's two blocks from Union Square, but it's also around the corner from a homeless shelter and the Tenderloin, one of San Francisco's worst neighborhoods. Every night I woke up to people yelling on the street outside. The rooms were adequate but small--especially the bathroom, where you have to wedge yourself between the toilet and the sink just to get the door closed. On the bright side, the staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. Adequate for a few nights, and if you're looking to save money, not a bad option. Just don't expect much going in, and make sure you have a map so you don't inadvertently stumble into the Tenderloin after dark.

review.title: Not impressed and will not go back
review.reviewText: This hotel, while located near Union Square, is also on the edge of a very fringe area which is very seedy between the hotel and Market Street. The hotel is also very dated, with very small rooms with uncomfortable chairs. The lighting in the rooms is very poor for those times when you want to kick back and read in between activities. There is nothing really to recommend this hotel except its location. They would have to pay me to stay there again.

review.title: san franciso trip
review.reviewText: hotel and the service was good but it was very noisy. the noise coming from taylor st due to the people on the street (homeless,prostitutes etc)

review.title: Excellent location for the money
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel for the money we paid. Excellent location with Union Square just a few blocks away. Good restaurants in the area. I would not recommend this hotel if you have children. We took our two children with us thinking we can put them on the floor. When we got there, room was so small that there was no room for anyone to sleep on the floor. Good service. I would recommend this hotel for singles & or for couples. Not with children.

review.title: Small and Quaint,
review.reviewText: It was decent little place, real nice, and the little mark twain quotes everywhere was a real nice touch.

review.title: Over-rated
review.reviewText: Nice location but disappointed with high rates for internet service and phenomenally expensive valet parking, which took place blocks away so that the car had to be ordered 15-20 minutes ahead of time. Very inconvenient.

review.title: Great price
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, staff were friendly and helpful. The elevator is really tiny and slow that was really the only downside. It is an older hotel but it has been done up, great for the price. There is a fantastic cafe and crepe place 2 blocks up called Honey Honey cafe and crepery it also has free wifi.

review.title: Reasonably Priced in the City
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located and easily accessible to the transit system. The room was comfortable, though small. The hotel is old with narrow hallways and a tiny elevator. It did however have helpful and pleasant clerks and met our expectations for being affordable, clean and in the downtown area.

review.title: Nice Place!
review.reviewText:
It is a nice place for those who want a clean, Quiet room.hotel staff was nice.
reasonable price though you know why when you walk outside.Despite Location I felt very safe.Because of location you will see a few homeless and questionable characters,but mind your business and you'll be fine.

review.title: good for the price
review.reviewText: Room was a bit small, everything was clean the staff was very pleasant, good location close to everything we were there just one night and felt safe and would recomend.

review.title: Do not stay at this hotel
review.reviewText:
I would not recommend anyone stays at this hotel. I couldnt sleep the whole time i was there because the window didnt seal properly so the wind and outside noise was very loud. Im not sure about the area but at night there seemed to be a lot of shouting and noise between 12pm and 4pm so take earplugs if you decide to stay here. The lobby seemed really nice so when we walked into the hotel, we were impressed, but dont be fooled. The room was small, dingy, dark and although it didnt seem dirty it didnt feel clean. The lift is tiny and area where the hotel is located seemed a bit scruffy and there were a lot of homeless people.The staff however were very helpful and polite and the hotel was located only a few minutes away from the major car rental companies and the centre where all the main shops were.
I mainly stay in 3* hotels but in my opinion this hotel should not be rated so highly.

review.title: Nice budget hotel
review.reviewText: We were looking for an affordable hotel for a two-night stay in San Francisco, and this was exactly what we were hoping for - clean, comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff, decent location, and the price is right! I would happily return there to stay for an extended period of time.

review.title: Character hotel, clean & tidy. A favourite.
review.reviewText:
Mark Twain is my preferred place to stay in SFO. The price for the location is great, and the hotel, while a refurbished older building, is clean, tidy and has character.

The only issue I've had with this Hotel is that the older windows allow significant noise into the street-facing rooms. This is a very common complaint with San Fran hotels in general, though.

This trip was also the first occasion I've had to arrive with a rental car; the Hotel is one block from the Mason St building which is the pick-up/drop-off location for major rental car companies.

review.title: Good for a quick trip
review.reviewText: It was good for a quick trip

review.title: Borderline neighborhood, otherwise OK.
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was quite OK. It's funny how as you leave the hotel, if you walk to your right, you're in homless people territory. You walk left, less than half a block, and you're in a totally different environment. Weird. I would have appreciated if at check-in, they had told me about this, as I had to figure it out by myself.

Not a bad deal at all (booked at a Special Expedia Rate).

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: Generally unimpressed. Expected more for the price.

review.title: One of my best hotel experiences!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain was such an amazing experience! From check-in, questions about San Francisco, directions, issues, and everything else, the hotel was simply amazing. The Hotel is beautiful; the rooms are great; and the hotel is near a number of great places to visit (Taylor Street Breakfast) and public transportation. Highly recommended for anyone!

review.title: Great price, service and location but neighborhood is sketchy
review.reviewText: If your looking for a great price hotel in union square then this is it. Just put up with some of the outside riff raff that is this neighborhood and your set. Rooms are fair size, bathrooms a bit small but wifi works, valet is cheap and all in all I would stay there again. It's more of single person or friends type of hotel and less family oriented. The bar downstairs looked cool just didn't have time to check it out.

review.title: Nice stay and affordable!
review.reviewText: No complaints with our stay at The Hotel Mark Twain. The location of the hotel was convenient to most of the attractions and areas we wanted see in San Francisco. If you're looking for a reasonable hotel downtown, this would be it!

review.title: Value for MOney
review.reviewText: The Hotel had excellent price to its name. 100% value for money. The staff is excellent. The room was calm and soothing. The bar is execellent. Location was perfect i.e. just 2 blocks from Union Square and all the cable cars come to Union square. So no connectivity issue.I will definetely come back to this place in my next visit.

review.title: Great Deal, bring earplugs :)
review.reviewText: It's a great deal for the price and location, but you get what you pay for. It's secure and clean. Neighborhood noise was occasionaly loud through the night but not terrible. ( I brought earplugs).

review.title: Not...good!
review.reviewText: Only one very tiny elevator, enough for 2 people and 2 suitcases. Staircase very narrow and windy. Room was 2 double beds. Smallest room I've had in SF on over 50 visits to city. I would not recommend it. It borders the tenderloin district.

review.title: Cute hotel in a convenient location. Brilliant staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely. Staff are incredibly helpful. The restaurant must be good because we couldn't get a seat. We should have booked ahead, this annoyed me a tad. The location was convenient for getting around and close to all the hot spots. Of course being in the city when leaving the hotel we were approached immediately by homeless, but they weren't too bothersome.

review.title: Absolutely would stay there again!
review.reviewText: We loved the Mark Twain!! Great location, very clean room, new bathroom, nicely decorated, nice staff. The restaruants looked great, but we didn't have time to ear there. Absolutely would stay there again.

review.title: Super San Fran!
review.reviewText: This was an amazing trip for me! The hotel is centrally located and the neigbourhood in downtown Boston does not change even if you stay in a higher priced hotel... The internet, wifi, TV all there... The neigbourhood has it all, you can walk to places, go out at night, check resturants, find hidden cafe's... and come back to your comfortable bed, sleep take your shower on get out to enjoy the day. The staff is very frienly and they answer your question pretty well. Can I go back to SF now?

review.title: Don't forget to bring your ear plugs!
review.reviewText:
This is the most noisiest hotel that I've ever stayed at. I think it's because they don't have the double glass window installed, and the traffic and people just so loud even in the middle of the night, I won't able to sleep with my ear plugs!
Also it took half an hour to wait for my car when we checked out.

review.title: Clean, simple, and courteous
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain worked out perfectly for my family. It is conveniently located near Market Street and the many buses, trolleys, and cable car that we used for transportation. Although this area continues to be home to the homeless and less fortunate, we were not harassed and it wasn't a problem. The Hotel is a couple blocks away from Larkin Street where you can find the best Vietnamese Food in town, or in the US even. The Hotel staff is courteous, the room clean, if small. The maid service was thorough, beds made nicely, towels and soaps replaced. I have no complaints. And the price through Expedia was fantastic.

review.title: Not impessed
review.reviewText: It was to much noisy, especially on night and mornig.

review.title: Nice, but you should prepare for the noise outside in midnight
review.reviewText: ok

review.title: Not bad for a downtown hotel
review.reviewText:
Three of us stayed on the lower floors facing a busy street. It was noisy. The other two were on the upper floors not facing the street, much nicer.
Rooms were small, but adequate, good value, clean hotel. Parking fee was bit steep because they said our pickup was considered oversized.

review.title: it is good in service, clean in room and convinient in location, but a little noisy outside 4-6am.
review.reviewText: it is a good hotel.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: Across from the Hilton, this hotel is a great deal and delightful stay. Our third time. Rooms are not luxurious but very agreeable. We will return.

review.title: Expensive without free interenet and parking
review.reviewText:
Expensive without free interenet and parking
but the location is good

review.title: Very econimic hotel
review.reviewText: So convinient to walk arround city

review.title: Not deal
review.reviewText: When a booked up one of the amenities was free internet, but the hotel charged US15,00 per day.. beside that, i used the valet service, but every time i requested i had to wait more than 20 minutes.

review.title: Good value, but nothing fancy
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel based on its attractive price and it was fine. The room was clean and entirely servicable. The hotel is quite old ("historic") and has some quaint features like radiator heating. The windows are single pane and don't block the sounds of the hustle and bustle of the streets below very well. If you are looking for a clean and economical place to stay this fits the bill.

review.title: Okay but there are nicer places.
review.reviewText: I had a courtyard view which is to say I had no view. The room was small but okay. Room was clean. The neighborhood isn't so great . . . no threats or anything but way more homeless around there it seems. Nice that there was a small fridge.

review.title: Truly Impressed!!!
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotael again!! Great service and great location. I was truly impressed with this hotel. Highly recommended!!!

review.title: I will not return unless the install an air conditioner!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in what is known as the "tenderloin". We discovered this area is the location of many prostitutes and drug users. When we got out of the taxi, we were surrounded immediately by the before mentioned sort of people. We made it into the hotel safely and were greeted by a very nice young man working the front desk. He was extremely courteous and gave us the keys to our rooms as well as some information about the things we wanted to do while in San Francisco. When we got to our room, the fun began! It was at least 85 degrees in there. You should know that it was only about 50 degrees outside so there was no reason a room should be that hot. At least we thought there was not a good reason for it until we tried to turn on the air conditioner. It could not be turned on because there wasn't one. We thought this must be a mistake. Every hotel room has some sort of air conditioning system unless it is located in a third world country right? Wrong! I went back to the friendly young man at the front desk to inquire about getting a room with an air conditioner. I was then informed there were no air conditioners in any of the rooms. He did however move us to a lower floor, and I must this room was somewhat cooler and had a ceiling fan. We were still hot, but it was tolerable. The only other complaint I have is the fact that we could hear other people doing a variety of things in their rooms. My advice is pay a little more and get a little better!

review.title: Great for the price & location!
review.reviewText:
The Mark Twain was a pretty decent hotel. Literally 3 blocks away from Union Square. There is a bar and restaurant in the lobby so that was really convenient for us to get food and beer. The cheeseburger there is fantastic! If you want something more low key, go right next door to Taylor's street coffee shop. It's a decent place for breakfast and lunch!

The area is ok. We would always see bums near or down the street of the hotel.

Overall, we were satisfied with our stay at the Mark Twain.

review.title: It is an above satifactory hotel.
review.reviewText:
I picked it originally because I wanted to see what a hundred year hotel looked like and how it was kept up.
The rooms were a little smalle than I had originally expected but comfortable nontheless.
I do admit I wondered how much more comfortable I would have been if at all at another hotel, one that had their pipes inside the walls and didn't have a few layers of paint on the walls (I'm an architecture student and former Navy Seabee, I noticed these things).
All in all I would not mind going back to Hotel Mark Twain again, especially if the price is right.

Thanks!

review.title: will never go back...
review.reviewText: The room was small and not entirely clean. We were told that the entire hotel was smoke-free, but once we walked into our room we were hit by a strong smell of tobacco along with cigarette burns on some of the bedding. The bathroom was tiny, in that, you'd have to do some fancy maneuvering to just close the door in order to use it...there were also missing knobs and drain stoppers. There was virtually no control of the room temperature. It was either ice cold or sweltering hot. Even though we were on the top floor we could still hear all of the drunken homeless folk directly outside yelling along with trucks and loud cars till 3am which is when the garbage trucks came by. Even after paying $25 extra for internet just so we could find a different hotel, we couldn't connect to either Wireless or ethernet and finally just checked out the next morning and searched for a new hotel the old fashioned way.

review.title: Good place at Union Square
review.reviewText: Good price/quality ratio. Good offer considering it's at Union Square Downtown.

review.title: If service is important-this is the hotel.
review.reviewText: Had only a heater, no air conditionining but had a ceiling fan.Ok for the price but great service which tops it all.Convenient, walking distance to cable car, church, stores, restaurants etc.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was cold enough that I had to get out of bed in the middle of the night to grab the extra blankets in the room, and that was still not enough. It was February, and felt like the heat in the room was shut off. The neighborhood was noisy, and it sounded like there was a recycling station next to the hotel. I had to sleep with ear plugs in just to dampen the noise, but was still woken up at 2 am due to trucks emptying what sounded like glass bottles both nights I spent there. There was a homeless shelter nearby and you could hear people in the streets fighting during the night as well.

review.title: WIFI Bait & Switch
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The atmosphere overall was great, my only complaint - there was a charge for the WIFI that was advertised as free. I was told this was because I book a "Standard Room" and WIFI was only free in a "Deluxe Room". I felt this was a little bit of a bait and switch since that was one of the deciding factors in my staying at the hotel i was a little disappointed.

review.title: great location and staff; services adaquate, clean, great price
review.reviewText:
great location, price, and staff
clean room, very small elevator
no microwave in room and limited access to warm up food

review.title: Disgusting Toilet spews on seat and floor, beware of "free" Internet promise
review.reviewText:
One of the reasons we chose this hotel was for free wifi internet. The web sire said that hardwired internet was extra cost and wifi was free, but after we checked in, they said that was only for "deluxe" rooms. The clerk said she would check the website and call me back but never did. We had to pay $10/day extra.

Most of the time when you flush the toilet, it literally spewed water and excrement on the seat and the floor. If you closed the lid first, it just spewed on the seat and all over the toilet itself, but not the floor.

The location is on the edge of the very seedy Tenderloin district, so it's a great location if you are looking for prostitutes and drugs.

review.title: Close by
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain, a C-Two Hotel is good for those guest who are in business and who are in vacation. It is close by good restaurats, shops, touristic atractions and public transportation. For those who like to walk, it is a walking distance from the Civic Center, China Town and Lombard Street. It also offes a quite accomodation.

review.title: Great location & price!
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at Hotel Fusion which is also a C-Two owned hotel. I had such a great experience that I decided to try the Mark Twain. Both hotels are conveniently located near Union Square, shopping, public transportation, cable cars and numerous bars and resteraunts. The staff of the Mark Twain was extremely helpful. The hotel is old, but is clean and has great character.

review.title: Christmas Time Tourist in the Greatest City in the World
review.reviewText: I'm a Mark Twain fan and that's why I felt inclined to stay at the Hotel Mark Twain (not that he himself ever stayed there). This is a great low-priced hotel for people like me who just want a bed and a bath -- and no frills. The staff was wonderfully helpful and warm-hearted. I came earlier than the check-in time and they were able to accomodate me by getting me into my room (Room 821) quickly. The bathroom was a bit small -- I had to do this kind of skimmy around the toilet to close the door so I could use the shower. Everything was neat and clean. I would stay here again.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: It is a very good hotel I have ever seen.

review.title: Make sure you have a credit card at check in, or your scewed.
review.reviewText: It's nice. Just bring a credit card. The area's a little sketchy.

review.title: The best service, location and priece. I recommend this hotel to all my friends.
review.reviewText: Perfect location, great priece, extremely good service, nice people. Greatest deal.

review.title: Traveling Business Man
review.reviewText: The experience was nothing that I had thought to experience. I felt I was at a hotel in New York City. Was crowded and stuffy. Very expensive vallet parking and overall experience was mediocre at best.

review.title: Good, not great.
review.reviewText: For the price, the hotel is a great deal. There are so many to choose from in the area and I would choose this hotel again if the price is the same. Nice and helpful staff.

review.title: Met expectation
review.reviewText: The hotel is kind of old.. but what can you expect with such prices. The location is very convenient, though.

review.title: Great Hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
I was very surprised how nice this hotel was the price we paid. Personnel were very pleasant and attentive. Hotel restaurant looked very nice although we did not dine there. Menu seemed a little steep in price. $13 for a hamburger/fries.

Neighborhood was "ok". Alot of homeless people down the street, but did not feel threatened. Good location for those coming to the city to do sightseeing/shopping in the Union Square area. I would definitely return again.
Oh, and no air conditioning as it's a very old building.

review.title: Fun
review.reviewText: the vallet parking was confusing, but theres parking right across the street so it was fine

review.title: Really great!
review.reviewText: After staying in endless dumpy hotels (apparently you get what you pay for) I was quite relieved when walking into the Mark Twain Hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was really nice, and a great size for two people (some people say it is "too small" but this is the city so huge hotels rooms are out of the question unless you are forking over the big dollars). They have valet and although expensive, I felt my car was in safe hands(we had a roof top carrier and were terrified someone was going to steal it in the middle of the night!! All was safe!). I guess the only negative thing was the neighborhood at night, although even though the homeless were present they truly left us alone. Great food around too!! I still can't believe how great this hotel was ESPECIALLY for the price we paid!

review.title: great, if you get a good deal on the price
review.reviewText: i got a great deal on this hotel during a 24 hour expedia special so for the price it was wonderful. the hotel is located across the street from the hilton and is an easy walk to the cable cars and public transportation. this is an older hotel with a very small and slow elevator also there is no air conditioning. the area to right of the hotel is a little shady i would recommend walking towards the left if walking in front of homeless people is an issue. overall the staff was very helpful and attentive i would go back.

review.title: comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: comfortable hotel, just be careful in the area.

review.title: Brilliant Location
review.reviewText: Absolutely great location and comfortable hotel but lots of road noise

review.title: Nice bargain hotel
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for the 1st night of our vacation to California, so chose to stay in a cheaper hotel. It was clean and comfortable, staff were helpful. Not the kind of hotel I would have wanted to stay in for our entire vacation (would want more amenities, etc), but well worth a one night stay.

review.title: Return Visit
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at the Mark Twain. The bathroom was a little tight, but the room was fine, very clean. There is a lot of street noise, but it was better from the 8th floor than from the 3rd. The folks at the front desk were always pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Slow Plumbing
review.reviewText: Hotel Mark Twain was a nice Hotel, centraly located,near theaters, resturants, shopping, site seeing etc. However the plumbing was not so good. The small sink in the bathroom seemed to have been stopped up and we had to flush the toilet 3 times to get it flushed properly or not. That was a little frustrating. However I chalked it up to bad water pressure.Could be the San Francisco city density and hills lots of toilets need to be flushed. Honestly though, I would book with them again. Have fun in the City.I guarantee you will leave your heart there too. And! Go back to find it!

review.title: not bad... pretty good value
review.reviewText: nice hotel, very clean and friendly staff. Only thing would be parking. The valet is a bit slow sometimes...

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Third visit and found that the deluxe upgrade room was good value. Only complaint is the VERY small elevator !

review.title: will stay again
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and nice

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Hotel is in a great location in a walking distance in one of the best touristic areas in San Francisco.The Hotel is comfortable,the staff very helpful, the bar is cozy and the restaurant good. We had a great time and unreservedly reccomend the Mark Twain Hotel.

review.title: Great Value! Great Location!
review.reviewText: I thought it was a great hotel! I liked, in particular, the Mark Twain quotes on the hall windows. The only thing I would have to complain about was that there was only $30 valet parking. The parking garage kitty corner from the hotel wanted $40 but the garage about a block & a half away was $15 overnight if you got your car out by 930am. Thankfully I was only staying one night & the weather was nice to walk.

review.title: Fun Cozy Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain was quaint and enjoyable. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable of the city. The hotel is close to the cable car line and streetcars. The hotel has a nice bar area and restaurant attached and is near other good restaurants, may need to cab it at night even though we did walk with no problems. Our first time at a small "boutique" hotel, usually go to Las Vegas, and we were very satisfied with the more personable experience.

review.title: Street noise, broken elevator
review.reviewText: Our room was on the forth floor. Upon return from touring the city we were informed that the only elevator in the building was out of order, not fun to walk up four flights of stairs after walking the hills of San Francisco. The room was fine, clean, and the towels were fluffy. Our room faced the front of the hotel with the street below. The street noise made it sound like our bed was in the middle of the street. When the garbage truck came at 2 AM I thought they were in the room. The single pane windows did nothing to block the street noise. One block down the hill from the hotel is what the locals call the meat grinder. An area populated by vagrants and street people. Not a place a tourist needs to visit or be near.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location and service Reasonable rate with good discount

review.title: Network
review.reviewText: Other condition is quite good except network is not stisified for me.

review.title: Great value - but...
review.reviewText: Good-sized room, kept very clean. Bathroom, however, was minuscule; plumbing may have dated back to Mark Twin himself. Front-desk staff was more helpful & friendly than I've experienced at hotels costing three times as much. Location very convenient, walking distance to Union Sq, Chinatown, downtown shopping. But if you go a few feet further away from downtown, you're in a very seedy area.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Rooms are cheap to San Francisco standards but bevare of extra cost: Valet (only available) parking $28 and an expensive breakfast.

review.title: Nice place to stay easy to walk from
review.reviewText: good place to stay. dont have far to go for food.

review.title: Surprisingly Spacious for a Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: I arrived at the Mark Twain in San Francisco and was startled by the small lobby and tiny elevator leading up to my assigned room. After navigating down the slender hallway I realized that the majority of the hotels space is allocated to the rooms. I was only there for one night but it is the ideal place to stay for an extended period. In so many hotels there is a wasted hallway between the front door and the living space and at the Mark Twain this room is given to a walk in closet with room for two weeks of clothes. The hotel staff was friendly and the location is great.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: Not luxurious but very comfortable, this hotel is charming and well-located. Right beside Glide Memorial Church, it is close to Union Square and the downtown core. The service was especially gracious and friendly. I intend to stay here next time I visit San Francisco!

review.title: Nice Little Place
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed at this hotel the night before we ran the San Francisco Marathon. It was really conveniently located to food, shopping, and the start of the race. The free late checkout option that was helpful for after the race--it gave us enough time to run and get back and shower before packing up. They had valet parking for $25 a night, but that included in and out privelages. Nice little place!!

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: The room was fairly clean. The bed was uncomfortable, could feel & hear the springs in the mattress. The worse thing about the stay was the noise. The walls seemed paper thin... I could clearly hear conversations in the next room, I could also hear voices and noise from the room above me. The worse noise came from the street... I could hear garbage trucks, could hear what people were yelling. It was as if the windows were wide open, of which I didn't dare open. I was there to run the SF marathon and got very little sleep. I had them change my room to an interior one the next night but that was only a little bit better. Once again, the walls seemed like they were paper thin. My girlfriend was going to get a room there on the last day but decided against it because of my bad experience. She even took a loss because she didn't call on time to cancel her reservation.

review.title: Great digs for the price!
review.reviewText: The hotel was exactly as it represented itself and as one reviewer said- as long as you don't turn right when you go out the front door everything is great! I stayed with a friend for 4 nights and we were very comfortable and well accomodated. Internet service was great. A bit noisy (from the streets) even though we were on the 9th floor.

review.title: *Best Bang For Your Buck*
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel for 3 reasons: price, proximity, & a fridge(It was the only budget hotel that had one). Let me just say having a fridge is a godsend, if you want to save time & money. As far as proximity goes, this hotel is within walking distance of many retail stores,drug stores, fast food joints, restaurants,etc. It is also within walking distance to trains, buses, cable cars & BART that are need to take someone directly to some of the major tourist attractions. Now there are some minor drawbacks. The elevator is so small that you & your luggage will have to go up separately. The room was neat, but small. It was good enough for my 6yr old & me, but no more than 2 adults. Don't know how much bigger it would be for triple or more. We had a nice view of a brick wall, so day or night was all the same. But if you're not going to spend much time in the room, it is just a minor annoyance. Please note: There are a lot of homeless people & panhandlers in the area & some reviewers & even the hotel will tell you to go left when exiting the hotel instead of right to avoid being harassed. But in my experience, this was not a problem. I actually had more beggars when I went "left" than "right". After the first day, I went right if I had to go right, I chose not to take the long way around. As I mentioned, I have a 6 yr. old & would not put her in harm's way intentionally. Needless to say, take precautions if you are going to be out very late.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I booked a room at the Mark Twain because the price was extremely reasonable and the location was good. The hotel has undergone a facelift but if you're looking for posh accommodations, look elsewhere. My room was quite small but clean. The major objections were a very loud fan in the bathroom that is connected to the light switch so it has to run all the time the light is on. Bathroom lighting is terrible. My room was warm and the A/C was not working. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the room itself was quiet; no street noise at night.

review.title: Not impressed, but reasonable for the price
review.reviewText: Area around the hotel was somewhat sketchy especially when I arrived at the hotel around 10pm due to my flight schedule. The building itself seems to be maintained okay. Reasonable stay for the price. If you are traveling on a budget, I would recommend.

review.title: Almost great
review.reviewText: I liked everything about this hotel except that they did not offer free internet. Internet is not included in the price of your room unless you get a deluxe room.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the room was comfortable and the staff were efficient and very friendly and helpful. Also centrally located. Only complaint is that the front rooms are very noisy - coaches running their engines, people shouting and cars hooting. Try to get an inside room.

review.title: small but quality hotel
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! Clean and comfort room, convenient public transportation, and professional employees!

review.title: The best small hotel in San Fransisco!
review.reviewText: Tthe Mark Twain hotel is charming in nature and wonderfully central in it's location. you can easily walk everywhere from Russian hill to Chinatown, to Union Square, and more.The staff is friendly, polite, and quick to respond to your needs/requests. This was my 2nd stay at the M. T. in 2 years, and I plan to stay there on my next visit to San Fransisco. Also, the maid service was a-1 in quality, and friendliness. Our maid was the sweetest thing !!!!

review.title: SanFran Union Square Hotel -- Great location & Value
review.reviewText: We spent 1 night at the Mark Twain & thoroughly enjoyed it! The rooms were nicely appointed & the location is great. The staff was very helpful. And the hotel isn't far from BART or the Cable Cars. While the bathrooms are quite small, everything was clean. We would definitely come back -- great value for San Francisco. PS The breakfast shop 2 doors down has wickedly good hash browns & cheese & bacon/ham (the Taylor hash browns).

review.title: What A Find!
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights while I was attending a NAMI convention. First, the hotel staff were warm, helpful and eager to help. Second, the location was perfect--around the corner from the a major convention hotel at 1/2 the price and the breakfast place next door was terrific. My room was comfortable, and my only complaint was that the mattress hurt my back and the pillows were a little thin--but I normally sleep on a Sleep Number bed with excellent pillows, so I'm spoiled. Anyway, I did inadvertently walk the "wrong" way to Market Street through a depressed neighborhood during the day, and I felt perfectsafe. In fact, no one panhandled, unlike the more fashionable areas on Geary, O'Farrell and Powell. So, if you're looking for a comfortable hotel at bargain price--this is it--thank you Hotel Mark Twain!

review.title: Dangerous area
review.reviewText: the room is just OK, the shower was dirty when we arrived, but the clean it, but the area is very dangerous after 9pm. lots of homeless people arround, we had to run to reach the hotel without been disturbed,

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Excellent value. Located in theatre district. Walkiing distance to lots of restaurants, transportation. the hotel and rooms very well mantaijed and excellent conditions. Cons: a little noisy. Bathroom extremely small. You have to basically get in the bathtub before you are able to close the bathroom door.

review.title: Convenient Location in Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed satying at Mark Twain. Teh location was very convenient as it was close to the Cable Cars and Electric Trams going to Fishermans Warf. There is an excellent little Breakfast place next door with very reasonable prices, and a convenient restaurantin the Looby(Tips are included in the Bill). The only part that was noticeable with the location is that there were a lot of homelles peopel on taylor Street asking for 'spare change'...but harmless... We would reccomned the Hotel as it it fit our Budget and the people were very nice.

review.title: i will go back as soon as i am in SF.
review.reviewText: great location. not expensive. clean. very nice people.

review.title: Great location, great price, great service
review.reviewText: We were extremely happy with this hotel, especially after our last hotel in LA which was a disappointment. It was affordable and in a great location in Union Square in the heart of the shopping district. The rooms were clean and well kept up, and the staff was always helpful and courteous. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is a comfortable, convenient, clean hotel. Great price...but you get what you pay for in terms of luxury! Walking distance to everything downtown! Next to a great breakfast place! Staff is very nice and helpful!

review.title: Fair
review.reviewText: The hotel was great as far as the service from valet parking to the front desk. The building was a little older and not in the greatest condition. The beds were very uncomfortable but the room did seem clean. The neighborhood seemed a little "ify" as well. There were a lot of homeless people on the street right around the hotel at night. The stay was pleasant but I am not sure I would go back to that hotel.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel for people who are not looking for expensive and luxury hotels. It's a nice hotel where you can sleep comfortably.

review.title: A few blocks from the core
review.reviewText: Pros: a few miles to the Chinatown, the business district, the Pier and the BART st. Nearby Park and shopping centers were also very close. Cons: received a very small washroom, where the sink would touch your head if you sitting on it. Road noise was a slight problem during the night as the street is considered a high traffic area. A few blocks south of the hotel (down the hill), resided several homeless people. Not a major concern to me, however, for people looking for security may pose an issue. Conclusion: would only recommend due to proximity to attraction sites (but it is a few miles away )

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel was basic but in a good position and was excellent value for money. Close to all that you need. Valet parking was also not bad value compared to what was available. Beds could do with a new matress. Recommended.

review.title: Will Use Again
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain provides a near great location at a very attractive price. The building is old with a historical feel but not too run down.

review.title: Overall acceptable
review.reviewText: Weaknesses: The Internet service is disappointing as we spent quite a lot of time to do the configuration and we had to move the heavy table to re-insert the cable. There was only one in charge of the front desk and he couldn't come to our room to help! Also, it didn't offer breakfast and there wasn't anyone over there to explain where it is when we were looking for it! Apart from these, the room was clean and it looked like magnificent, although a little bit small.

review.title: great bargain
review.reviewText: Nice place

review.title: Cute, Clean, Boutique
review.reviewText: Love the Mark Twain. Stayed here on two separate occasions. Very clean. Bathrooms are very small though, but closet is a walk in. Would book this hotel again.

review.title: A good value, we'll be back, expect us!
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, safe, and a good location. Located close to the public transportation, it is clean, and safe, and a good price. After we completed our serious business, we discovered that Chinatown is a great place to blend in with the tourists and loose your problems. Thanks, Anonymous and Mudkips

review.title: The hotel has a very good downtown location. Clost to BART
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain Hotel is probally as old as the namesake author! However it is clean and comfortable. No freebies (OJ, muffins, fruit etc). It seems that they want to squeeze every dime out of their guests. Inroom movies for example $13.95 plus tax. Valet parking $26.00 plus tip. The location is the best point!

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the center of Union Square and is close by to all forms of transportation. Also within walking distance of restaurants, stores, coffee shops etc. The hotel staff are very accomodating and the rooms are clean, although small. Good value for the price.

review.title: I will come back to this hotel in the future
review.reviewText: The only problem was that the rooms close to the street are not sound-proof as such the first night I have difficulty sleeping well. Things changed after I was transferred to another room.

review.title: Noise, noise and more noise...
review.reviewText: Everything was fine except for the VERY noisy hotel room that we had (traffic, homeless people yelling, whatever machinery they have across the street). We slept uncomfortably during our two nights stay.

review.title: Good Location to centre of city
review.reviewText: Would ask for a room at the back, as front rooms facing street subject to noise of street cleaning and garbage removal.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay in the heart of union square, great service, an i have the opportunity of staying in the same room Billye Hollyday was arrested for possession of opium... great trip.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Needed better Bell hope service for arriving customers. Front desk seemed a little un-organized on day of check out. Room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Good Value - Not for Families.
review.reviewText: Service was excellent; the receptionists were friendly and helpful and the maids did an awesome job. The hotel itself is by no means a luxury hotel but def. good value for the price. If you tend to hang out in the room a lot, wouldnt recommend as the walls were thin and you can hear people coughing, showering, watching tv, etc. in the next room. Also, the hotel seemed to be right where the solid touristy area turns into more shady, homeless people territory. Overall, not a bad choice for budget travellers.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed and showering bath tub. The table for cofee maker beside of TV set works good enough for me to do the job by notebook which I carried.

review.title: Great value!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel- great value, very clean and quaint.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel for the price, good location

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: The holet is a bit old and no breakfast is included but the hotel is allright for its price.

review.title: Noisy but friendly
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a conference at the Big Hotel right across the street from the Mark Twain but could not justify Big Hotel room rates. Mark Twain's location was perfect, and the price was right, so I booked it. The hotel staff was really friendly at check-in, and stayed that way through the week. I ended up with a street-facing room on the third floor, and found the street noise a bit difficult to deal with between 0100 and 0700. Some soundproofing on the windows could be a big help. The room was large but modest, and the bathroom and other features worked as expected. The mattress, however, may have been carved from a solid block of limestone. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but it appears to concentrate on artisan meats (the bits we Texans feed to the dogs) served in the provincial French style. I did not note much traffic going in and out, but I was seldom in the area during peak dining hours. The hotel bar was dark, quite, and seemed to be well-occupied with guests. This being San Francisco and basically next door to some sort of assisted-living facility, there were lots of interesting characters on the streets, though I had no trouble from any of them.

review.title: Quaint & Clean
review.reviewText: Great central location in San Francisco, with tons of restaurants nearby and shopping on Market St. Was only a few blocks away from the Moscone (where my convention was being held) and it was a very easy, safe walk there and back in the mornings and evenings. The room layouts vary, with some having larger bathrooms or closets. Unless you are cramming more than 2-3 people in a standard room there is enough space for everyone and their luggage (although navigatable floor space can get scarce very quick.)

review.title: Nice small hotel
review.reviewText: Nice People, but one elevator makes moving to higher floors a little slow. Good value.

review.title: a good compromise
review.reviewText: cheap and clean the service very good

review.title: Mark Twain sufficient but no extras!
review.reviewText: Very rustic and not updated rooms at the Mark Twain. Resides in a tough part of town and was not told of the extra parking fees of $25 per day to stay there. Bed was very uncomfortable and carpet was very dirty. No contential breakfasts and small restaurant in hotel was very overrated and overpriced! Would not go back.

review.title: Great place, loved it in the spring, hope to return!
review.reviewText: I spend a few days in the hotel across the street, for a convention, then moved to the Mark Twain for one-third the cost per night. It was smaller, but still beautiful, and my only complaint was that it did not have air conditioning. I get stuffy at night, and would have run it for that reason; I thought it might be uncomfortable in a hotter season.
