Poeple were great, I felt quite safe, and my family really enjoyed the location and city.

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel good location.. only problem is TINY bathrooms

review.title: It was OK.....
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was ok. It is right smack in the middle of everything and the staff was great. The room I had was ok the bathroom was insanely small. I could hear the traffic from the street at all hours. I felt like I had the windows open but they weren't. That is how loud the street traffic was. Sirens sometimes 3 or more times a night. The breakfast place next door was incredible. The location for the hotel itself is HORRIBLE. Even the staff recommends not to go out at night. There are homeless all over the place. I felt bad for them and it ruined the whole vacation feel.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Given the city and the location within San Francisco, this is a great deal. Nice people on staff. No pretensions. Very satifactory

review.title: Great hotel - great staff - great location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with a lot of ambience and history. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Very reasonable price for a clean, comfortable hotel. Friendly, efficient staff.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel looks nice and it has good service. But, it is located on the edge of the Tenderloin, a rough neighbourhood, and right beside a community house, outside of which there is yelling all night long. There was so much noise on the street (yelling, trucks, construction?) that it was very difficult to sleep. The noise was especially loud because one of our windows wouldn't shut. We actually liked it when the heat came on and the boiler radiator beside the bed made its loud noise because it was harder to hear outside. Also, the bathroom was so small I had to blow dry my hair with the door open to have enough elbow room and air for breathing. We switched hotels mid-stay.

review.title: Elegant and reasonable
review.reviewText: A very nice older hotel with the only drawback being the loud traffic noise outside, and a window which wouldn't shut to help dampen the same.

review.title: Price is right, but make sure you know the area.
review.reviewText: The people who work at the hotel are very nice, questions answered,safe inside the hotel, maid service was very good. But, it's sad that this hotel is in the tenderlion. Alot of homeless, crackheads sitting around the area. I would recommend never going down turk or eddy after 6 pm on the way to the hotel. take alt. route using other safe streets or a taxi right to the door.

review.title: Pleasant staff
review.reviewText: The hotel employees were very friendly and assisted with information requested in a very diligent way.

review.title: Great San Fran location
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 days to see a college & Wonder-Con. The staff is very friendly & helpful. We had a room in the back & heard no outside traffic noise at all. The heater clanked a little the first night only. The room is small but clean with plenty of big thick towels. My son thought the beds were a bit hard but I was OK. I did ask for extra blankets though. There was a big flat screen TV with basic cable. Window shutters opened to let in sunlight. The price was great & we were out all day anyway, so this hotel was fine for us.

review.title: it's was an ok stay. there are better options of similar prices
review.reviewText: This hotel can really use some major renovations, especially the bathroom. I m not sure how it is a 3 star hotel. I would not recommend it if you are staying for longer than 2 nights.

review.title: There's Good and Bad
review.reviewText: There are some people who will love this place and some people who will run screaming. Having lived in a developing country for several years of my life, we were fine. The good: the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, especially when we first arrived. I don't think I've ever had a nicer welcome at a hotel. The rooms were fairly clean, nothing special, painted quickly without attention to details. It's VERY centrally located, we walked EVERYWHERE in no time. Great value for the area! The bad: it's noisy. The hotel faces a busy street and there are car horns and people screaming all night. The electricity in the hotel went out twice during our stay (granted they were have their worst storm in 27 years). The radiator in the room was clanking all night. Not a very restful room. If you're a heavy sleeper and don't need all the amenities, this is place for you.

review.title: OK Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel near the gritty Tenderloin district. Some parts have been renovated but the rooms haven't been in a while. Okay if you get a good room rate.

review.title: Great Value Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what I was looking for. It was a clean, comfortable room for a great price. And it the location was excellent, right near everything Union Square has to offer. The staff was very nice and helpful. A nice hotel experience.

review.title: Trapped
review.reviewText: Trying to leave for an early morning flight on Sunday morning January 25th, I was amazed to find the door leading out of the lobby locked, and no desk clerk around to unlock it. I waited five minutes, I called out, I shouted at the top of my lungs. Still no one showed. Thinking maybe the clerk had a heart attack, I walked around the desk, into the back room. No one was there. I shouted again, still no answer. I walked back around to the front of the desk, and was about to call 911 when the clerk showed up, after my having been there trying to check out for twenty minutes. He said, "Why were you yelling, I was there all the time?"

review.title: Best Bang for your Buck
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The room was small but cozy and being located in the downtown area made travel easy. Overall a great stay and very affordable.

review.title: Cheap but very noisy!
review.reviewText: I stayed two nights at the Mark Twain hotel. Very well located and very nice but very very noisy! Was not able to sleep.

review.title: Top Notch!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Mark Twain was nothing but relaxing. It was a GREAT deal and the hotel room was so nice! This was our first trip to San Francisco and we could not stop talking about how friendly the staff was and willing to help us by telling us good places to eat, how to use the Metro, and easy destinations to walk to. It is right in the middle of shopping central and just a block from the amazing Market street. We had great time and will be staying there again! THANK YOU!

review.title: Good deal for the price
review.reviewText: I got a very good last minute rate for 1 night. The hotel is typical of the San Francisco older hotels that have been updated. They don't provide the fanciest decorations, but are more than adequate for sleeping. The Mark Twain was nicer than most I've stayed at. The bed and bath were clean and comfortable. I was a bit concerned when I checked in as my room fronted the hotel, across from the very large Hilton across the street. There was a constant stream of tour buses with attendant backup beepers. Fortunately this stopped in the evening and I got a good night's sleep (I'm a light sleeper, so the street noise couldn't have been bad).

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful in answering questions of where to go where... where to find what... and they happily stored our luggage for us when we checked out to see some more attractions without our luggage. Overall nice hotel. Close to Union Square but not as expensive as the Union Square. Elevator was small and did not accomodate our whole group of 4 with all our luggage and the elevator was somewhat slow. Well...it's an older building but well maintained. Just a small walking distance to Union Square, Cable Cars, bus stations, Walgreens, and great food. We did not travel with a car thus cannot provide information on parking and such. It was great for us just to walk or take the buses.

review.title: Nice, cheap and in the middle of the downtown area
review.reviewText: Nice small hotel. Good personality. Three blocks from Union Square. Friendly staff. For the price, I really recommend it.

review.title: Full of Character
review.reviewText: GREAT location, full of character, and friendly staff! Definitely a fun place to stay. Only complaint, the rooms were reminiscent of a motel not a hotel. Bathrooms could use some deep cleaning and the lights were pretty dim. BUT if you're looking to spend more time out of the room than in the room, it won't be a problem. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good Value, No frills!
review.reviewText: Can't beat the value of the Mark Twain! Shuttle right across the street, every 15 minutes! Hotel is quaint, and fun. Only complaint is the restaurant and food service are way below par for SF? If you want a nice play to stay without the frills, this is it.

review.title: hotel mark twain
review.reviewText: not in the best area... but super close to everything. awesome hotel for the price. not super fancy but very cute and clean.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mark Twain. It was a very nice hotel and the staff was fantastic. It was a charming hotel. Had a nice European feel.

review.title: Excellent Budget Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is a gem of a hotel for the budget-conscious traveler. The hotel is comfortable and clean with boutique amenities. Its neighborhood is a bit on the dicier side, but at the same time it is across the street from the Hilton and just a block away from the Hotel Monaco. Within walking distance of BART and MUNI train lines, the hotel is an excellent base camp for a visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Simple and Nostalgic
review.reviewText: Cute hotel in great location. Pleasant staff and tidy rooms. Simple, but nostalgic. Good price.

review.title: not impressed.
review.reviewText: Very tiny standard one-bed room: They must have used a magical camera to make them look spacious in pictures. Paper- thin walls: I can hear everything in the room next to me. And the two girls stayed next to me didn't stop giggling until 2am. Cleaning is no good: Carpet is very old and ugly. sheets smell detergent.Hair was found on the shower wall. Front desk service is ok. A breakfast restaurant next to it. My room faced back of the hotel, so didn't hear much noise from streets. $9 something for internet per day.

review.title: A fancy motel
review.reviewText: Centrally located, the Mark Twain was a last minute choice for two nights near the convention center. If all you need is a place to sleep, it is adequate, but a bit noisy (with cars and buses on the street all night). The room was a like a fancy motel rather than a true hotel. Not at all comparable with the standard big hotel chains.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The bed linen had ordors that seemed to me to be unclean, the radiator in the room made contant noise which was difficult to muffle when sleeping. I at times had to turn on the TV in order to block out the sound of the radiator. The bathroom was clean, however not enough towels were provided.

review.title: Definately recommend
review.reviewText: Cute simple cozy rooms, not for those seeking luxury. Restaurant downstairs with interesting menu, unfortunately didn't get a chance to try out. Great value for price, friendly service, and great location! Plenty of overnight parking garages within 1 to 2 blocks for decent price.

review.title: Decent hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This is a decent, no-frills hotel good for tourists and business travelers. Room was a bit small and the bathroom even smaller (think "European") but unless you really need to spread out this should be a non-issue for most. It's an older building but the furnishings are up to date in the typical boutique hotel style. Staff were friendly and helpful. Try to request a room that is not facing the street, I didn't and it was rather loud at night but in fairness the front desk person did warn me about the street side rooms when I checked in. Also, the old-style cast iron steam radiator was a bit noisy at night. Some of the reviews mention the local residents around the neighborhood in a bad light but honestly, it may be a little bit rougher than the average suburb but cities are like that and San Francisco has always had its share of characters. I was satisfied overall with my stay and would stay there again.

review.title: The area & location would go back
review.reviewText: Good location, but do not turn right out of the hotel as there are large homeless hostel there - so not safe. hotel is within walking distance to loads of things - staff really friendly and helpful. rooms basic but you are only sleeping and changing there, so why waste money on a more expensive place. loved san fran, lovely place to go, shopping not as good as boston or NY, but loads of sights to see.

review.title: Great location - right in the middle of town
review.reviewText: The room was clean however the bathroom drains were very slow and some upgrades for the bathroom would have been nice. The staff was great, price was right and location was ideal. Morning coffee in the lobby would have been a nice upgrade. I will plan to use it again when in the Frisco area.

review.title: Good hotel - Centrally located
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Very professional staff.

review.title: Good but avoid roadside room!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located very close to Union square so is perfect for Christmas shopping. The room was great but on our first night the traffic outside (cars and humans) kept us awake. The hotel staff promptly moved us to a new room for our second night, which was fab!

review.title: Very convinent,excellent restaurant
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location for access to the shopping and tourists area. The hotel was an older sytle but confortable enough. For the price I was delighted with it. I would stay there again on my next trip to San Francisco

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was affordable and great if you want to be in a busy area of S.F. There was hospitality and everything was taken care of.

review.title: Hospitality fab - concierge tops
review.reviewText: I read the reviews and they're all correct-- but it's all a matter of perspective. SF is noisy, though my room was towards the back and therefore night-time street noise was much reduced, 6am garbage pickup was my 'alarm' clock ea day; the room had a ceiling fan and w/judicious use of the window, easily regulated my room temps (once I found out the windows DID open!). Staff were superlative--and that goes a long way! Beds were a bit hard and the outdoor night life is pretty wild, but both the doorman and the concierge are very vigilant and all will help you out however you might need. Four Starbucks within 2 blocks! Excellent location to sightseeing, transportation, shopping, and city center. Offbeat style but I felt very 'at-home' and safe. If you're used to Hilton suites--you'll feel like you're slummin' but if you do the wonder-bread types (like Express Inns and #8 or #6 cheap hotels), you'll love it and feel like you've stepped up a couple of stars! excellent hotel for the price.

review.title: Pleasant appearance; obnoxious noise.
review.reviewText: The Twain hotel was very pleasant in appearance. Staff was very friendly and the room was clean. Unfortunately we had a room on the street side of the building and the noise that came up at night was defeaning. Between idling buses, honking horns and shouting crazy people; it was impossible to sleep. Perhaps a room on the back side of the buiilding would be an improvement. Placing double paned windows would be even better.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel workers were extremely nice and hotel was clean. Hotel is located next to a community center and lots of homeless around outside. No air conditioning and windows only open up about 6 inches. Must be miserable in the hotter months. Beds were very hard and uncomfortable. You could hear whole conversations through walls (3:00 a.m.to 4:300 a.m our neighbors just talking) Bathroom had no fan and loud when you flushed. We moved to another hotel the second night as we did not sleep the first night. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: The best hotel on a budget!
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice, and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in Downtown
review.reviewText: I fell in love with this hotel the moment I walked through their doors. It has so much character and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Rooms were very spacious, though the bathroom was a little tight (I can live with that!) I travel to San Francisco alot and this is the hotel I will be booking first next time. Highly recommended. Excellent rates for the convenience.

review.title: Hotel was fine!
review.reviewText: I read prior reviews that were all over the board and I was frankly concerned. The hotel staff was very professional and the hotel was fine. If you don't go to the right when you head out the front door the location is good; close to Union Square, shopping and good restaurants.

review.title: Great affordable hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located, blocks from union square, shopping, BART, trolly station. Rooms were very clean, great maid service, friendly employees. Beds were extremely comfortable which is rare to find in a hotel. The bathroom and elevator were very small but not a big deal. The walls were quite thin and you could hear your neighbors. Overall, great hotel for the price and location!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I spent three nights in San Francisco between a trip from NYC to San diego. I did not know SF so I wanted to stay in a centralplace, not expensive and not a thrashy place. So I booked Mark Twain over the net reading some nice reviews about it and the price was OK. The place was very nice, close to Union Square and some very nice dance clubs (for the ones who likes it!). So for the price, the hotel is very comfortable, clean and better than I expected! Thnak You for my staying MT staff!

review.title: Convenience of Location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is convenient to sightseeing San Francisco. Union Square is just a few blocks away. We had trouble finding the place at first, since we were unfamiliar with the city's lay-out. However we could walk to Union square the next day and do our excursions by public transportation. For the price we paid, the place was clean and wellcoming.

review.title: Overall
review.reviewText: Convenient location at fair-ish price. Not a glossy hotel.

review.title: Will Not Stay Here Again - Once was enough!
review.reviewText: The Hotel's location was convienient but my room was kind of sad. Pictures on the walls were sliding out of their frames. I could hear whole conversations from the rooms on both sides of my room. At night there were several homeless people who hung out around the Hotel asking for money. The lobby was nice which led me to believe at first that the rooms would be as nice but they looked like a Super 8 Motel to me. I was surprised that Expedia rated this Hotel at three stars because Expedia is most often very reliable regarding their ratings. I can only assume the Hotel only showed them their finest rooms when they gave it a rating. It was disclosed that wi-fi was not free but I think for the price that should have been included as this is pretty standard in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel near Union Sq
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an inexpensive clean hotel, this is the place.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Perfect location to explore SF, close to Union Square, and not too far from China Town and Russian Hill.

review.title: A good value
review.reviewText: An economical and convienient hotel in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: Would Recommend
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and helpful. Everything is very clean, modern and well maintained. My few off remarks are that my room temp was cold in the mornings/evenings with only radiator heat, and the small elevator has the capacity for two people with luggage or three without. I stayed on the fourth floor, so I took the stairs most of the time. The area is convenient to shopping, theaters and transportation. I prefer these smaller renovated hotels to the larger modern "towers".

review.title: Worth the stay there if you are looking to save money
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel location for the price obtained. Just 1 block away there are hotels over $300 per night. This hotel is excellent in location, cleanliness, comfortable and beauty for the price. The only bad thing I found was that you can hear noise through the walls. We would hear noises of the shower pipes when the room next door people would take showers. However, for the price and knowing this is the only bad thing, I would still recommend the hotel. I researched a lot of hotels around union square and this was the best deal. I was hesitant knowing the prices other hotels charged and thought it would be bad service, but to the contrary. I recommend it if you are looking to save money while having a great time in San Francisco.

review.title: Things you should know
review.reviewText: Positives: Great Location, Great Staff and Services, Clean Room (carpet seemed vacuumed but was old and dingy) Negatives: Carpet badly needed replacing, Walls are thin so expect to hear your neighbor. Note: The large vent in my bathroom went straight through to the neighbors bathroom about three feet away. I could see when they had their bathroom light on and hear very clearly anytime they flushed their toilet, took a shower, or had a conversation near the bathroom. Shutting the bathroom door helps only a little. Bottom line: Overall a decent place but if you're a light sleeper or are on business and need to get good sleep, this hotel is a bit of a gamble, you may want to consider someplace else.

review.title: Good value close to most transportation
review.reviewText: It was close to Union Square and the trolley lines and within walking distance of many places to eat. The staff was friendly and helpful and for the money it was a great value.

review.title: Going back next time
review.reviewText: I have been to a few other inexpensive hotels in downtown SF and this one turned out to be a very good deal. The staff worked hard to get me a room even though I arrived very early (10am). The room was simple but alot better than I expected. It is centrally located so you get the noise from the street that you should expect at night downtown anywhere with your window open. Rather than try a yet another new place, I will just go back to this one the next time I am in SF.

review.title: NOT SUITABLE FOR FAMILIES!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was cute enough, however the rooms are teensy tiny. The hotel has NO Air conditioning which is a problem in the summer time, the radiator is completely exposed so if you have young children you have to be on guard the entire time. They do not offer cribs or play pens so come prepared with your own. Elevator was also teeny tiny, cute though. Nice walk to Union Square. I won't stay there again unless it was just myself and my husband.

review.title: Know Your Area
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, but the area is a little sketchy. One morning I was greeted in the lobby by 6 policemen and outside the hotel were at least 5 more. The valet had my car waiting, but when I went to get my keys from him he wasn't there so I turned around to go back inside the lobby and the policeman stopped me. I explained to him my car keys were inside and he took my ticket and went to get them, but while I was waiting for him the other policeman said to leave the area because there might be shooting. Luckily right then the policeman with my keys came out and I was able to leave in my vehicle. Needless to say I left for the day, but when I came back and asked the manager what had happened they said the they weren't sure because the shift had changed but it may have been someone trying to use a keycard that did not belong to them. I didn't find that reassuring at all but it was my last night there so I went in my room looked under the bed bolted my door and went to bed. I would have felt much more comfortable if the manager would have written something up explaining the incident and given it to the guests that were staying for more than one night. I did find it hard to believe that a shooting would occur if someone was just trying to use a keycard. But who knows.

review.title: Hotel Mark Twain
review.reviewText: Hotel very comfortable, workers are very kind. The hotel is ideally located,'s shopping and nightlife.

review.title: a pleasure....
review.reviewText: My 5 day stay at the Mark Twain was a pleasure. With the hotel's many high points, comfort, cleanliness, location...., was its staff. Professional ease with a sincere friendliness. They truly make you feel like a guest to their hotel.

review.title: Cute hotel, but the wireless sucks
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was very nice and very unique. Staff was very friendly. The wireless network they advertise, however, is really bad. It took me over an hour just to look up a few things on Google... I kept getting booted off.

review.title: Not for the light sleeper
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was incredibly friendly, but the overnight stay was extremely noisy. Our room faced the Westin hotel. The windows are single pained (and dirty). We listened to Friday night partiers, trucks backing up (with back up sirens), police sirens and a homeless person. This did not make for a good nights sleep.

review.title: A good hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Good customer service. Good room for the price. Good location for thge price. Smaller rooms compared to the picture, but still good for the price. I could hear the toilet flush from the next room.

review.title: Couldn't sleep due to noisy heater
review.reviewText: I didn't pay much to stay at the Twain so my expectations weren't the same as if I was walking into the Hilton. All I wanted was a bed for the night so I could sleep off a night out in S.F. Unfortunately my only requisite wasn't met when I got home to find the heater had kicked on and sounded like a techno song on high volume. It kept me most of the night.

review.title: Not too impressed.
review.reviewText: I don't think I have unreasonable expecations when it comes to hotels. This hotel was below my expecations. The area isn't very good-there were homeless people all over with police frequenting the area. The lobby is nice, but the room was less than great. Where the carpet actually covered the floors (it didn't go all the way to wall-there was a 1/2 inch missing between the wall and carpet and exposed dirty concrete), the carpet was stained and dirty. There were cracks in the walls, the room was tiny. The bathroom was small. The walls of the bathroom were dirty and the tub had stains in it. Our view out our window was of a scuzzy alley way and all through the night we could hear every sound outside-from car alarms to god knows what. The only positive thing I will say is the staff is super friendly and made our stay there bearable. The housekeeping even folding our clothes and put them on the bed. One last thing: they advertise parking as being $25/day, but forget to mention the taxes and fees so it's really $28.50/day, and they only have valet parking.

review.title: Great place for reasonable price
review.reviewText: Very convenient location at affordable price. I got a room with two king size beds, flat panel TV, and very clean. Internet WiFi is an additional charge at Hotel, but for free at nearby Union Square. Would go again.

review.title: decent mid-priced hotel
review.reviewText: Fairly clean, older but renovated hotel. You could tell the hotel was built in the earlier 1900's but it has been kept up fairly well. There was some cracking/peeling paint in the bathroom that looked like it had been painted over many times. The water temp. in the shower was prone to frequent variations if some one flushed the toilet in another room but it was tolerable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is right on the edge of a sort of sketchy area (lots of homeless people) but if you tend to stay to the north and east (toward Union square) its not as bad. The hotel is fairly close to public transportation, including BART which can take you from the airport so it is very easy to get around without renting a car. There is also a very good small cafe just to the north of the hotel that is good for breakfast and lunch. Overall a good hotel.

review.title: Central to everything
review.reviewText: My mother-in-law and sister-in-law were visiting from Australia. They wanted to spend a few days in San Francisco while they were here. I booked this hotel for them mainly because of the location. When they came back they have nothing but good things to say about the hotel, the size of the room, the cleaniness, that they were able to make a cup of tea in the room, and the very helpful concierge that gave them lots of information about what to see and what to do, etc. They were able to walk everywhere. They had a fabulous time and I came out smelling like a hero. I will definitely give it a try myself next time on our annual visit to San Francisco.

review.title: OK for summer prices in SFO
review.reviewText: Biggest summer drawback--no airconditioning. Ceiling fans helped. Hotel was cheapest we found in Union square area., but also clean and comfortable .Would stay there again. Area around Market can be "rough", so especially at night,suggest a walking route from Bart station, up Powell to O'Farrel, L 3 blocks to Taylor, then cross street, 1/3 blk L to Hotel.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Mark Twain San Francisco

review.title: everything satifactory
review.reviewText: everythign satifactory, but in no way special

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: For its price it was a nice stay.

review.title: Good value for location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in good location near Powell street BART station and Union Square. The rooms are modest, but the service is good.

review.title: Good bang for the buck
review.reviewText: My wife and I found that the Hotel Mark Twain met most of our needs. The hotel is conveniently located near the Powell Street BART station, which meant we could easily get to and from the airport. Most everything we wanted to do or see was within a 30-45 minute walk (although some of the area immediately surrounding the hotel is a little sketchy). The room itself was nicely decorated and comfortable, and well maintained throughout our stay. Service at the front desk can be a little slow, and I was disappointed in their policy of charging by the minute to use the one computer in their "business center" (a PC stuck in a corner next to the elevator, running an interminably slow internet connection). When we travel, we like to stay in a clean, modest room that doesn't cost us a fortune so that we have more available fire power for dining and entertainment. As such, the Hotel Mark Twain was just what we were looking for, and we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Worth for money and good staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is worth to stay for the cost. The staffs were very kind and helpful to enjoy the city. I can say it is the best maney saving to stay in SF.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The only gripe I really have with it is that the bathroom is really quite small. Other than that, the place was fine, and it has a great location too!

review.title: Not Impressed with Mark Twain Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel had no air conditioning. Temp in SF was in 90s. Window faces into well/pit area - no air circulation. Ceiling fan only circulates hot/stale air. Windows open maximum of 6 inches. Room too small. Debris from previous guest still on floor. Elevator very small. Hotel almost empty but could not grant us a late checkout!!! Offered no receipt upon checkout. Will never go back.

review.title: Great deal, good location, very San Francisco-y
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Mark Twain. It was a beautiful boutique hotel with a lot of character and in a good location. The service was pretty good, and the hotel seemed to attract a young, international crowd. However, there seemed to be very little soundproofing and tended to be noisy late at night due to the younger clientele and even noisier in the morning due to the cleaning staff. I would suggest earplugs, but still thought this was a wonderful place to stay.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: Some of the nearby neighborhood is funky (Tenderloin district, panhandlers and massage parlors), but the hotel itself was fine. (I would have liked to see better equipment in the exercise room, but that's a minor quibble.) Staff were helpful and friendly, room service was regular, and my room had a surprisingly large walk-in closet.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: you can hear your nieghbors talking, showering, bathroom use anytime you or your nieghbor use the plumbing you can hear the flow of water running uncomfortable bed matteress and pillows no window views

review.title: Affordable & Nice
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and even went out of their way to give my family and I directions to all the tourist sites. We only stayed there one night but I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay there longer. The only flaw was parking wich we paid $30 for (24 hour parking total). The truth is however that when you're in San Francisco parking will cost you that much anyway.

review.title: Very Convenient Hotel!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mark Twain. It was very close to a major muni and Bart center, making travel through out the city very easy. The room was very clean, but the bathroom was tiny. All the accommodations were brand new (tv, bedding, furniture, etc.). Restaurants, parking decks, and major shopping venues are within a few blocks walking distance. All the staff in the hotel were more than helpful. Our radiator/heater continually clanged during the evening, which kept us up through out the night.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great location, great price, great service. Note that it's a little noisy. The heater makes a little noise and street noise may be an issue. I didn't care about any of this but I heard other guests complaining. Still, I go back on a regular basis - four times already this year.

review.title: will stay again good business hotel
review.reviewText: location good small but comfortable good for business

review.title: just right
review.reviewText: If you want a pleasant, clean, adequately appointed place to sleep, The Hotel Mark Twain fits the bill.The Hyatt across the street makes for a little late night noise but the location is great and if your looking for a nice place to sleep after being out all day it's a great value!

review.title: It is a good choice
review.reviewText: It ís a great hotel.

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel is walking distance from Union square and all the famous shops in San Francisco. The lobby is probably the most beautiful thing you will see in the hotel.room was clean,a nice LCD tv is there and a wireless is available(not included in room rate). The bathroom is really small,it was quite difficult close the door while you are in;and the night was quite noise due to the guests from the adjacent room. But overall it's a good quality/price compromise

review.title: Great relaxing plce for the price!
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean, staff was very nice, the price was very inexpensive and the location was close to the events (and Union Square). Yes, city noise, and you have to watch out for the bums but this is SF and that is what to be expected... The good with the bad. I will stay there again. We took BART in and it was just up the street.

review.title: Would Stay Again!!!!!
review.reviewText: Had a very nice stay here!!!! Everyone was very helpful and the size of the room was bigger that I thought we were going to get in San Fransico. Would stay here again, and will tell all my friends!!!

review.title: Very disapointed
review.reviewText: 2 days elevator was out of order, cafe close at morning hours.

review.title: Good hotel-bargain
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located and is a very good bargain. There was a bit of noise from an adjacent room facing the courtyard but overall a good deal with nice rooms.

review.title: Worked for us
review.reviewText: Older style hotel, but clean and comfortable. Helpful, cheerful staff.

review.title: Ehhh
review.reviewText: The hotel was a good place to stay if your unfamiliar with the city because it is easy to find. The room was just a place to sleep in between site seeing trips. The bed wasn't the most comfortable one I've ever slept one, but the sheet were clean. The bathrooms were tiny with the largest space given to the shower/bath. There was barely enough room for the door to shut for the toilet and the sink was as big as a water fountain in a park. I've stayed in worse hotels that were more expensive. Plenty of food places within walking distance. We went to a great pizza place just up the street. No parking, only valet which was kind of expensive.

review.title: Rick's Mark Twain Hotel Review
review.reviewText: This place was pretty cool. It's not your run of the mill chain hotel or high end boutique hotel. It's close to Union square. BART and Muni are easily accessible for navigating the city. The restaurant has some good food. The bartenders are knowledgeable about drinks, food and the city, hit them up for info on the, out of the way, non-tourist places to go. The hotel has got character. One drawback, the elevator is small, but at least it's slow, okay two drawbacks. Overall, I would stay here again, check Expedia prior to booking, it had better pricing than the hotel website.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: clean and spacious room with a fridge. Our room was on the main street and it was quite noisy at night but, otherwise it was very good

review.title: Short and Quick in SF
review.reviewText: Overall I was pretty happy with the hotel, the gym could use an upgrade as I felt buried in some desolate basement, my room faced the street so it was a little loud but didnt bother me too much as I was out doing business dinners etc at night so when I got back to the room I was pretty much exhausted, I tried to stay an extra day and my rate went up about 250%, I think i just received a pretty good rate up front but I was a little discouraged as I had to move to anohter hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel in a bad part of town
review.reviewText: No AC in the rooms, very noisy and a terrible part of town. Hotel staff was great and it would be a nice hotel if it were in a different area.

review.title: Good value for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, small, and in a terrible location, but a good value for the money. Walking to Market Street, I was able to smell urine on the street all around the hotel. At night, there were some characters of ill-repute standing on all of the surrounding street corners. Overall, when I was in the hotel, I felt safe and secure. Also, there was no view out of any window in my room, and I stayed near the top floor. The elevator was incredibly slow, and one evening I walked up because I was tired of waiting. The restaurant was pricey, but the food was EXCELLENT!

review.title: Cute and cuddly
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was close to everything we wanted to go to. Parking was hard, but they valet. We frequently came and went all day and valeted every time with no hassle. Hotel heating system makes weird noise, but the hotel offers a small heater or electric blanket if you want your room to be completely silent. Great place!

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was just what I was looking for! It was the selling factor for me. I would absolutely stay here again. Three blocks away is the Powell and Market St. intersection. You have the BART, which is the train you catch to & from the airport, and it is where you board the Trolley Cars. It is also in close proximity to Bloomingdales, Westfield Centre, and all high end stores. Service. 1) I called the hotel in advance to ask how much an airport shuttle would cost me, their quote was off by $5. 2) I had to call down to the front desk to ask them to activate my phone so I could make outside calls. Should have been done at check-in. 3) An information sheet explaining hotel services and costs (internet costs were my only concern) was out of date. Not a big deal,but come on. They did provide tourist maps and booklets, and those proved to be very helpful in planning out my days and routes. The Room. Bed and pillows were comfortable. I booked a single Queen, got two doubles. I did not complain. Linens were nice and the room was clean. I did not find the room to be too small, but I was a single traveller, this may have been the difference. The water pressure in the shower was good! but the in-bathroom hair dryer was on its last legs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and wants to uses the money on shopping & entertainment instead of lodging.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: the hotel lobby is cute and quirky. but it's an old building and needs to be upgraded. the elevator is small and slow. the rooms need a coat of paint and ndew bedding. the bathroom is ridiculously small. but its affordable, downtown and has the basics for a short stay.

review.title: satisfactory
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small. The bed was comfortable enough. Sometimes there isn't hot water for the shower which is my biggest complaint. The hotel is in the downtown, Tenderloin area which is inundated with homeless people hustling you for money so this might not be a great hotel if you have kids.

review.title: Base of operations
review.reviewText: Decent accommodation located at the fringe of down town. Easy to climb unnecessary hills or get cornered with the "will you help" street dwellers. 24 hour check in / out effortless and ATM / activities pamphlets available in lobby. Rooms reasonable and include coffee making facilities / iron, though heating is a single small radiator and I could see through the shower room vent to the neighbouring shower. A reasonably priced base of operations.

review.title: One slight problem, fixed quickly
review.reviewText: The location is great; neat all shopping, resturants, cable car, and the BART system (underground subway). We had one slight problem when the boiler went out, but the front desk quickly brought a portable heater, which met our needs. As the hotel is older, you may wish to request a back room, as the room near the street allows the street noises to be heard.

review.title: Worth the price!
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 stayed for the Thanksgiving weekend. If you are on a budget, its great! The rooms are small, but clean...who stays in the room anyway? On the edge of the Tenderloin district, but just a block or 2 from Union Square, the cable cars and the F-line to the wharf. Valet parked the car in the garage and only used it once to venture out toward the bridge and Golden Gate park. This small hotel is clean and priced right. Highly recommend for those who want to spend their money on eating & shopping!!

review.title: Quite impressed!
review.reviewText: Great location, wonderful service, bathroom is quite small for average americans, but it was clean and well designed for short term stay.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Hotel is a good value. Only issue was that the bathroom was a little small. It borders a less than ideal area of the city, but otherwise the location is great. It is walking distance to the BART Powell station, so that saved us on rental car/taxi costs.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: A great hotel. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

review.title: Great place to get away
review.reviewText: This is what i look for in a Hotel a nice little out of the way place that is well maintained and clean. Ths staff were freindly and i hard a great stay.

review.title: Room was fine.
review.reviewText: The room was fine but I didn't like the location. If you turned left out of the hotel it was fine. But, go right and the area was horrible. Lot's of homeless, not a desirable area. Friendly staff. The Taylor Street Cafe next door had wonderful breakfasts.

review.title: Two-star
review.reviewText: Well-located. Wireless internet was difficult to configure, etc. despite hefty daily surcharge.

review.title: Centrally located, intimate place to stay within budget
review.reviewText: Hotel Mark Twain is centrally located within the Union Square district. A few blocks stroll will take you to the main square. It can be a little bit seedy late at night due to its close proximity to the flat iron district, but I never felt unsafe. Check-in and front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The tiny little elevator can be a bit frustrating. It can hold 2 adults with luggage comfortably. Our two double bed room was small but adequate. The bathroom was also miniature in size but adequate. The water temperature in the shower got spotty at times. It would never stay at a constant temperature, and I ended up taking a cold shower twice. The beds were comfortable and housekeeping did a great job with the room everyday. If you're looking for a comfortable place to stay, especially if you do not have a car, this hotel is great. It's fairly inexpensive, and a lot of places are within walking distance. The BART and cable car are both within walking distance also.

review.title: Good hotel for a resonable price
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the Mark Twain Hotel. On the edge (but far enough away) from the Tenderloin district of San Francisco, I was weary that it was not going to be safe, but had no issues once I arrived! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and rooms comfortable. There was only 1 elevator which was a little small, but the stairs were always an option!

review.title: Centrally located in Tenderloin District
review.reviewText: Hotel is a few blocks from Union Square. Smaller room, but big enough - I wasn't there to live in it. Staff very friendly and helpful. Excellent restaurant in hotel. The Tenderloin District used to be rough, but the area is becoming safer, never felt threatened (even at 3 in the morning).

review.title: Should not be 3 stars
review.reviewText: Did not have the room I reserved, so they down graded me and was not willing to adjust the price. Changed rooms the second night. Was not impressed with either room. Not sure why this hotel has 3 stars.

review.title: Nice overall hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel had very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Service was good as well. It's only problems stem from the old building it is in: no light bulbs in the closet and unreliable hot water. It was nice as it could be without gutting the building. I would stay again, however, and would recommend to friends.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel with nice rooms. Staff were all pleasant and willing to help in any way. Just a few blocks from one of San Francisco's best shopping areas.

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: location of the hotel is great, but the room is toooo small. Service is good.

review.title: Affordable place
review.reviewText: The place doesn't look very impressive, rooms are small (shower is EXTREMELY tiny), but it's located at the downtown and price is affordable. If you are not spoiled, it's a good option.

review.title: Quite Good
review.reviewText: A good and cheap hotel

review.title: Get Location for Downtown Stay
review.reviewText: This was a great Hotel for the price and location. The rooms are small but very nice and I would stay there again. Also the staff was very friendly and helpful with all of our needs.

review.title: Great value in great location
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful and with a few more upgrades, this boutique hotel would be nearly perfect. The low rates and great location make the hint of mustiness and slightly worn carpeting quite tolerable.

review.title: Stayed in the Billy Holiday Room
review.reviewText: Great view of Taylor Street. Across from the Major places to stay and very convenient to Nob hil and convention areal. If you drive a bit of sticker shock for valet service. Someone is getting rich.

review.title: Good Location, bad service.
review.reviewText: great location. Very old and small rooms. Customer service very rude

review.title: Mark Twan & Lady Day Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain is a great find and better location in the center of everything. We were surprised that Billie Holiday (Lady Day) was featured and had a special suite. We just returned from the 50th Monterey Jazz Festival and the spirit of the art of jazz was there in the hotel. The room was neat and comfortable, and the lask of air conditioning was not a problem. The staff provided additional towels upon request and delivered to our room with a simaple phone call to the front desk. The cost of the valet parking was unexpected, however, a drop-off was easy and a call to the desk had our van waiting when we arrived in the lobby. Three thumbs up! ;-)

review.title: Service is Poor
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is quaint and rooms are comfortable but the service was lousy. Our group made very few requests, such as calling a cab for a in specific time or having the valet bring the car out at a spcific time, they would not carry out requests until party was in the lobby. The convention that was in town caused a 20 minute delay in cabs. Needless to say I called a cab myself and kept his business card and repeatedly used his service. He was always on time and never gave us a hassle. He would be an excellent concierge or receptionist at this hotel.

review.title: Had to Switch Hotels
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a very bad part of San Francisco with very seedy characters hanign around. The room was so dirty and out dated. THere was acutally a hole in the shower wall that you could see into the other room. YIKES!

review.title: Great value for location
review.reviewText: A very nice and comfortable hotel right in the heart of downtown that has very reasonable rates. Unless I had a giant expense account I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

review.title: cute rooms but too small
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is nice - nothing to rave about. It's definitely a historic hotel with a recent face lift. The rooms are VERY small - but quaint. The bathroom was EXTRA small, but clean. Overall, it was okay for the price and you're right in downtown SF, so if you're looking for convenience and an affordable stay, it's a good find.

review.title: Pleasant and well located
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain is a bit threadbare, the walls are thin, the water pressure low, and there's no air conditioning. There's one tiny elevator and absolutely no frills. But the staff are sweet, the location comfortably close to where I needed to be, and the price was terrific. So for a place to sleep, it worked just fine.

review.title: Nice place, but too many problems.
review.reviewText: I stayed in a deluxe room, and it was nice, and clean, though on the small side. The problems were that the Wireless internet access was very spotty, the TV (which only gets about 9 channels) kept automatically switching the channel back to the promo channel, and most importantly, there is NO A/C in this hotel. So if you are like me, and want a cool room in which to sleep, you will have to choose between opening the window and living with the sounds of the city (including the Fire station a couple blocks away - they use their sirens at ALL hours), or being in a stuffy room. This was a real problem for me. I travel to S.F. on business frequently, and while I could see how others could enjoy a stay here, this hotel is now at the bottom of my list of desirable places to stay.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient to public transportation and Union Square. Interesting neighborhood with Glide Memorial literally next door but felt safe.

review.title: Fine for a short stay
review.reviewText: The exterior and lobby looked very nice, but once upstairs, it looked like just another old hotel with small rooms. Which was fine for me at the time, because I only needed to stay for one night. The room was kept in decent shape, though.

review.title: I'd choose it again !
review.reviewText: Top Service ! Very very professional in all situations. There is a GREAT breakfast restaurant beside the hotel !

review.title: One of the best inexpensive high quality hotels near Union Square in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Excellent place for an overnight, short stay when running into the city for an evening event. Close to Union Square and Market for excellent shopping, and within walking distance of the Theater district.

review.title: Great location for a great price
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean, staff was extremely helpful. Our first night our hotel room faced the street and it was really loud and didn't sleep much, so ask for a room in the interior it will keep the noise down. The rooms are charming, and most of them have a mini frig which come in handy. It's in a great location, two blocks from Union Square. Overall, I'd stay here again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was not very helpful. They did not have updated information of the tourist attractions in San Francisco. The front desk person could not answer any of our questions and did not put in the effort to help find answers to our questions. I was not satisfied with my stay at this hotel.

review.title: cozy, but clean and good price
review.reviewText: not a luxury hotel by any stretch of the imagination, but we found it clean and adequate. right in downtown san fran and only a few blocks from union square and cable cars. about a 30min ride to fishermans wharf.

review.title: Not Satisfactory
review.reviewText: I do not recommend this hotel if travelling to San Fransisco. On check in was told all the unsafe areas arrond the hotel to avoid - only a block away. No aircon in room, which although clean was stuffy. Toilet was not secured to floor and wobbled on it base when my 4 yr old "climbed" on. Not sufficient towels for 4 guests and after rquest additional towles only arived at 9:45 pm. No food service and felt unsafe taking kids out at night in immediate facinity. On checkout elevators did not work (being serviced and had to walk with bags down 6 floors.

review.title: Quaint
review.reviewText: If you like historic porperties, you will like this hotel. Not a lot of bells and whistles but it was quite nice, and very reasonably priced.

review.title: Would recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a good location for touring the city. Found the rooms to be very comfortable and clean. Hotel staff were very helpful too.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: It was difficult to find a hotel in a city where we have never been before and only rely on photo's and the word of others. We picked this hotel for the price, location and the good reviews of the hotel staff. It was a nice place to stay, not big, but we were there to sleep. The location was exactly what we were looking for. The staff was very helpful and kind! Ideal for a single couple or business trip!

review.title: Great base for exploring the city
review.reviewText: If you want to find a good value hotel with a central location, clean simple rooms and friendly staff this is the place.

review.title: Definately will stay here again, if visiting San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Very freindly and helpful staff. Room are charming and cozy. Location is great for shopping, dining, in walking distance.

review.title: Good idea, mediocre execution
review.reviewText: I like so-called "boutique" hotels and the Mark Twain fit the description in terms of size (small) and overall intimacy. However, it was not up to par as far as I'm concerned. It felt run-down even though it had had a recent overhaul, and the furnishings seemed to have come from Grandma's attic. The staff was pleasant but not terribly knowledgeable about the area, and the walls were paper-thin, enabling us to hear people down the hall. It's nicely situated near Union Square, but the neighborhood itself is seedy. The price was right, however, and since we were only staying two nights as part of a longer trip, we didn't mind too much. I would not choose the Mark Twain again, especially if I had a family with me.

review.title: Great location for concert at Warfield
review.reviewText: Okay, it may not be in the best neighborhood, but it is quite convenient for concerts at the Warfield. We only had to walk four blocks to the venue, and when the show was over after midnight, we had dinner at a great 24-hour Indian restaurant a block from the hotel. I have no complaints. I would definitely stay at the Mark Twain again if I attend another concert at the Warfield.

review.title: Bugs in bed
review.reviewText: The hotel service and its location are fine. The only, but major, problem is that the day we were leaving the hotel, a blood sucking bug appeared in the bed. This was a most disgusting situation.

review.title: Long overdue for renovation!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in horrible condition. Paint pealing of the walls in the room, and it is just being re-painted on top over and over. Bathroom lined with grey mold, seeping from under the cheap plastic bathtub insert. Hotel has only 1 tiny elevator, which is being shared among guests and cleaning personnel with huge linen and supply carts. Most guest take the stairs at least on their way down from all (9 if I am not mistaken) floors. The 3-star rating for this hotel is a gross misstatement.

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: For a weekend stay it was ok, I was not impressed with the neighborhood, even though there are high rated quality hotels are accross the street. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Noisiest night ever
review.reviewText: Heard flushing toilets and clanging and shuddering pipes from neighbouring rooms 24/7.

review.title: cheap, spotless, friendly, perfect location
review.reviewText: cheap, spotless, friendly, perfect location

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: It's worth the price you pay for. This hotel is conveniently located near the shopping area. It is clean. Just be aware that one block down is a seedy area. But anyway, the block where it is located, is quite ok. Just make sure you walk up and not down. The only problem we had was with the radiator. It was very close to the bedside.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location. Close to Bart and all the bus route. Staffs were very helpful arranging tours and other things. Cleaning staffs were less than satisfactory.

review.title: Unexperienced staff - Great Old Hotel
review.reviewText: 4 people stayed for 5 nights. The first night the television did not work. The front desk staff told me to "follow directions on the remote. It should be self explanatory." Then when I told him that I had tried everything, he said. "I don't know diddley squat about the TVs in the rooms." An order was placed to fix the tv. We had 4 people, two sets of towels were provided. We had to go pick the extras up. 2nd day - were were moved another floor and for the next three night the hotel/cable ad came on every 10 minutes. After 10pm it came on every 30 seconds. Again, each day we had to ask for extra towels. On the 3rd night, someone (not of our party) used their room card to get in our room. The clerk had coded and rented the room to someone else knowing that it was occupied! The hotel is a beautiful old hotel but it is on the edge of the Tenderloin District and not safe at night, as well as being next to the homeless shelter. There is no parking on the premises and no continental breakfast. Also, the custodial staff did not pay attention to the signs that said to save water and cleanning costs...not to replace towels that were hung. Each day there was a new batch of towels...only 2 sets short. We never saw a manager only 1-2 clerks.

review.title: Convenient, quaint, met my needs
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Small but ample rooms, clean bathroom. Nothing fancy. Frig, coffee pot, TV [no remote]. Close to my large conference in Union Square area. Just a couple blocks from Powell Street BART station. Front desk staff responsive, helpful.

review.title: Good one
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed, clean room, well located, good service, very friendly and helpful staff. Small print: No extractor fan in bathroom, no individual room temperature control, no window in the gym. Certainly consider coming back next time!

review.title: good for the money
review.reviewText: Our stay was pleasant. The room was a nice, aside from the bathroom being a bit small. This is an older hotel, the elavator is very small and the corridors give off that older hotel vibe, but the lobby and rooms are very modern and comfortable. We had no problems with noise or service while staying. I would stay here again, the price is right and the parking fee is decent too!

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: We were very very happy with our hotel...we got to stay in the Billie Holiday room, which was great. The quality of room was quite nice, with great closets. Very clean, though staying on the second floor facing the street was a tad noisy. Other than that, highly recommended.

review.title: reasonable
review.reviewText: Reasonable price in downtown.

review.title: Good location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a conference across the street at the Hilton. The hotel was very nice and well kept. Easy access to many attractions like Union Square, the Cable cars, and downtown.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Great place to stay and will stay there again..No air conditioning but there are ceiling fans.How-ever the only thing if your hungry theres NOTHING close by...Breakfast and lunch at the cafe next door is wonderful..they are only open until 2:00pm

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a boutique hotel about two blocks from union square. It is one of the easiest walks and best location, literally another two blocks to downtown market street. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were decent, you essentially get what you pay for. If you're not a total snob and don't need a lot of ammentities, you're actually going to San Fran to experience it rather than sitting in your hotel room, then this is the perfect place for you.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Had to pay for parking, pillows to small, noisy ice machine, slow elevator.

review.title: Well worth the money
review.reviewText: A small quaint hotel that I would definately stay at again and reccommend to friends. Walking distance to trolley and union square.

review.title: Good value for money. Cheap comfy stay.
review.reviewText: The bathroom was SMALL-couldn't open the door as it hit the toilet. Other than that detail, I was comfortable. Delicious Indian restaurant called "The Sultan" next door, definately try it! Hotel location was perfect-close to Union Square and bus, street cars, cable, etc.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Only bad thing is the TV, not enough channels...

review.title: Friendly, clean and cheap
review.reviewText: We were after a budget place that was clean and welcoming and the Mark Twain was perfect as that. It is not flash and the decor is old but the poeple were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were kept very clean. Just a reminder though if you stay here don't go right out the front door always go left! Right leads into a pretty seedy part of town.

review.title: needs super makeover.
review.reviewText: the room was clean except for the carpet, the radiator made a noise all night and the bed was not comfortable,stayed 3 nights and had the worst sleeps of any hotel,they need to renovate these rooms to keep anything like 3 stars,they charge very high rate for internet,most hotels now offer for free,better and cheaper hotels in same area,lucky to rate as 2 stars.

review.title: Quaint Boutique in the City
review.reviewText: My stay at the Hotel Mark Twain was excellent. It was centrally located near the Powell BART Station. After reading other reviews I was kind of weary about how this hotel would hold up. It was decent & reasonably priced compared to other SF hotels. I had the Billy Holiday room (she had a drug bust in there apparently), and it was clean, small & comfy. They could use a little upgrading, particularly with the carpets. My room also faced the main street & I did hear a lot of noise but it didn't bother me - I slept like a baby. Would I choose this hotel again? Definitely. If you are not to high-maintenance and not planning to spend a lot of your time in your hotel, this is a good deal.

review.title: Decent Hotel, but not perfect
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain was decently close to the convention center where I had to go. However the ammenities provided by the hotel are a bare minimum. The restaurant downstairs does not stay open past 11 and there is no room service. Taylor street is about as far west as you want to go into tenderloin. Being with my gf I walked her home each night so as to be safe.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Good sized rooms, excellent value for the price. Location ideal for Times Square, cable cars, Chinatown etc. Would return to the hotel again, when in SF.

review.title: good condition for over 100 yr old hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly service and clean room. Some spot of the room needs more work.Close to anywhere in downtown.

review.title: Great hotel, questionable neighbors
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain exceeded all our expectations, the staff was incredibly helpful and the room was incedibly clean and cozy. The only potential drawback was the homeless shelter located very nearby.

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: Great hotel with basic and effective service according to the rate. Convienient location for shopping, sightseeing and easy access with the BART-train from the airport.

review.title: Bare bones but gets the job done
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is a solid hotel located close by to lots of attractions in San Francisco. The hotel is pretty bare bones in terms of amenities but the hotel is reasonably priced for the location. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel for price
review.reviewText: Hotel is slightly into a shadier part of town (tenderloin district) but still in walking distance to great shopping and cultural events. Toilet in bathroom had broken bolts and would wobble if leaned on. Hotel staff were very helpfull and curtious. Rooms were kept clean and neat. Windows on the exterior could use a good cleaning more often.

review.title: Good Value. Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Small but clean. Cold weekend in San Francisco and room was cold in late afternoon. Staff said it takes an hour to heat the hotel and heat is not turned on until6:00 PM. Good Union Square location.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: If you ended up renting this hotel, when you walk out of the main enterance, just make a left and continue on...otherwise you'll end up somewhere that you don't want to end up. beds are not comfortabale at all and if you have backpain i wouldn't recommend. Staff were nice, they cleaned the room on time and its located in the heart of the city. all you need to do is to ask the staff which street to not go.

review.title: Total dive
review.reviewText: Any hotel room that requires you to use your foot to flush the toilet is NOT a 3 star hotel. The carpets were disgusting, the radiator (yes radiator) was loud. The hotel lobby was very shabby and becoming low rent in appearance. The hotel has the potential of being quaint but has flipped over to the tacky classification. We checked out the first night. The clerk at the desk didn't seemed surprise and didn't even ask why we were leaving early.

review.title: Adequate for the price I paid
review.reviewText: I got a special on this hotel through a site for *i'm not supposed to say* a night, so for the price, I can't really complain. It was a little inconvenient when the downstairs office told me they didn't have toothbrushes or toothpaste though! I learned from the hotel that I'd rather pay a little extra to stay at hotels that cost a little more.

review.title: Clean, Economy Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, very quaint, tiny elevator, small rooms, very small - no frills- bathroom. The room was clean and staff was friendly. Blankets were thin but the room had a small radiator which heated things up quickly but was a little noisy. The hotel is next to a church and there were quite a few homeless people sleeping and hanging out. They were quiet and they didn't bother us or our two children (ages 8 and 14). The hotel is within walking distance to the Metreon, public transit (Muni, Muni Metro, streetcars) and restaurants. There are many Indian restaurants in the area. The room was perfect for our family (we were looking at cleanliness and affordability) since we didn't spend a lot of time in it, using it just to sleep.

review.title: An acceptable moderate alternative
review.reviewText: Most of the negatives about this hotel have already been noted by other visitors-- the room was quite small, with little space beyond the beds, and the bathroom so tiny that we had to turn sideways to get in around the toilet. That said, the room was clean and tastefully painted and furnished. The location was convenient to Union Square and public transportation, although the homeless shelter next door did contribute to some excessive street noise at night. Overall, the moderate prices and helpfulness of most staff (only one on the grumpy side) would make it worth returning to.

review.title: Mark Twain Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff as the Mark Twain was wonderful and took care of our every need. They were always kind and courtious. There are many places to see and dine within just a few blocks of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. My fiance and I are looking forward to returning there soon.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was very small for three people also it wasn't clean. The place was not good and not safe (a lot of strange people on the street). I don't raccomand this hotel for a family

review.title: Just don't make a right on Taylor Street
review.reviewText: We found that this hotel was very affordable for its location. The room was cozy but the bed could have been a bit more comfortable. The room was always kept up. New televisions and cable would be a nice upgrade to the hotel. Guest services was excellent! They were very helpful and informative regarding city information and directions. The area is alright as long as you do not make a right on Taylor Street. You will meet some "interesting charachters" if you make a right.

review.title: Mark Twain
review.reviewText: Go for it if your looking for no extraordinary vibrations (other then the roaring traffic of Taylor street.) If you wanna sleep, you must have your windows to the yard. Excellent location for downtown activities and good value for the price. I recommend the Breakfast place next door. Valet parking expensive compared to the overall price range.

review.title: Nice place.
review.reviewText: Hotel is on the edge of Union Sq. area. Not the best neighborhood. If you have them park your car be sure and give them plenty of notice when you need it.

review.title: Impressive customer service
review.reviewText: What impressed me the most are the staffs at the front counter. There were extremely busy moments when I had to get help from them, but they were always very polite and treated the customers with full respect with smiles. It sounds trivial, but it's been a long time since I experienced this level of professionalism at a hotel of this cost in the US. The room had everything I'd expect for the cost -- will definitely use the hotel again in the future.

review.title: Affordable but rooms lack comfort
review.reviewText: Small bathroom, old TV, unexciting view, thin walls all add up for discomfort of the room. On the good side, hotel is affordable and has great location. Staff is pretty helpful too.

review.title: Not very accomodating
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is just a block away from the "seedy" part of San Francisco. The ice machines were located in alternate floors, some didn't work and there was no functioning refrigerator in the room. Bed was uncomfortable. A dissapointment for a hotel bearing such a distinctive name. Would not stay there again. Also, breakfast was to be included but they did not due to lack of service at the time.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: We found the Hotel Mark Twain to be a good buy for our money. It provided the standards (but not any luxuries) very affordably for San Francisco. We skipped the $10 continental breakfast.

review.title: nice place, good location
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain is a nice place, with a good location just down the street from macy's. A nice comfortable place for a shopping weekend in the city.

review.title: Mark Twain - not bad at all
review.reviewText: Mark Twain hotel is located nicely -lots of transpotation possibilities. Very helpful and friendly staff. The place was clean... although it wouldn't hurt to have new carpet in the rooms. The restaurant that is connected with the lobby is good if you like Indian food. I would stay at the Mark Twain again.

review.title: A literal hole in the wall
review.reviewText: Weird vent in the shower enabled me to see into the adjacent room. Definitely not 3stars...

review.title: Great location for price
review.reviewText: Great location. Good customer service. Good price.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient place to stay
review.reviewText: The beds were so comfortable it was hard to wake up! I would NOT recommend walking west of the hotel as you'll end up in a sketchy part of town. The Indian restuarant downstairs was great, too.

review.title: Simple but Sweet
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back. The accomodations are relatively "no frill" i.s, no cable, no cost-included breakfast, but the little coffee shop right next door is wonderful and very reasonable. Hotel staff couldn't have been more courteous, friendly or helpful. We were just a little over 2 very walkable blocks from Union Square and the BART station. In short, Hotel Mark Twain is quaint with old scool charm and simplicity.

review.title: If we'd have only read the reviews!
review.reviewText: Thankfully the homeless man guiding us to the hotel warned us away from the wonderful sights of the Tenderloin - out of the hotel don't turn right (and that's what the hotel staff told us!) Rooms were a a good size but noisy and tired looking. The staff were more than friendly and Union Square, the shops and Market Street station were not far away.

review.title: Great for Budget Travelers
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay. The parking was not great at all. You definitely have to pay for parking if you rented or brought a car. The area is great for shopping. Would not recommend the hotel for 4 star people. The rooms were to small and the bathroom even smaller. But, if you are on a budget and want to hit the sites in SF, this hotel is definitely the route. Overall score for this hotel, 2.5.

review.title: Good enough to stay a week
review.reviewText: The hotel was good. Although I should point out that the appearance of this hotel was not impressive. Everything was fine. Room was ready on time, staff members were nice and kind. Since I never had breakfast in this hotel I'm not sure about meal searvice, but everything was good enough for me to stay almost a week.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean but older and well worn. But for $100 a night, you won't find anything nicer in San Francisco.

review.title: No Frills, but Fine for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was inexpensive and we took a chance. The desk personnel and maids were friendly and helpful. The room was small & clean, though the carpet was obviously worn. The other reviews mention noise from the street in rooms nearest the street; this is definately true. The hotel is just on the edge of an area that I would not feel safe walking alone in, but as long as you exit the hotel and walk up the hill (north), it was fine. GREAT place for breakfast just next door. The room was just right for our needs: inexpensive, clean, in a convenient area, safe. We were out all day and it was a place to sleep. I would stay again.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is perfect, in the heart of San Francisco. Its clean and neat, I wish that the bath room was bigger, its really small, but clean.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: excellent location and very affordable

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: This hotel is within walking distance to all public transportation,the nieghborhood isn't great, but we took one patrons advice and always turned left when leaving the hotel.We also took our own travel fan for setting in front of the open window for fresh air,and brought a hairdryer. Keep in mind that it's an old hotel, but the rooms were always clean and we recieved clean towels whether we asked for them or not

review.title: This is not a 2 or 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: Stained carpet, nasty bed covers, walls were dingy and needed paint. The toilet had been broken and didn't sit level on the floor. I think this hotel had been rated at 2 or three stars, I have no idea how.

review.title: Good Value for SF, but not a luxury hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain was a decent hotel for the price and location, I guess. There is a Hilton directly across the street, which I can only assume is much more expensive. The rooms are very, very small, but served our purpose. The staff was friendly, but not all that knowledgeable about things to do around the city.

review.title: A decent place to stay at a good price
review.reviewText: The Hotel Mark Twain is a clean, decent hotel. Our room was good sized and not cramped. Ameneties are limited to a TV and phone--don't expect a hair dryer.
