The room was clean and the hotel well maintained. It is on the edge of the Tenderloin, so to get there we usually encountered some homeless people, but nobody gave us any trouble. And there is an excellent breakfast restaurant right next door.

review.title: Do not stay here
review.reviewText: I don't care how cheap it is, don't do it, you'll regret it. The hotel staff is rude. There's mold in the shower. The elevator fits maybe 3 people. We used the stairs to get to our 2nd and 4th floor rooms. They said the room are preselected, so they couldn't put my friends and I on the same floor. I could hear the people in the next room going to the bathroom, blowing their nose, etc. Bathroom is very small. The 'bar' downstairs is never open. It's not even a bar, it's a counter with stools. Location is ok, but it's a very shady area all around. If you like modern ammeties at all, do not stay here.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I paid ahead and was disappointed in the hotel. I was surprised it got a 3-star rating without AC. The room was small with a tiny TV. It seemed dated and was not very sound proof. There was a surprise $30 per day parking charge. I found Taylor St. scary. There are many homeless in the area and someone has a hand out on every corner. A few folks wouldn't take no for an answer. If I'm ever in SF again, I'll stay on the Golden Gate Bridge side of town.

review.title: Good situation
review.reviewText: Hotel has a good situation (near Union square) and rooms are comfortable and clean. You can directly see San Francisco center and go along the cable car streets. bad point : The bar of the hotel is not really convenient and always empty (even without a waiter) due to the restaurant that is part of the hotel.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: we prepaid for this hotel, yet were punished for not having a credit card, we were made pay alot of dollars as a deposit and had to plead to keep the phone, this was ridiculous treatment and they need to understand not everybody has a credit card, an unclean and old feel about the place, dont stay and the area is not pretty or safe

review.title: Very good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Mark Twain is a great hotel, specially for the price. Rooms are clean, staff is competent and helpful, and the breakfeast (served next door) is amazing! Rooms are quite small, specially the restroom, but who cares, I didn't go to San Francisco to waste time inside the room. There's a safe in every room (the safe usage is included in the room fare) where you can fit a Powerbook 15'' (usefull if you go to a conference like Apple WWDC or something, and you want to leave the computer in a safe place while visiting the town in the free time. Not sure if the 17'' fits. The neighbourghood may be a bit unplesant at night, but it's not too bad. Mark twain is great value for money in SF.

review.title: Good service but very noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice. The rooms are clean and quite ok. But I've got a room facing the main street and it was quite noisy all the time.

review.title: Not good value.
review.reviewText: For the rating of the hotel it is overpriced in comparison to others. Small bathroom,and room that are outdated with an elevator that is tiny and out of the ark.

review.title: hard to beat given the rate and location
review.reviewText: Checked in after 3pm and the room assigned was not cleaned, so they immediately found us another room. The room was on Taylor accross from the Hilton group tour bus parking. The buses idle their engines all day and late into the evening so if you are sensitive to continous relatively loud street noise you want to look somewhere else. The staff was very helpful. Rooms and bathrooms are small but our bed was comfortable and access to shopping and restuarants is very convenient. We would stay here again if a rate driven trip.

review.title: Rooms facing street unbearably noisy
review.reviewText: The staff was suberb; friendly and professional. In fact everything was great except that my room facing the street was unbearably noisy from street traffic that lasted late into the night. Certainly there is something that the hotel could do about this. I would recommend staying here if you could guarantee that you would not get one of these rooms.

review.title: Really nice hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: In the downtown, near everything, nice service and helpfull people there. definitely recommend it!

review.title: Good value, great location
review.reviewText: Great place to go if you're looking for a home-base to use for San Francisco.

review.title: Ok, but...
review.reviewText: Room rate was good, but I was disappointed that there was no central air or heat.

review.title: A well-located and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We wanted a hotel close to Union Square and the cable car. We chose the Hotel Mark Twain and were pleased with it. We found the front desk staff and the room service staff to be helpful and friendly. We'd certainly stay there again.

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is not bad, although the rooms, especially the bathrooms are quite small. It is one block too far into a seedy area for walking toward Market Steet to be a comfortable experience anytime of the day or night, but if you go the other direction and loop around and down to Powell to get back to Market, you can avoid the worst of it and walk in a nice area. It's a decent place to stay at a good price, but you are getting the good price for a reason.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel overall, was very nice. Rooms were clean and kept clean efficiently every day. The staff was helpful and friendly. Walking distance to great shopping and many attractions. One surprise was no air conditioning, but was there through extremely hot weather and the room didn't overheat.

review.title: Had a pleasant stay!!!
review.reviewText: Overall good comfort and rates. Was centrally located to all public transportation.

review.title: Worth for its value
review.reviewText: - there is no aircondition, but is on downtown San Francisco. Near Union Square.

review.title: No reason to stay anywhere else
review.reviewText: no frills; you get what you need. Very clean room, friendly staff, wireless connection, gym, great restaurant right next door! Cheap! It was perfect for what I was looking for. Clean, cheap and good location. :)

review.title: Great hotel at a great price!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was super and most helpful. The central location was great. But, the bottom line was the great price for a very nice and comfortable room. I most enjoyed the fact that the windows could be opened to let in the fresh air!

review.title: Missed Expectations
review.reviewText: The hotel looks nice in the lobby and is in a great location. The room levels and the rooms themselves are dated with old carpets, comforters and aged paint. The ventilation system consists of radient heat and a window. Their are no ventilation controls in the rooms. Can figure out how a hotel received 3 stars without adequate ventilation????

review.title: Everything you need
review.reviewText: Hotel Mark Twain might be small, or might be in a noisy spot of the city, but it sure has everything you might need. If you are planning on spending your days in San Francisco sight seeing, or traveling througout the city, and your hotel consists only on a place you get to sleep and rest from the tiresome walks, this hotel is just for you! Enjoy!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Small but friendly hotel with-in walking distance to Bart.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The only things that I was disappointed with the hotel was that I asked specifically for a smoking room and did not get that. Also, the elevator is pretty small and may need to wait for it several times if it's real busy. Otherwise, I think that it's maintained well, but the rooms are a little small, not much room to walk.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: I would have to classify this hotel as just adequate, a few frills accommodation with dated decor. It was clean, but the non-smoking room had numerous cigarette burns in the carpet. Thankfully, the room did not smell of cigarette smoke. The only real luxuries were a small refrigerator and an iron (without ironing board). I'm assuming I could have obtained an ironing board if I had needed and asked for one. The staff were generally courteous, friendly and helpful. I would not rank this hotel as a special place to go, but rather as an adequate place to stay on a business trip.

review.title: Good Location. Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Hard beds. Old hotel. Can hear the plumbing through the walls. Great location in Downtown SF though. Close access to BART, MUNI, and cable cards.

review.title: Nice services. Room is clean
review.reviewText: Reasonable price. Hotel is close to Union Square, Chinatown, and cable car.

review.title: Nice hotel near in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Close to Market St, Powell St, Geary St, Moscone Center.

review.title: Opulent Luxury
review.reviewText: For those traveling on a budget, the Mark Twain is a vintage example of opulent luxury. Ok, it's not exactly opulent--but is certainly a good bang for the buck in SF.

review.title: Great for experiencing downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Mark Twain hotel made our San Francisco experience a treat! The location allowed for easy traveling to and from the airport and downtown walking. We walked to the Golden Gate park and down to the Fisherman's Warf from the Mark Twain. Bring comfortable shoes!! The neighborhood West of the hotel was shady, but we were never intimidated or fearful during the day. I would recommend staying clear after dark, but tell me a metropolitan city that doesn't have those aspects. There are homeless people panhandling all over for coins. Just a reality of living in our Capitalist society I guess. We will choose to stay at the Mark Twain hotel when we stay in San Francisco again.

review.title: ok place to stay at
review.reviewText: the hotel was ok for the price. the only thing bad is that it doesn't have parking. you have to pay extra for that. so you might stay at a hotel that includes parking for the price your paying. and there was to many homeless people hanging around. not a good sign when your pulling up.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: Cheaper rate is a good thing of this hotel

review.title: good budget hotel
review.reviewText: This is an OK budget hotel for San Francisco. It is clean, close to Union Square, and the people are nice. If you are looking for just the basic and nothing to fancy, this is a good place to stay.

review.title: Too noisy
review.reviewText: Traffic on the street all night long making it so noisy that you can hardly get any sleep.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The room and hotel were clean and efficient. Not particularly luxurious, but close to everything.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I was VERY disappointed in the quality and cleanliness of the hotel-relative to what I was expecting a 3 star hotel on Expedia to be like. I had never booked a hotel on expedia, assumed I was getting good information, and was disappointed. I would categorize this hotel as a 1 or maybe 2 star hotel, certainly not a 3 star. The front desk staff were very pleasant, but I would not recommend this hotel. It was inexpensive.

review.title: not bad for its price
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great; it's very close to the Powell BART station and the Powell Cable car line. There are lots of restaurants and convenient stores in the neighborhood. The cleaning service was great. The bedroom and the bathroom were both spacious enough to feel comfortable. The staff was very friendly and efficient. What I didn't like was the noise made by the steam based heater and the fridge in my room. I couldn't sleep well the first night and had to buy ear plugs to rest better the following nights. The fridge frequently went on a cooling cycle, at the end of which it rattled and shook the wooden closet where it was placed. This made quite a bit of noise, and it sounded like someone outside my room knocking on the door - not pleasant at night. While in bed I could also hear the fridge rattle in the room adjacent to mine, so the noise problem is probably true to all rooms. This hotel is not ideal for people sensitive to noise. Otherwise, it's quite good.

review.title: Great choice!!
review.reviewText: This was a very comfortable hotel. The walk from the Moscone Center stayed on well-lit streets. I didn't feel unsafe (which I have at other hotels in the area). The mini-fridge was also a huge plus for me. They get few TV stations, but as I'm not a big TV fan, that didn't bother me. My only disappointment was that they charge a fee for the wireless internet access.

review.title: Not Bad For the Price
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location for Union Square. They do need to remodel to keep up with the times and near by hotels. Such as adding air conditioning and new carpeting.

review.title: Older hotel with good functionality
review.reviewText: Desk personnel were very helpful and friendly, Rooms as expected for the age of the hotel but very clean and comfortable. Locale for amenities is excellent. Good in house Indian Restaurant. Fabulous Breakfast place next door, and Internet Cafe up the street. Close to theaters. Would come back again. Please note-My criteria for hotel is providing a basic room and good convenient location to other venues.

review.title: Not Bad for the Dosh
review.reviewText: We have just come back from the bay area. we stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The first impressions were not great visually. The staff were great and helpful. The room was exceptionaly clean. Yes the furnishings were in the autum of there years but for the price and location we were more than happy. The location is fab Leave the car aT HOME. They have a great Public Transport

review.title: Bad Neighborhood
review.reviewText: Most of the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. We left early because of the location and the homeless folks all around. The room was even smaller than I expected and in need of repair(walls,carpets,etc.)The walls are thin...dont flush!

review.title: great for the travler on a budget!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and ammenites for the price paid!!! Would not have expected anything more than what we got!! Great hotel for the discount traveler. Also great location to transit!!! thats the most important thing for us.

review.title: Quick rundown of our experience....
review.reviewText: Room was small and not clean. Bathroom was dirty and floors thru out room needed a good cleaning. Sheets did not fit the bed (short sheets). The walls are paper thin so be wary when feeling "frisky". I "took a shower" with a French couple. The walls are so thin I felt like if I turned around I would rub elbows with them! (Good thing, hmmm or bad, I don't speak French!) At 2am each morning we were awakened to a lot of party noise in the alley below which lasted until 4am. No air conditioning so it was a necessity to have the windows open a little. Even closed, we could not escape the noise below and in the hallways. We didn't spend much time in our room so these things are just part of the vacation adventure to us. The location was ok I suppose depending on where you want to hang out. We spent most of our time at the Wharf so I will stay there next trip. We had a great visit tho. Enjoy SF!!

review.title: What room were you in? What bad experience!
review.reviewText: I'm not sure where some of the people stayed that wrote some of the previous comments. Our room was clean, comfortable, well taken care of and what we expected for a 21/2 to 3 star hotel. There was no mold, spider webs or excessive noise. As for the homeless, they're in any city. Have you ever been to New York? The front desk staff was kind, courteous and helpful. They sent us to some the best restaurants that we have been to in several years. We would not hesitate to return there in the future and would recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: staff very helpful

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Clean and hotel localization perfect

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, courteous staff. Excellent value for the money.

review.title: Best hotel in the areas for your money
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were great. Excellent location (near Union Square) You get what you paid for but the hotel is nice but not fancy so if you don't mind that this is the hotel for you.

review.title: Great price and Great Location
review.reviewText: Not the best hotel but perfect for someone on the go. Right in the middle of Union square and Market Square and it's so asy to get around with a BART Station down the street.So if you like to stay in your room the whole trip this is not the hotel for you but if you just need a place to crash this is perfect.

review.title: Good value for price
review.reviewText: The hotel may be old but the room was very clean and comfortable. It's perfect for GG Theatre and Warfield theatre concerts.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I found the hotel room stark and in need of repairs. The carpet had major stains on it and the bathroom had mold all over the ceiling.

review.title: Convenient and Cheap
review.reviewText: If you can get this hotel at a good price, it is very convenient to Union Square. Paid parking is across the street. Basic, but safe and clean.

review.title: Great Location, Affordable Stay in Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: Would Definitely Go Back!! Maybe Soon if I don't move there first!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Noisy, particularly on lower floors in the evening. Exterior noise included nearby bar patrons involved in an altercation.

review.title: ok but not all what I expected
review.reviewText: coffee maker and iron didn't work, room was too hot had to keep window open, bathroom way too small. But front desk staff was extremely helpful and courteous.

review.title: great price, great location, but bring ear plugs old hotel thin walls
review.reviewText: great price, great location, but bring ear plugs old hotel thin walls

review.title: Hotel Mark Twain Union Square
review.reviewText: We chose the Executive Mark Twain Union Square Hotel simply by looking on expedia.com, and booked it sight unseen.  We loved it, it turned out to be a GREAT location, very reasonably priced, and very comfortable accomodations.  For a quick weekend trip, definitely a good place to stay in the city.

review.title: Great location, service, value.  Rooms just ok.
review.reviewText:
What was most important to me was price and location. I wanted to be near Union Square at a low cost, and I was willing to trade off room & amenity quality. Thus, the Mark Twain fit the bill. It's not a 4 or 5 star hotel that's going to wow you with decor; rather, it sacrifices some ambience for value.

The service was fantastic. The staff was courteous, friendly, informative, and helpful. 

The location was great in the sense that it was just a few blocks from Union Square, the trolley, and Market St. But since I had a street facing window, it was a bit loud, and the neighborhood to the north and west of the hotel weren't so pretty. Nevertheless, I felt safe. 

Rooms were pedestrian and a bit outdated, particularly the bathroom. However, everything was clean and tidy. For the price I paid, I was not disappointed. After all, I spent little time in the room when not sleeping, and all hotel rooms look alike when you're asleep.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was extremely courteous and very helpful with any question we had. Another great factor was that it was located within walking distance to restaurants, buses, cable cars, etc. The classic character of the hotel was another plus....it takes you back in time. We loved it!

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: this is a nice location for those who want to be smack dab in downtown. about 5 to 10 mins walking distance to cheecefactory/macys. about 10-15 mins walking distance to market street. freeways are near by. reasonably priced for a 3 star hotel in downtown sf/ union square. rooms are cozy and quaint. thumbs up!

review.title: Excellent location - friendly and efficient staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is still the same even it's not a Ramada anymore. Good value for your money!

review.title: Good low price stay for SF
review.reviewText: I had a room on the street, and it was a bit noisy due to the hotel strike at Hilton across the street.  Otherwise fine.  There is no a/c so hot summert (rare in SF) might be bad.  Room was small, but fine for sightseeing stay.  Nice coffee shop type restaurant.  Easy walk to all SF sites and public transport.  Other review described dirty room - mine was very clean and prepared well.
